loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is a 24-year-old married man living in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. He and his wife struggle to earn a living by growing rice. He also works as a policeman to supplement income.

This is Channa's second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and he fully repaid his past loan. In a group of two, he is the group leader. He will spend his loan portion to buy rice seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers and to plow the rice farm. He hopes that he can earn more income to renovate a house to be as good as others.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers and to plow the rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sugarcane to support her juice-selling business.

loans.name: Kimnai's Group

texts.en:
A 30-year-old farmer living in Bovel district of Battambang province, Kimnai is a widow with four children, three of whom are still in school. She grows rice on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income. To supplement her income, she sells noodles.

This is Kimnai's seventh time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of two members seeking a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizers and to plow the farmland to grow rice. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to plow the farmland to grow rice.

loans.name: Eang's Group

texts.en:
Eang is 33 years old and a married mother of three children who are all dependent children; two of them are in school while the other one is too young to go to school. Now she lives with her family in a rural area located in Mongkul Borey, district of Banteay Meanchey province. Raising chickens and working for other farmers have been the sources of her family’s income for thirteen years. She could earn around 66,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

Eang’s group consists of two members, and this is the fourth loan for her with VisionFund. The previous loans have helped her to have the ability to send her children to school. As the group leader, she decided to take this new loan. She is planning to use her portion to buy food for feeding chickens to support her current business. She hopes that she could earn more income and create a new business in the future.

loans.use: to buy food for feeding chickens

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath is a 50-year-old woman with  five children who lives in Battambang province.  She supports  three children, one attends school and other two are too young. She  grows  cassava. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use the loan  to buy fertilizer, seed, and  labor. 

She hopes to ean more income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Los Trabajadores De Xolbe Group

texts.es:
Nicolasa (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía con suéter azul  es una joven de 23 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Nicolasa con el afán de generar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los ingresos de la casa, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como pollos de engorde, elle tiene 5 años de realizar esta labor, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también trabaja como empleada doméstica en una casa particular.
Nicolasa es una joven muy entusiasta que tiene la visión de superación por lo que ahora ha considerado incrementar los números de los pollos, pero para poder hacerlo necesita de un buen capital, por tal motivo a organizado a un grupo de personas para solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá comprando docenas de pollos y concentrado para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
Ella tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder seguir prosperando con la crianza de pollos y así poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Nicolasa (the first on the left in the photo, wearing the blue sweater) is 23 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the community of Sololá.

Nicolassa is enthusiastic about generating more income and supporting her parents. She makes a living raising and selling animals like chickens. She has been working in this area for 5 years, but in order to supplement her income she also works as a domestic in a private home.

Nicolassa is an enthusiastic young woman who has it in mind to increase the number of chickens she has, but in order to do so she needs investment capital. And so, she organized a group of individuals in order to ask for a loan that she will invest in purchasing a few dozen chickens and livestock feed so she can then sell them at a good price.

She hopes to get the loan so she can continue to prosper and to grow her small business and hopefully build her own home one day.

loans.use: purchase chickens.

loans.name: Saolat's Group

texts.en:
Saolat is 42 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school. She is a resident of Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. She and her husband grow cassava, oranges, and rice as the main sources of income. 

Saolat requested her fourth loan from VisionFund, which she will use to to buy seeds and fertilizers and to plow the field to grow cassava.  She is the leader of her group, which consists of two members. She hopes that she can earn more income to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to plow the field to grow cassava

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, está mejorando su venta de comida con la buena administración del préstamo anterior, la clientela es mayor  y sus nuevos ingresos le permiten tener mejores condiciones de vida junto a su familia.
Como una manera de surtir su inventario de forma inmediata solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar carnes, pollo, condimentos, bebidas, pastas, arroz, verduras, etc.,  tendrá la materia prima para elaborar la comida que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mary’s food sales are improving because of her proper use of the previous loan. She has more customers and her new income allows her and her family to have a better standard of living.
In order to stock her inventory quickly, she is requesting a new loan to buy meat, chicken, condiments, beverages, pasta, rice, vegetables, etc. This way she will have the ingredients to make the food she offers her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, condiments, beverages, pasta, rice, vegetables, etc. in order to have the ingredients to make the food she offers her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira is 54 years old. She has farmed for 25 years. She is married and has a son and two daughters. Her husband is a farmer too. The family is large, and together they have had a farm for a long time. Their farm is very old. Elmira raises cows; her daughter makes dairy products from the milk; and her son sells meat and dairy products at the local bazaar every Wednesday, Saturday and Sunday. Elmira is a very experienced farmer, and now she wants to expand her farm. She applied for a 1000 AZN loan to repair an old stall for cows.

loans.use: to repair an old stall for cows

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap is a farmer living in Phnom Proek District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is a 44-year-old married mother with seven children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She struggles for a living growing sesame on four hectares of farmland as the main source of income. Sometimes she works as a paid worker to supplement her income. As a group leader of two members, she will spend her loan portion to plow the field, buy seeds, and pay for workers. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her life.

loans.use: to plow the field, buy seeds and pay for workers

loans.name: Chhiet's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Chhiet is 45 years old and a father of five children. He can earn income to improve his family’s living conditions by rice cropping and working as a construction worker.

This is Chhiet's eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and he has fully repaid his past loans. In a group of two, he is the group leader. He will spend his entire loan portion to buy construction materials to support his work. He hopes that he can earn more income to update his lifestyle to be better than before.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to support his work.

loans.name: Hta Ni Pat Village

texts.en:
Pictured above are the Community-Based Organization (CBO) members from Hta Ni Pat Group, named (From left to right) Theinji, Saw, Pa, Sein and Thein. The Featured Borrower, Thein, is part of a family that has farmed for generations. He has a 2-acre farm in the Delta Region of Myanmar and has been farming for over 50 years. In this area, paddy farming can only be done in the winter season. Like many farmers in this area, savings are low before harvest season. The loan will help him purchase petrol and fertilizer, rent farming equipment, and pay transportation costs. The loan is important because he and his family depend on the income generated during the harvest season for the entire year. Thein is 63 years old, married, and supports a family of four (two children), the youngest of whom is in 10th grade. Part of the family’s income goes towards funding the children's education. Thein and his family hope eventually to save enough money to buy pumping water equipment, which is much needed for his paddy fields.

The CBO leaders oversee a group of 21 borrowers in their village.  The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time.  Hta Ni Pat Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal foods. They also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs for additional income.

loans.use: The featured borrower will use this loan to buy  the necessary farming resources needed before harvest.

loans.name: Adrian Orlando

texts.es:
Adrián, de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltero, vive con su mamá y un hermano de él.

Adrián, tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad desde hace 1 año, comenzó vendiendo solo granos básicos y luego poco a poco comenzó a surtirla con más productos.- Adrián, también es agricultor, la tienda está en su casa y el horario de atención es desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m.

Adrián, necesita el crédito para comprar ladrillo, hierro y cemento para construir un cuarto en su casa, porque la tienda le abarca mucho espacio y no quiere que su mamá este incomoda, el préstamo le ayudará a mejor su condición de vida.

Sus deseos son, ampliar más su tienda y continuar trabajando en la agricultura para cubrir todas sus necesidades y las de su mamá.
texts.en:
Adrián is 53 years old and studied up to the 6th grade.  He is single and lives with his mother and a brother. He has a store where he sells staple goods and has been doing this for one year. He started by selling only basic grains, and then little by little he began to diversify his products. The store is in his house and he sees customers from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.. Adrian is also a farmer.

Adrian needs the loan so that he can buy bricks, metal, and cement to build a room in his house. The store takes up a lot of room and he doesn't want his mother to be uncomfortable.  The loan will help him to improve his quality of life.

His wishes are to expand his store and continue working in agriculture to cover all of his and his mother's needs.

loans.use: to buy bricks, metal, and cement to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL SEÑOR APOYA A SUS PAPAS CON SU PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO YA QUE SU PADRE SUFRE DE UNA ENFERMEDAD CRONICA. ACTUALMENTE EL SÑOR PRESENTA MOLESTIAS Y SE LE DIGNOSTICO PERICORONITIS EN UNA DE SUS PIEZAS DENTALES, APARECIENDOLE UNA ULCERA EN LA ENCIA, POR ESTA RAZON NO HA PODIDO TRABAJAR EN LOS ULTIMOS DIAS AFECTANDO ASI LA ECONOMIA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
This man supports his parents with his small business since his father suffers from a chronic illness. He has been experiencing discomfort and has been diagnosed with having pericoronitis with one of his teeth. It also appears that he has an ulcer in the gums.

For this reason, he has not been able to work the past few days and this has affected his family's finances.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Somos Progreso Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Somos Progreso” La cual  está constituida por 08 socias responsables y entusiastas. Este es el caso de Demetria de 46 años de edad es separada con 05 hijos dos de ellos dependientes. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega donde vende abarrotes como azúcar, arroz y aceite. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus menores hijos. Su mayor deseo es  que todos sus hijos sean profesionales. Solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, sal y leche. La Alcancía “Somos Progreso” agradece a todos a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar dicho crédito. Demetria se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo floreado y pantalón color morado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Somos Progreso” consists of eight responsible and enthusiastic members. Such is the case with Demetria. She is 46 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five children, two of whom are dependents. Demetria has a small store where she sells groceries such as sugar, rice, and oil. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to improve the quality of life for herself and her young children. Her greatest wish is for all of her children to become professionals.

Demetria is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, salt, and milk. The Communal Bank “Somos Progreso” thanks all of the Kiva lenders for facilitating this loan. In the photo, Demetria is the first person seated on the right, wearing a floral blouse and purple slacks.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, salt, and milk.

loans.name: Ramiro De Jesus

texts.es:
Ramiro, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar cables, luces, bugías y otros repuestos para reparar vehículos, de esa manera continuara atendiendo bien a sus clientes en el taller.
El financiamiento anterior le ha dado los recursos económicos para tener un mejor inventario en su negocio, los ingresos son más estables y todo esté tiempo no ha tenido dificultades para mantenerse trabajando.
texts.en:
Ramiro is requesting a new loan to purchase wiring, lights, spark plugs and other replacement parts for repairing vehicles, and in this manner, he will be able to continue attending well to customers in his shop.

The previous financing has provided financial resources to acquire a better inventory for his business. Ramiro's income is now more stable and during this time, he has had no difficulty in keeping himself working.

loans.use: buy wiring, lights, spark plugs and other replacement parts to repair vehicles. In this manner, he will continue his good services to customers in his shop.

loans.name: Shakarhan

texts.ru: Шакархан, 54 года, замужем, есть 3сыновей. У Шакархан- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Собственный бизнес начала в 2010 году и развила его. В хозяйстве Шакархан есть корова и 1,23 Га земли, где она выращивает кукурузу. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Шакархан составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Шакархан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она мечтает дать своему младшему сыну высшее образование.
texts.en:
Shakarhan is 54 years old, married, and has three sons. Shakarhan has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock and crops. She began her own business in 2010 and has developed it. On her homestead, Shakarhan has a cow and 1.23 hectares of land, where she grows corn. Currently, Shakarhan's monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS). She applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase a calf for fattening and resale.

Shakarhan plans to invest income from the loan in further developing her business, and similarly she dreams of giving her younger son a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase one calf for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband purchase raw wooden material for making furniture.

loans.name: Kumushai

texts.ru: Кумушай 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает 4 детей. С 2005 года Кумушай начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS), Кумушай сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец и 2,0 Га земли, где Кумушай  выращивает кукурузу и табак. В целях расширения своей деятельности, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на приобретение 12 овец. Кумушай планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Kumushai is 38, married, and is raising four children with her spouse. In 2005 Kumushai began raising livestock and planting crops. She started a business with 10,000 som (KGS) that now earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. She has two cows, ten sheep and a 2.0 hectare plot of land where she grows corn and tobacco. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy 12 sheep. Kumushai plans to invest the profits in additional livestock.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy children's clothes and women's finery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various shop goods

loans.name: Yulduzoi

texts.en:
Yulduzoi is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is married and has two children. She has 30 years experience of doing business.

First of all, she worked at sewing fabric, and after the independence of Tajikistan she started her own business. She is a seamstress. She can sew jackets, school uniforms, dresses, pants, etc. She has permanent women and men clients. She sews modern, newly designed clothes, and customers are satisfied with her work.

She wants to enlarge her business and asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy textiles and needed items to sew more beautiful clothes.

loans.use: to buy textiles and needed items to sew more beautiful clothes.

loans.name: Mohida

texts.en:
Mohida is a skillful woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She lives in a big district and has two children. Her husband is in construction. She does business in agriculture. Each season she plants onions, wheat, cucumbers and other plants on her two hectares of land. She loves her activity and works hard. 

Mohida is planning to plant vegetables and wheat for the coming season and to have a good harvest. She wants to get a loan to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds of vegetables and fertilizer

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a helpful woman. She was born in 1975. She is living in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Her husband is in construction and also helps to Rano to run a business. She does business in agriculture. She plants agricultural products and keeps livestock. She started her business with planting cucumber and tomato. Recently, she planted onion and wheat. She helps her husband to feed their family. 

Rano has a good reputation and has a long years of experience. She needs money to buy fertilizers to have a good harvest this coming season. She awaits Kiva lenders' mercy and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ausberto

texts.es:
Ausberto, de 36 años de edad, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado y su esposa vende panes y frescos, tienen dos hijos y están estudiando.
 
Ausberto, trabaja de peluquero desde hace ocho años y fue gracias a unos amigos que lo aprendió, debido a la pobreza  en que vivían, tuvo que aprender de todo tipo de trabajo.- Un amigo lo motivo para que colocará su propia peluquería y ahora gracias a este trabajo, ha logrado brindarles lo necesario a su familia, su peluquería está a 8 cuadras desde su casa y su horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. hasta 5:00 p.m.

El crédito será invertido para comprar material eléctrico, para colocar la energía eléctrica en el negocio.

Sus sueños son, que sus hijos se preparen académicamente, construir su propia casa y mejorar su peluquería con mejores herramientas.
texts.en:
Ausberto is 36 years old and only studied up to Grade 2. He is married and his wife sells bread and fruit drinks. They have 2 children who attend school. Ausberto has worked as a barber for the past 8 years, thanks to some friends who taught him. Due to the poverty he lived in he had to learn all kinds of work.

A friend motivated him to open his own barbershop and now thanks to this work he has managed to provide for the needs of his family. His barbershop is 8 blocks from his house and his hours are from 7 am until 5 pm.

The loan will be invested in buying electrical materials to connect his business to the electric grid. His dreams are to prepare his children academically, construct his own house and improve his barber shop with better tools.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials to connect his business to the electrical grid.

loans.name: Salidat

texts.ru: Салидат 31 год, замужем, есть 2 детей школьников. У нее среднее образование, с 2006 года в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Салидат, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салидат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и сена для скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, также хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Salidat is 31 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She has a secondary education. Since 2006, as an additional source of income for her family, she has been raising livestock and crops, having begun with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Salidat's hard work, she currently has on her homestead three cows and 15 sheep. Monthly income amounts to approximately 16,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her business, Salidat applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 45,000 som (KGS) на покупку овец и сена для скота. She plans to invest income from the loan in further expanding her business, and also wants to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and hay for livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Uulbubu

texts.ru: Уулбубу, 27 лет, замужем, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Уулбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2008 году с покупки скота. Благодаря упорному труду Уулбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 30 овец. И арендованный земельный надел мерою 1,0 ГА, где она выращивает картофель и люцерну для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уулбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Уулбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своей деятельности и хочет накопить средства на покупку холодильника.
texts.en:
Uulbubu is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Uulbubu raises livestock and crops, having begun in 2008 with a livestock purchase. Thanks to Uulbubu's hard work, she currently has on her homestead three cows and 30 sheep, and a rented plot of land measuring 1.0 hectare, where she grows potatoes and alfalfa to sell. With the aim of further developing her homestead, Uulbubu applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock.

Uulbubu plans to invest profits from the loan in further expanding her activities and wants to save money to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Sakish

texts.ru: Сакиш 57 лет, вдова, многодетная мать 4 детей. Сакиш, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы. Также есть 0,84 ГА собственной и 1,00 ГА арендованной земли, где Сакиш выращивает люцерну. Ежемесячный доход Сакиш составляет в среднем 8,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 37,500 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Сакиш планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, она хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sakish is 57 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. Sakish, as a main source of income for her family, is engaged in agriculture. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows on her homestead. She also has 0.84 hectare of her own and 1.00 hectare of rented land, where Sakish grows alfalfa. Sakish's monthly income amounts to an average 8,000 som (KGS). She applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 37,500 som (KGS) to purchase steers.

Sakish plans to invest income from the loan in further developing her business. She wants to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase some steers for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a 30-year-old woman. She lives with her two daughters, two sons and husband in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a sewing machine sales shop for the past four years. He sells new sewing machines from his shop. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers.

He wants to buy more stock of new sewing machines for resale. Therefore, Uzma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband would be able to purchase more sewing machines for his business purpose so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Uzma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines for her husband's sewing machine sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new moto-rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband in purchasing a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories ro offer for sale

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 40 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of six children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. 

Her husband owns clothing sale business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently, he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that, Shahnaz is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase variety of clothes to sell. This will help him respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the help of the profits, her husband will put aside some savings to pay for electricity and gas bills. Shahnaz hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her husband's clothing sales business

loans.name: Mamanur

texts.ru: Маманур 51 лет. Она замужем мать двоих детей. Маманур вместе семьей проживает в районе Джом. Ее муж занимается таксистом. Маманур серьезная и шустрая женщина. Она занимается шитьем. Маманур 10 лет своей жизни занимается этой деятельности. По ее словам ей удобно, сшить дома. Маманур запрашивает кредит, чтобы расширить деятельность. За счет денежных средств она планирует приобрести больше ткани и швейные принадлежности, чтобы сшить больше платье и привлечь себе больше клиентов. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей улучшить процесс работы и  расширить деятельность.
texts.en:
Mamanur is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Mamanur and her family reside in the Djom region. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Mamanur is a serious and nimble woman. She is engaged in sewing. For ten years of her life, Mamanur has been involved in this activity. According to her, it is comfortable to sew at home.

Mamanur is requesting a loan to expand activities. Through the monetary resources, she plans to acquire more fabric and sewing implements, in order to sew more dresses and attract more customers. The requested loan will help her to improve her work process and to expand activities.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and to expand her business.

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.ru: Сафармох успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Она очень благодарна за Вашу поддержку. Благодаря Вам она сейчас продвигает свою деятельность. Сафармох сейчас планирует расширить деятельность, и она обратилась за кредитом. За счет кредита она хочет приобрести несколько скота, и продвигать бизнес дальше. Животноводство является основной источником дохода. Доход от  этой деятельности обеспечить ее семью, и она не хочет потерять источник дохода.
texts.en: Safarmoh successfully repaid a previous loan. She is very grateful for the support of Kiva lenders. Thanks to you she is now promoting her activities. Safarmoh is now planning to expand activities, and she applied for a loan. With the loan, she wants to acquire some livestock, and to promote her business further. Raising livestock is her main source of income. Income from these activities supports her family and she does not want to lose the income source.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and to expand her business.

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
Nuriniso is a conscientious woman. She was born in Tajikistan in 1987. She lives in one of the big districts of her country. She is married and has two children. 

Nuriniso keeps, feeds, and sells livestock in the animal market. She has six years practice of doing business. She wants to get a loan from Kiva lenders to plant agricultural products. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds of agricultural products

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a strong woman. She was born in 1988 in a small town. She is living in the northern part of Tajikistan, in J. Rasulov district. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a constructor.

Zarina is a responsible, goal-oriented and nice person. She has a good history of getting a loan. She does business in agriculture. She started her business with planting cucumbers and tomatoes. Recently, she is planting onions and wheat and gets a good harvest from each hectare.

Zarina has a good response to her produce from clients and friends. She is asking for a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers and natural chemicals. She hopes to have a good harvest this season and awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and natural chemicals.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra, who is in her early twenties, engages in mixed farming to earn an income. This skillful woman keeps livestock as well as planting and harvesting vegetables. She lives with her husband in the northern part of the country. 

Initially, Gulchera's sole business was keeping cattle and selling them at the animal market. Over time, she increased her number of cattle by degrees. Eventually, she also started to farm onions, and now she earns an income from selling her produce as well as her livestock. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy fertilizers and natural chemicals for her crop. This will allow her to bring in a good harvest at harvest season. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and natural chemicals for her onion field

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cria cuyes y gallinas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere poner su tienda de abarrotes ya que es su sueño tener su propio negocio, la socia también quiere tener un lugar más amplio para que pueda vender sus animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y también alimentos para los animales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marina continues to manage her business of raising animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. As a result of this business, she wants to open a grocery store since her dream is to have another business of her own. Marina would also like to have a larger place where she can sell her animals. She is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for these animals.

Marina is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of the country in 1987. She lives in a small town. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a master. 

She started her business trading women and kid’s wear. She has seven years of experience trading in the domestic market. Before she was a housekeeper, and her husband alone feed their family. He went to Russia to work. 

When her first child was born she decided to start a business buying and selling kid’s wear. She thought the demand for kid’s clothes was stable. She saved up money from money that was sent from her husband and added to her business. Year by year she attracts a lot of clients. There was demand for women's clothes also. 

She decided to enlarge her assortment and asks a loan to buy women and kid’s clothes. Tahmina hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy women and kid’s clothes

loans.name: Oibonu

texts.en:
Oibonu, who is in her mid-fifties, buys and sells livestock to earn her living. She has been engaged in this activity for 15 years. She is confident in her skill and enjoys her work. 

Oibonu lives in a small town in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is a responsible, hard-working and kind person. She and her husband have two children. Her husband helps in running the business. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through IMON in order to buy cattle. She is grateful for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar Augusto tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, la población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pavos, cerdos, etc. Cuenta con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito será para la compra de más animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en su negocio, con gran influencia en el negocio, esto le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y de esta manera incrementrar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 22 years old and single. He lives with his family in the Oyotún District, located in the Chiclayo Province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Life in the district is tranquil. The people of the region work mainly in agriculture, trade, and livestock. 

He makes a living by breeding and selling animals such as ducks, turkeys, pigs, etc. He has more than 3 years of experience in the business and very good personal and professional references locally. This loan is for the purchase of more animals and balanced feed for fattening them. This investment will help him to have more variety and productivity in animals which will have a large influence on his business. This will allow him to generate more revenue and thereby improve the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and also to buy feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Misalimu

texts.en:
Misalimu is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Buukan

texts.ru: Буукан 53 года, замужем, есть 2 сыновей и 2 дочери. У Буукан средне-специальное медицинское образование, работает медицинской сестрой в школе-лицеи интерната. Заработная плата составляет около 8,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) для покупки краски, цемента и прочих строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Буукан намерена свои доходы и дальше вкладывать в улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Buukan is 53 years old, married, and has two sons and two daughters. Buukan has a specialized secondary medical education. She works as a nurse in a boarding school. Her wages amount to about 8,000 som (KGS). She applied to Bai-Tushum Bankfor a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to purchase paint, cement and прочих building materials for home repairs.

Buukan intends with her profits to continue to invest in improving living conditions.

loans.use: to buy paints, cement, etc., in order to make some improvements in her house.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
José, vive junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijas, una de ellas se encuentra estudiando, ofrece el servicio de mecánico de vehículos y de una moto taxi (para la cual contrata chofer), al tener esté negocio puede obtener ingresos para suplir las necesidades familiares y además puede ofrecer empleo para ayudar a otra persona a tener recursos económicos.
El crédito será el complemento para comprar un vehículo para mejorar la movilización para realizar compra de repuestos para que su negocio siga funcionando, espera tener un efecto positivo con dicha inversión y mejorar su condición económica.
Sus aspiraciones son tener la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
José, lives with his family which is made up of his wife and two daughters, one of whom is still in education. He offers mechanical services for vehicles and a motorcycle taxi service (for which he hires a chauffer). From this business he can earn enough to provide for his family and he can also offer someone else employment and an opportunity to earn money.

The loan will be used to buy a vehicle to make him more mobile in order to buy spare parts and ensure that his business continues. He hopes that the loan will have a positive effect and improve his financial situation. He dreams of being able to provide his family with better food, clothing and education.

loans.use:
to buy a vehicle to make him more mobile in order to buy spare parts and ensure that his business continues. 

para realizar compra de repuestos para que su negocio siga funcionando

loans.name: Zhypar

texts.ru: Жыпар 48 лет, замужем. У них с мужем 2 детей. Жыпар в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1986 году начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жыпар, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 2 лошади, 20 овец и 6,60 Га обрабатываемой земли, где выращивает люцерну. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Жыпар планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhypar is 48 years old and married. She and her husband have two children. As a source of income for her family, Zhypar in 1986 began to raise crops and livestock, having begun this business with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zhypar's hard work, she currently has on her homestead three cows, two horses and 20 sheep and 6.60 hectares of prepared land, where she grows alfalfa.

With the aim of further developing her business, Zhypar applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep. Zhypar plans to invest income from the loan in business development.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband purchase raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 42-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and two sons. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Nazeeran's husband provides services in shuttering work for building construction. For this business, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. That will enable him to generate more income to financially support of his family. 

Nazeeran is applying for loan from this Kiva field partner for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Kimso's Group

texts.en:
Kimso, age 37, is a rice farmer living in a rural area located in the Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom province. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 19 years. In order to earn additional income, Kimso also works as construction worker. She is able to earn about 55,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

Kimso and her husband have two children, both of whom live at home and attend school.

This will be the first loan for Kimso’s group, which consists of four VisionFund members. Kimso is the leader of the group. She will utilize her portion of the loan funds to build a private toilet for her family. She is grateful that this loan will allow her to offer her family improved sanitation and therefore a better standard of living.

loans.use: to build a private toilet for her family

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 32-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and one son. She is a house wife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband provides services making shutters for buildings. In this regard her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shutters work so that he can generate more income to financially support his family. 

Musarat is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials so her husband can make iron accessories to add to his work making building shutters

loans.name: Chanty's Group

texts.en:
Chanty is lives in a rural area of Sangke district of Battambang province. She is 43 years old, and a married mother of four children; three of them are dependent children and only one is in school. Growing rice and fishing are the main sources of her family’s income that could earn her about 50,000KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 

This is the second loan for Chanty’s Group, which consists of two members, with VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to have a better living condition. 

Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan, with her portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for a plowing fee. 

She hopes that she could earn more income and expend her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира 26 летняя молодая жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Она замужем и имеет два сына. Муж занимается таксистом. Мунира серьезная и ответственная женщина. У нее среднее образование. Мунира планирует открыть магазин возле дома, и иметь свой бизнес. Ее магазин пока без ремонта, она еще не закончила ремонт.  Она планирует взять кредит, и за счет кредита она хочет приобрести стройматериалов для завершение ремонта. На оставшуюся часть денег она перевозит  молочные продукты для бизнеса. Мунире нужно Ваша помощь. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Munira is a 26-year-old young resident of the town of Kurgan-Tiube. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is a taxi driver. Munira is a serious and responsible woman. She has a secondary education. Munira plans to open a store hear her home and to have her own business. Her store is still without decoration and she still has not completed repairs. She is planning to take a loan and with the loan he wants to acquire building materials to complete the repairs. With the remaining part of the money, she will transport dairy products for the business. Munira needs help. She believes in the support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and to transport dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace her roof.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Это Зулфия. Ей 31 лет. Она проживает в районе Рудаки. Зулфия замужем и мать двоих детей. Ее муж находится за границе, он зарабатывает, и отправлять деньги домой. Ее дети ходят садик. Зулфия живет вместе свекровью, тестю и детьми. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Зулфия после окончания школы выбрала швейную деятельность. 8 лет своей жизни продвигает швейную деятельность. Зулфия занимается у себя дома, потому что ей удобно, сшить на дому. Она параллельно ведет домашнее хозяйство. Зулфия обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить мебель для дома. Она хочет улучшить условия жизни семьи.
texts.en:
This is Zulfiya. She is 31 years old. She resides in the Rudaki region. Zulfiya is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is abroad to earn a living and he sends money home. Her children go to kindergarten. Zulfiya lives with her mother-in-law, father-in-law, and children. She is a hardworking woman. After graduating from school, Zulfiya chose sewing activities. For eight years she has been promoting sewing activities. Zulfiya works at home, because it is comfortable for her to sew there. At the same time, she runs the domestic household.

Zulfiya applied for a loan, in order to purchase furniture for her home. She wants to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase furniture.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are attending school. Margaret has no additional family members. 

She has a business selling cereals, and has been selling ground nuts in a shop at retail for the last 20 years, working seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy bags of ground nuts, beans, and peas. 

Her challenges include seasonality and price fluctuations. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. 

Margaret resides in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of ground nuts, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: La Palma Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Palma” lo conforman cinco mujeres y un joven. Entre ellos existe una gran amistad y siempre se han apoyado en circunstancias difíciles. La población donde viven es muy pacífica y los habitantes se caracterizan por su gran amabilidad. 
Doña Angelina es una mujer muy trabajadora, siempre preocupada por el bienestar de su familia. Tiene 47 años de edad y está casada con el señor Jorge, juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales ya sólo uno depende de ellos y continúa estudiando su educación secundaria.
“Mi esposo trabajaba en Estados Unidos y estaba a punto de regresar, pero me preocupaba porque ya no tendríamos un ingreso estable para mantener a los niños” entonces, todos sus hijos eran pequeños. Cierto día, una sobrina le recomendó vender flores y dado que no había recibido ningún tipo de capacitación ella temía que su negocio no funcionara; aun así se atrevió a invertir todos sus ahorros. Recuerda que comenzó la actividad un día antes del miércoles de ceniza lo que le ayudó a vender todas las flores en las que había invertido. Después, Angelina se dio cuenta que tenía un reto importante: la mayoría de las personas del municipio cortaba flores directamente del campo, pero su esfuerzo le ayudó a mejorar sus ventas y las ganancias fueron aumentando poco a poco. 
Tiempo después escuchó hablar de VisionFund y se animó a solicitar un préstamo para hacer crecer su negocio. Angelina ha aprovechado al máximo sus créditos, actualmente tiene dos florerías, una que atiende ella misma y otra su esposo. Las ganancias también le permitieron comprar una camioneta para transportar las flores y ha contratado a una muchacha para ayudarle. Con su nuevo préstamo podrá comprar más flores de diferentes tipos para seguir creando adornos florares, arreglos para regalos, coronas, etc.
Angelina trabaja todos los días muy contenta y verdaderamente disfruta de su actividad “Me encanta llegar a mi negocio y estar entre tantas flores”. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Norma quien invertirá en inmobiliario; Erika y Josefina, en zapatos y ropa; Kevin, en pollos e Ilse, en mantelería.
texts.en:
The "La Palma" group is made up of five women and one young man.  They are all good friends and have always supported each other in difficult circumstances.  The people where they live are very peaceful and the inhabitants are known for their friendliness. 

Angelina is a hardworking woman who is always concerned with her family's well-being.  She is 47 years old and married to Jorge.  Together they have a family of four children, of whom only one still depends on them while they attend school. When her children were young, "my husband worked in the United States and was about to return, but I was worried because we did not have a stable income to care for the children".  One day, her niece suggested that she sell flowers.  Since she had no training, she was worried that the business wouldn't work, but she dared to invest all of their savings.  She remembers that she started her business the day before Ash Wednesday since it would help her to sell all of the flowers that she had invested in.  Afterwards, she realized that most people in her town cut flowers directly from the fields, but her efforts helped her to improve her sales and her profits increased little by little.

Later, she heard about VisionFund and decided to request a loan to grow her business.  Angelina has taken advantage of her loans and currently has two flower shops.  She works at one and her husband works at the other.  Her profits have allowed to her to purchase a truck to transport flowers and to hire a young woman to help her.  She will use this new loan to purchase more flowers of different types so she can continue creating decorations, flower arrangements, crowns, and other items.

Angelina works every day and genuinely enjoys her work.  "I love coming to my store and being among so many flowers".  

The other group members are Norma, who will invest in real estate, Erika and Josefina, who will buy shoes and clothing, Kevin, who will buy chickens, and Ilse, who will buy table linens.

loans.use: to purchase different types of flowers.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, a widow living in Kampala, makes and sells cold juice beverages to earn her living. She has operated her retail for 15 years and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Betty has six children, three of whom attend school. The family lives in a house that has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her primary monthly expenses are school fees and utility bills. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO, and she will use her loan funds to buy crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, passion fruit, pow pow fruits, and oranges for making juice.  She also hopes to invest in her business by buying serving utensils with which to serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, passion fruit, pow pow fruits, and oranges for making juic

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is married and has one child who goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a retail shop, and she has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX  from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice, and bags of maize flour. She works in her shop seven days a week, and sells on retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and transportation. She hopes to buy a better fridge to serve her customers better. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice, and bags of maize flour

loans.name: Urmat

texts.ru: Урмат, 35 лет, женат 2 детей. В настоящее время занимается животноводством, он с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 1,40 Га земли. Супруга и дети помогают по хозяйству. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 7,000 сом (KGS). Урмат обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян клевера для выращивания и заготовки для скота.
texts.en:
Urmat is 35 years old, married with two children. He is currently involved in raising livestock. With great responsibility, he applies himself to his trade. On his homestead, he has three cows and 1.40 hectares of land. His wife and children help him on the homestead. Monthly income amounts to 7,000 som (KGS).

Urmat applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase clover seeds to cultivate and harvest for livestock.

loans.use: to buy clover seeds in order to grow it for his livestock.

loans.name: Chanthan's Group

texts.en:
Chanthan is lives in a rural area of Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is 43 years old, and a single woman. Growing rice and working for other farmers have been the sources of her family’s income for 23 years. She could earn around 58,000KHR per day to support her living. 

Chanthan’s Group consists of two members, and this is the second loan for her. The previous loan helped her to have enough consumables to use. 

Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan, with her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to do the farming. 

She hopes that she could generate more income and create a new business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Nayseoun's Group

texts.en:
Nayseoun, 61 years old, is a widowed mother of six children, and one of them is a dependent child. She is a resident in a rural area located in Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. The only source of her family’s income is generated from rice farming, which earns her around 45,000KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Nayseoun’s Group, which consists of two members, with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. 

Now she is leading the group to apply for this loan, with her portion to buy seeds and hire laborers to work on the farm. 

She hopes that she could earn more money and have enough rice for consumption.

loans.use: to buy seeds and hire laborers for the farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ah Kei Gyi Te Tan Village

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Te Tan group, named (from right to left) Myint, Thein, Than, Hla and Maung. The featured borrower, Myint, has a 19-acre farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, savings are low before harvest season. The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs before harvest. Myint is part of a family that has farmed for generations, and has been farming for over 40 years. Farming is in his blood, and he is proud to be a rice farmer. The community views farmers as contributing greatly to society because rice is consumed by everyone on a daily basis. Myint is 60 years old, married, and supports a family of six (four children), the youngest of whom is in 10th grade. Part of the family’s income goes towards funding the childrens’ education. Tin and his family hope to eventually be able to save enough money to buy farming equipment. From the profits from his paddy fields, he could send his daughter to Yangon University for further study.

The CBO leaders oversee a group of 32 borrowers in their village. The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time. Ah Kei Gyi Te Tan Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other seasonal foods. They also raise livestock such as duck farming, raising pigs and plantations such as palm trees, and banana trees.

loans.use: to buy petrol, rent farming equipment, and for fertilizer and transportation costs

borrowers.first_name: Ah Kei Gyi Te Tan Village

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband purchase a greater variety of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Hendrick

texts.en:
Hendrick lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with six children, two of whom attend school. She also looks after her grandchildren and elderly mother. 

She has been operating a food stall selling fresh peas and beans for five years, working six days a week. She also sells local brew as another source of income. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,100,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy fresh cow peas, beans, tomatoes, onions, cabbages and green peppers.  

Her challenges include seasonality and perishability of fruits. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. 

She lives in her own house with access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy fresh cow peas, beans, tomatoes, onions, and cabbages

loans.name: Mkatajika Group

texts.en:
Debora, who is in her early 30s, is married with four children who are still in school.  She has been running a genge business for two years now.  She works from 06 am to 06 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Debora's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase the genge stock to meet  her customers' demand.  She dreams of expanding her genge. 

Debora will use this loan with her loan group, MKATAJIKA , which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase genge stock to meet  her customers' demand.

loans.name: Layali

texts.en:
Layali is a 34-year-old Lebanese married mother of one child. 

In 2008, Layali started her own business by opening a small room for vending clothes in her house with her special selling methods and by providing a high quality of products. She is well-known in her region with the special talents in her domain. 

Today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to increase her business merchandise with special collections.  This will meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income and therefore develop her lifestyle. 

Layali states that she is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to expand her earnings.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special collections

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es:
La socia Aniceta se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Aniceta continues with her business of selling groceries. She sells such staple goods as rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits and works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.. Aniceta has been in this business for five years and it has been going very well.

This member's dream is to expand her grocery business and she is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits. She is happy because of the loan and promises to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits.

loans.name: La Luz Del Saber Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se conformó el grupo “La Luz del Saber” se caracteriza porque la mayoría de la población se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza o a la elaboración de fibras y esponjas específicamente. 
Doña Filiberta es una mujer muy trabajadora, desafortunadamente perdió a su esposo a una edad muy temprana pero tuvo la fortaleza para sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos. Actualmente ella está muy contenta y orgullosa de sus gran familia, su mayor alegría son sus 20 nietos y sus 6 bisnietos.  
A sus 61 años, Filiberta aún se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza y bordados. Cuando sus niños eran pequeños y se quedó sola, sabía que tenía que trabajar para tener suficiente dinero y comenzó a vender pescado en las calles de su comunidad. Durante cinco años esta fue su actividad pero había veces en que no lograba vender todo el producto que terminaba echándose a perder, lo que significaba pérdidas importantes. 
Entonces, Filiberta comenzó a vender productos de limpieza y para el hogar como trapos de cocina, cucharas, volteadores, pinzas, entre otros. Ya son 23 años de experiencia los que tiene en este tipo de negocio. Para ella, VisionFund ha significado una gran ayuda para invertir más, tener más mercancía y pagar con mayor facilidad. “Realmente ha sido de gran ayuda porque así pude sacar adelante a mis hijos, podía solventar mis gastos entre otras cosas” comento Doña Filiberta. Ahora ya no tiene tanta energía para estar recorriendo todas las plazas y tianguis como antes y por eso comenzó a bordar servilletas y manteles para tener un poco de dinero extra. 
El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en productos de limpieza y en tela, hilos y estambres. Su gran ilusión, es mantener ambas actividades que le permitirán seguir teniendo un ingreso para pagar sus gastos. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son Don Moisés quien invertirá en productos de jarcería; Gregoria y Aurora, en su tienda de abarrotes; Ángel, en fibras metálicas; Ofelia, en borregos y David, en su taxi.
*La fotografía fue tomada en comunidad a lado del taxi de Don David, él viste camisa blanca y Doña Filiberta es quien tiene las trenzas es un peinado característico de la región, también viste chaleco rojo.*
texts.en:
The group La Luz del Saber was founded in a community where most of the population works selling cleaning products or manufacturing scouring pads and sponges, specifically.

Filiberta is a very hard worker. Unfortunately she lost her husband at a very young age, but she had the strength to raise her six children. Now she is very happy and proud of her large family. She has twenty grandchildren and six great grandchildren who fill her with joy. At her 61 years of age, Filiberta still works selling cleaning products, as well as embroidery. When her children were little and she was left by herself, she knew that she had to work in order to have enough money, so she started selling fish on the local streets. She was in this business for five years, but sometimes she wasn't able to sell all of her product and some of it would spoil, which meant significant losses. Then she started selling cleaning products and household items like kitchen towels, spoons, spatulas, tongs, and other things. She now has 23 years of experience in this line of business.  

For Filiberta, VisionFund has been of great help. It has enabled her to invest more, have more merchandise, and make payments more easily. "It really has been of great help, because this way I was able to provide for my children and cover my expenses, among other things," Filiberta mentioned. She currently doesn't have as much energy as she used to, and can't cover the squares and markets like before. That is why she started embroidering napkins and tablecloths, in order to make some extra money.

She will invest this new loan in cleaning products, as well as in fabric, thread, and yarn. She looks forward to keeping both businesses running, because this will allow her to continue supporting herself.

The other members of the group are Moisés, who will buy cleaning products; Gregoria and Aurora, who will invest in their grocery store; Ángel, who will purchase metal fibers; Ofelia, who will by lambs; and David, who will invest in his taxi cab.

The picture was taken as a group next to David's taxi cab. He is wearing a white shirt, and Filiberta is the woman wearing her hair braided in the traditional way of this region. She is also wearing a red vest.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products, as well as fabric, thread, and yarn.

location.town: Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра, 40 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода она занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая на 0,64 ГА собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли фасоль. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 30 овец. Благодаря упорному труду совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 105,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, удобрений и топлива для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Зухра планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку земельных угодий для полеводства.
texts.en:
Zuhra is 40 years old, married with five children. She has a secondary education. As a source of income, she raises livestock and crops, growing haricot beans on 0.64 hectares of her own and 2.0 hectares of rented land. On his homestead, he also has two cows and 30 sheep. Thanks to her hard work, total monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 105,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow, fertilizers and fuel for preparing the soil.

Zuhra plans to invest income from the loan in further developing her business and buying land for crop cultivation.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fertilizers and fuel for land cultivation and growing organic haricot.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара, 29 лет, не замужем, детей нет. У нее высшее образование, работает старшим контролером, получая заработную плату в размере 14,440 сом (KGS). По характеру она: честная, целеустремленная и пунктуальная. Гулсара решила отремонтировать свой дом. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), чтобы купить пластиковые окна, кафель, печь для отопления. Гулсара является участником группы "Гулсара", в которой еще состоят 2 человека, всего их 3. Это позволит Гулсаре улучшить жилищные условия, доходы она будет откладывать на приобретение земельного участка.
texts.en:
Gulsara is 29 years old, single, and has no children. She has a higher education. She works as a senior controller and receives wages of 14,440 som (KGS). By character, she is honest, determined, and punctual. Gulsara decided to repair her home, therefore she applied to Bai-Tushum for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), to purchase plastic windows, tile, and an oven for heating. Gulsara is a member of the loan group "Gulsara" which consists of two additional people, for a total of three.

This will allow Gulsara to improve living conditions, and she will invest the income in purchasing a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows, tile, and an oven for heating in order to repair her house.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Anastacia to improve her business. 

She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. 

She will buy some additional supplies such as rice, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water and slippers.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Anastacia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. 

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water and slippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his child's dental treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tools to continue her husband's service of repairing ricksaws

loans.name: Busamar

texts.ru: Бусамар, 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей, они школьники. У нее высшее образование, работает фельдшером, получая заработную плату в размере 21,367 сом (KGS). Бусамар решила отремонтировать и утеплить свой дом. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), чтобы купить пластиковые окна, двери, кафель, кирпичи. Бусамар является участником группы "Гулсара", в которой еще состоят 2 человека, всего их 3. Доходы она будет в дальнейшем вкладывать в улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Busamar is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three school-aged children. She has a higher education and works as a paramedic, earning wages of 21,367 som (KGS). Busamar decided to repair and heat her home, therefore she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), to purchase plastic windows, doors, tiles, and bricks. Busamar is a member of the "Gusara" loan group, which consists of two other people, for a total of three.

She will further invest the income in improving living conditions.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows and doors, tiles, and bricks to repair her house.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She is a poultry farmer. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products by retail from home. She also gets additional income from selling charcoal. 

She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy poultry feed, vaccines, and bags of charcoal. Her main business challenges include seasonality and diseases, which affect the quality of chicks. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a demonstration farm in the future. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed, vaccines, and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; all attend school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent. 

She operates a restaurant and works five days a week. She has been in this business for 11 years. Seasonality of food is a major challenge that she faces. Her goal is to buy food warmers.

Nulu has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000  from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour, bunches of green bananas, and beans.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, bunches of green bananas, and beans

loans.name: Carmen Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia Carmen Presentacion se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de produtos de limpieza,la soci trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de limpieza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar jabones,adornos y tarjetas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Carmen Presentacion, continues her work selling cleaning products. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. and has been doing this for a number of years. It has been going very well for her.

Carmen Presentacion's dream is to have a shop where she can sell her cleaning products.  She is asking for a loan so she can buy soaps, decorations, and cards. She is happy because of the loan and promises to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy soaps, decorations, and cards.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
Luz Margarita tiene 70 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a curaciones y prótesis dentales, desde hace varios años, su consultorio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, es conocida en su distrito dado que no existe competencia en el rubro. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de material para curaciones de dientes lo que le va a permitir brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y va a incrementar su nivel de ingresos lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Margarita is 70 years old. She is single and lives in a house that she owns in the Oyotun district, a rural area where its population works in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry, located in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coast. 
She has worked in dental treatments and making false teeth for many years. Her dental office is located in her home. She is known in her local area, because there is no competition in her area of expertise. She is requesting a loan to buy materials for dental treatments which will allow her to offer a better service to her customers and increase her level of income. With this she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for dental treatments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit (cowshed).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a crop of sorghum.

loans.name: Aikokul

texts.ru: Айкокул, 24 года, не замужем, детей нет. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает бухгалтером, получая заработную плату в размере 16,233 сом (KGS). По характеру она: ответственная, спокойная и целеустремленная. Айкокул решила сделать пристройку к дому- летнюю кухню, уже залит фундамент. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), чтобы купить пластиковые окна, двери, кирпичи.  Айкокул является участником группы "Гулсара", в которой еще состоят 2 человека, всего их 3. Свои доходы она будет откладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Aikokul is 24 years old and single without children. She has a specialized secondary education and works as a bookkeeper, receiving wages of 16,233 som (KGS). By character, she is responsible, calm and determined. Aikokul decided to build an extension to her home: a summer kitchen, and she has already poured the foundation. Therefore, she applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), to purchase plastic windows, doors, and bricks. Aikokul is a member of the "Gulsara" loan group, which consists of two old people, for a total of three.

She will invest her income in further improving living conditions.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows, doors, and bricks to build a kitchen near her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with five children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 14 years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

She generates additional income from selling charcoal stoves. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality. She resides in the family house and they have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen operates a shop at her local market to earn an income. She has been in this business for the last 11 years, working seven days a week. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation, which increases her operational costs.  She earns additional income from selling piped water and by operating a beauty salon. 

Allen lives in Kampala. She and her husband have four children, two of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family lives in a house that has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 900,000 Uganda shillings in order to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, crates of soda, and peas. Her goal is to buy a plot of land for farming.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, beans, crates of soda, and peas

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 22-year-old, single woman. She lives with her parents and one sibling, who is still attending school. Her father is the main income provider for the family. She opened a beauty salon in her town two years ago to help her father financially. She is a very talented person and she provides her clients with her brilliant hairdressing and beauty services. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to buy new chairs for her business. She is well known in her region and neighboring towns by her good reputation. She states that she is very sure this loan will help her to develop her work and to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy new chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Sofia
