texts.en:
Sofia sells clothing items to the people of her immediate community to earn her living. She has operated her business for the past 10 years. Her primary challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school. They live in a house that has both electricity and piped water. Sofia's greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Sofia decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business. With her Kes 50,000 loan funds, she intends to purchase bales of clothing to offer for sale. 

She dreams of expanding her enterprise into a boutique business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 43-year-old married mother of four children still attending school. She started her business by opening a small room in her home for vending cremes and perfumes, using her special selling skills and providing high-quality products. She also visits her clients based on their needs. She is well-known in her region for the unique products that she offers and for her friendly and adorable personality.

Today, Zahraa is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l, to increase her inventory to meet the needs of her clients and increase her income. She is very proud of having been able to develop her business in a short time and hopes to open her own shop in the near future.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cremes and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This borrower lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and they all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She is a mushroom farmer. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy cotton waste husks, mushroom seeds, and firewood. Her major challenges include seasonality and perishability of the mushrooms. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing for mushrooms, cotton waste husks, and fire wood.

loans.name: Fridah's Group

texts.en:
Fridah, age 40, is a maize farmer. She is the representative for a group of seven farmers in Kakamega South District. She has been farming for 19 years and is considered experienced and skilled in her work. 

Fridah is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she wanted to have access to quality training so that she can acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Fridah wanted to represent her group because she wishes to be more active in her community.

Fridah will use her loan funds to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Fridah hopes to be able to send her children to school. She and her husband have six children.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of three acres of land. Though Fridah chose not to request a solar light, four of the farmers in the group will each be receiving one as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Mwanarusi operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Khabiba

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Хабиба. Её 45 лет и она живет в городе Истарафшан. Хабиба женщина и мать двоих детей. У нее две дочери в возрасте 18 и 20 лет. Хабиба честная и ответственная женщина. Она занимается поваром в столовой уже 1 год. Ее место работы находится в городском больнице. Хабиба любить готовить разное блюдо. 
Сейчас Хабиба планирует параллельно заниматься животноводством. Она хочет начать свой бизнес. Хабиба обратилась за кредитом для купли несколько крупнорогатого скота. У нее есть коровник для скота, там она будет ухаживать о домашних животных. Хабиба так старается трудиться больше, чтобы зарабатывать и обеспечить семью. Вы можете помочь ей с финансовыми трудностями. Хабиба будет очень рада за Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This woman is called Khabiba. She is 45 years old and lives in the city of Istaravshan. Khabiba is the mother of two daughters, ages 18 and 20. She is an honest and responsible woman. She has worked as a cook at a cafeteria for a year already. She works in the city hospital and loves to prepare different dishes. 

Now Khabiba plans to raise livestock on the side. She wants to start her own business. Khabiba applied for a loan to buy a few head of cattle. She has a barn for the cattle and she will care for the animals there. Khabiba is trying hard to work more to earn money and provide for her family. You can help her with her financial difficulties. Khabiba will be very thankful for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start a new business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam operates a boutique where she sells second-hand clothing items. She has been engaged in this business for eight years and works seven days a week. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Mariam lives in Kampala with her husband and their three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. The family lives in a house that has access to both piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 700,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes to offer for sale. Her aspiration is to build permanent business premises.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is a 32-year-old married factory worker with two young children in her care. She has worked in the factory since 2013. Her husband is 29 years old, and he is also a factory worker. All of them live in the Kandal province in Cambodia.

Both Sandy and her husband can earn around USD 10 per day. She lacks the finances to buy more cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell, and therefore is requesting a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy more cows.

For her future plans, Sandy is going to save money to build a new proper house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell.

loans.name: Ermitania

texts.es:
La socia Ermitania tiene un negocio de internet, ella tiene computadoras y da servicio de internet, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de internet. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Ermitania, has an internet business. She has computers and provides internet service. She has been doing this for several years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to expand her internet business. She is asking for a loan to buy a computer.

She is happy to get this loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

Saumu decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married with two children who go to school. They live at their own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women’s wrap cloth) selling business. She sells from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas (women's wrap cloth) to sell.

loans.name: Fayze

texts.en:
Fayze is a 27-year-old single Lebanese woman living with her parents and one sibling, who is still attending school. Due to the bad financial conditions, she cooperates with her father, who is their main income provider.

Fayze started her own clothing sales business from home 10 years ago.  She sells a variety of clothes and has loyal clients who always look forward to her providing them with the latest trendy fashions at good prices.

Today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the new fashion. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and thus her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is an 18-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and only child. She has worked as a private teacher since 2011. She likes her occupation because she feels that she is helping students to get the needed education. She has arranged a special room in her house where she receives her students and equipped it with required materials and supplies.

Her husband is an employee in a local company, and they cooperate to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, Zahraa is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop and printer machine to improve her teaching skills.

She is very positive about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop and printer machine.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is a 50-year-old, proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Judith has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Judith described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Judith’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's Group is made up of six farmers in Kakamega South District. Sarah, age 36, is the group leader. She has been a farmer for four years and is often referred to as a very hard-working individual. She joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and reports that she has noticed significant life changes since then, particularly since she is now consistently able to adequately feed her family. Sarah and her husband have two children.

This year, Sarah will not only receive fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now her children will be able to study during the dark hours.

In addition to Sarah's solar light, the group will receive sufficient farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Henrieta's Group

texts.en:
Henrieta is 37 years old and has five children. She is a group leader, and is representing her group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. Henrieta has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Henrieta also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Henrieta's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Violet is representing her group of eight farmers in Kakamega South District, and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Violet has been a farmer for 20 years, and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs, but also two solar lights, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Violet is planning to buy a goat.

Violet’s Group will plant a total of 3.75 acres, and between them they will receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Sareang's Group

texts.en:
Sareang, age 38, is a rice farmer. She lives in a rural area in the Santok district of Kampong Thom province. She and her husband have four children. 
 
This is the third loan for Sareang’s VisionFund group, which consists of six members. Sareang is the leader of the group.

She will use her loan portion to build a private toilet for her family. She is grateful to be able to improve her family's health in this way.

loans.use: to build a private toilet for her family

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is the group leader for a group of eight farmers in Kakamega South District. She joined One Acre Fund in 2011, and she has decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers to others in the community. 

With a portion of this loan, Mary will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. Mary plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school. She and her husband have two children.

In total, Mary’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of four acres of land. They will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new bicycle, a thermoflask box, an umbrella, and additional ice cream for her husband's ice cream business.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat is 63 years old and lives in Ang Snuol, a district that is within Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been married since 1980 and has two sons and three daughters. Four of her children are married and some are garment factory workers.

For the past thirteen years Yat and her husband have made a living as farmers. Her husband has also raised cattle for the past 22 years. Yat is applying for a 1,500 USD loan through MAXIMA to buy more cows. She said that the cows will “earn her more income so she can support the family better.” She promises to pay her loan back on time.

loans.use: To buy more cows.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Sr. Antonio é casado maritalmente e pai de um  filho com 3 anos de idade, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema a partir de conversa com colegas de trabalho no mercado que são clientes, este é seu primeiro financiamento com a Hluvuku, com este pretende comprar 3 caixas de paradaise rum, 3 caixas de paradaise gin, 3 caixas de paradaise wisk e 5 caixas de tipo tinto para revenda. 
Tem como maior desafio fazer seu negocio crescer e como sonho ter uma viatura para que lhe ajude a transportar sua mercadoria dos vários pontos que a compra para revender.
texts.en: Antonio is married and has one three-year-old son. He came to know about Hluvuku-Adsema from a conversation with work colleagues from the market who are clients. This is his first loan with Hluvuku; with it he plans to buy three cases of Paradise rum, three cases of Paradise gin, three cases of Paradise Whisky, and five cases of Tipo Tinto rum to sell in his store. His main challenge is making his business grow and his dream is to have a car to make it easier for him to transport his merchandise between his various suppliers.

loans.use: to buy three cases of Paradise rum, three cases of Paradise gin, three cases of Paradise Whisky, and five cases of Tipo Tinto rum to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother of five children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, her elderly parents. Ruth resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills. 

Ruth has a business which sells used clothing. She has been in this business for four years. She works six days a week at the market and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to import used clothes and to become a wholesaler.

She applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Melchor

texts.es:
El socio Melchor se dedica al negocio de agricultura, el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra café y platanos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Melchor works in the farming business. He has a plot of farm land where he grows coffee beans and banana trees. He works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. 

Melchor has been in this business for many years and things are going well for him. His dream is to grow his farming business. He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

He is happy about the loan and he promises to follow his repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years Mwanasha has owned a food stall where she sells her wares to neighbors and town dwellers. Both seasonality and transportation to her stall are her major business challenges.

Mwanasha is applying for a 25,000 KES loan through Yehu to restock her stall with such goods as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil. She dreams of developing her stall into a modern café.

loans.use: to restock her food stall

loans.name: Kittys Aracely

texts.es:
Kittys, está soltera, es madre de tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad, ella se ha dedicado a trabajar vendiendo ropa para ambos sexos y atendiendo su pupusería, es así como ha logrado criar a sus hijos, su negocio tiene varios años de estar en el mercado y trabaja sola.
Invertirá en prendes de vestir con la tendencia de la moda actual y materia prima para elaborar la venta de pupusas tales como: harina, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, etc., le permitirá continuar realizando su actividad económica, atender mejor a sus clientes y generar nuevos ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son reducir sus deudas y enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar para que ellos puedan defenderse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Kittys is single and is a mother of three grown up children. She has earned a living selling clothes for men and women and looking after her stuffed tortilla shop. It is in this way that she has been able to bring up her children. Her business has been in the market for several years and she works alone.
She will buy clothes that are of the current fashion trends and also raw ingredients to make and sell stuffed tortillas such as: flour, cream cheese, crackling, oil, etc. This will allow her to continue with her economic activity, to tend to her customers better and the create more income. 
Her aspirations are to reduce her debts and teach her children how to work so that they can look after themselves and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy clothes of the current trends and ingredients to make stuffed tortillas.

loans.name: Emmah's Group

texts.en:
Emmah is 67 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by seven farmers in the Kakamega south district of Kenya. 

Emmah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Emmah also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Emmah's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mourice's Group

texts.en:
Mourice is 55 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Mourice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mourice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Mourice's Group will be able to receive a total of three solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Grupo Agrícola Pajoca Sur 1 Group

texts.es:
Isabela (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa color rosado fusia) es una mujer de 27 años de edad, esta juntado con su esposo con el que tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 5 y 7 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Isabela con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica al cultivo de café y banano a pocos metros de su vivienda, ella tiene 5 años de realizar esta actividad, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también vende trajes típicos en la plaza de su comunidad.
Isabela hace algún tiempo sembró unas cuerdas de café que ahora ya necesitan de su mantenimiento, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, por tal motivo a organizado a un grupo de señoras con las mismas necesidades para juntas solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá comprando fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra.
El gran sueño de Isabela es poder instalar un local para su negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica, además ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabela (the first on the right in this photograph in the fuchsia pink blouse) is a 27 year old woman. She has a husband and has two children with him who are five and seven years old. This modest family live in the community of Sololá.
With the desire to earn an income and support her husband with the household expenses, Isabela grows coffee and bananas a few metres from her house. She has been doing this for five years, however, in order to improve her income she also sells traditional outfits in the square in her community.
Some time ago, Isabela planted some lines of coffee plant and this now needs to be maintained. However one of the difficulties that she has is that she does not have enough money. For this reason she has organised a group of woman with the same needs so as to ask for a loan together which she will invest in fertilisers and paying for labour costs.
Her biggest dream is to be able to have premises for her business of buying and selling traditional clothes, furthermore she wants to extend her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and pay for labour.

loans.name: Eav's Group

texts.en:
Eav is originally from and lives in a rural area of Stoung District of Kampong Thom Province. She is 49 years old and a widowed mother of three children, who are all dependent on her. Her family makes its income from farming rice, feeding pigs and selling groceries. She is able to earn around 30,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

This is the fourth loan with VisionFund for Eav’s group, which consists of three members. As a leader of the group, she applies for this loan with the intention of using her loan portion to build a private toilet for her family. She hopes that she will be able to earn more money in the future and is looking forward to having a good small toilet for use within her family.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UN JOVEN EMPRENDEDOR QUE CON SU ESFUERZO HA SALIDO ADELANTE PARA PODER APOYAR A SUS PADRES, ACTUALMENTE LABORA EN UNA EMPRESA DONDE HA RECIBIDO BURLAS Y HUMILLACIONES CONSTANTES POR MOTIVO DE SU DENTADURA, ES POR ESO QUE ASPIRA A INICIAR UN TRATAMIENTO QUE LE HAGA AUMENTAR SU AUTOESTIMA Y SEGURIDAD EN SI MISMO.
texts.en: This enterprising young man has been able to get ahead so that he can support his parents.  He currently works at a company where he has been teased and humiliated because of his teeth.  For this reason, he hopes to start treatment so that he can improve his self-esteem and have security in his self-worth.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Loan is 51 years old and lives with her two children and husband. Her husband works as a driver. For the past six years Loan has been running a business selling clothes to earn income to support her family. Loan is the leader of a six-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, Loan is third from the right, wearing glasses and a striped blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Loan is requesting a loan to purchase better quality and a greater variety of clothing products to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality and a greater variety of clothing products to sell.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwanarusi sells cashew nuts to her neighbors and passersby at the market. Seasonality is a major challenge for her.

Mwanarusi decided to join Yehu so she could take out a loan to develop her business. She is applying for 30,000 KES to buy seven sacks of cashew nuts to sell. Her ambition is to buy a rental house for the income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and does not have any additional family members. She rents a house with both electricity and running water, and her major monthly expenses are rent and food. 

For the past seven years, Janat has been selling charcoal at the market. She works seven days a week. She earns additional income from selling fried cassava. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Janat is requesting UGX 700,000 through MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her dream is to grow her business to the point where she would be able to buy land. She also hopes to own a delivery van to ease her transportation issues.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Это Махбуба. Она жительница района Рудаки. У нее большая семья. Махбуба в районе живет вместе мужем и детьми. У Махбубе 6 детей. 4 дочки и 2 сына. Дочкам 33, 28, 26 и 17 лет. Сыновьям 30 и 24 лет. Махбуба ответственная и честная женщина. Она 28 лет занимается бизнесом. Махбуба продает чапан, джурабы, национальные платки, тюбетейки и женские штаны. Она перевозит товаров с Узбекистан. Махбуба планирует, перевозит больше товаров, чтобы расширить деятельность. Но для совершения данной операции у нее нет денежных средств, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.Махбуба заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
This is Mahbuba. She is a resident of the Rudaki region. She has a large family. Mahbuba lives together with her husband and children in the region. Mahbuba has six children; four daughters and two sons. The daughters are 33, 28, 26 and 17 years old. The sons are 30 and 24 years. 

Mahbuba is a responsible and honest woman. She has been in business for 28 years. Mahbuba sells chapans (traditional coats), woolen socks, traditional dresses, tubeteika (traditional caps) and women's pants. She transports the goods from Uzbekistan. 

Mahbuba plans to transport in more goods, in order to expand her business. She does however not have enough money to do this. For this reason she applied for a loan. Mahbuba extends her thankfulness in advance.

loans.use: to transport more goods and expand her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is married with four children, three in school. She has a market business she has operated for three years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal, bunches of green bananas, cassava, cabbages, tomatoes and onions. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to educate her children to the university level. She resides in the family house where they have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal, bunches of green bananas, cassava, cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker in a local company. For three years, Tuyen has run a general store in her community.

Tuyen would like a loan to purchase household items and beverages to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase household items and beverages to restock her store

loans.name: Vuong

texts.en: Vuong, 30, is married with two children and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Vuong sells motorcycle parts. He started his business to cover his expenses and to generate income to raise his children. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more motorcycle parts and accessories to sell. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his stock. He hopes that through the loan, he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in the future.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycle parts and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a 47-year-old married woman. She lives with her three children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have run a business sewing clothes for five years, 
Lan would like a loan to purchase a sewing machine. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a business making springs, 
Linh would like a loan to purchase steel material in bulk for making many kinds of springs. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family

loans.use: to purchase steel materials in bulk for making many kinds of springs

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en:
Phorn is a 44-year-old married mother of a dependent child who is in school. She lives in a rural area located in the Santok district of Kampong Thom province. Growing rice has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years. To earn extra income, she also sells groceries. She can earn around 55,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs. 
Phorn’s Group consists of four members and this is her fourth micro loan with VisionFund. The previous loan helped her family improve their living conditions. Now, Phorn is leading this group to apply for a loan and will use her portion to build a private toilet for her family. She hopes that she this loan will help her family have a better, healthier standard of living.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

loans.name: Adelide's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Adelide, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is married and the mother of four children, and is known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Adelide joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvest season, Adelide plans to save more money for the future.

Between the eight farmers in Adelide's Group, a total of four acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Donia

texts.pt:
Sra. Donia é mãe solteira de três filhos, vive sozinha,  os dois filhos mais novos vivem com o pai e a mais velha encontra se já a viver maritalmente. A cliente conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema a partir de uma amiga e já teve três créditos com a Hluvuku.  Com o presente financiamento pretende comprar 20 sacos de cimento, 20 varões 8, 15 carinhas de pedra, 1 kg de pregos e pagar mão-de-obra ao pedreiro. 
O seu maior sonho é ter sua casa e a nível profissional pretendi ver seu negócio crescer. O seu maior desafio é construir sua casa.
texts.en: Donia is a single mother of three children. She lives alone, as her two youngest children live with their father and her oldest is married and lives on her own. She heard of Hluvuku-Adsema from a friend and has taken out three loans with Hluvuku. With this loan, she plans to to buy 20 sacks of cement, 20 pieces of rebar, 15 loads of rock, and one kilo of nails, and to pay for construction labor. Her greatest dream is to have her own house and, in terms of her professional goals, to see her business grow. Her main challenge is in building her house.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of cement, 20 pieces of rebar, 15 loads of rock, and one kilo of nails, and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Oluftamo

texts.ru: Олуфтамо 41 лет. Она жительница города под названием Куляб. У нее не очень большая семья. Олуфтамо живет вместе мужем, тестю, свекровью и четверым детям.  Сыну 14 лет, а дочкам 16, 14,13 и 7 лет. Дети учатся в средней школе. Олуфтамо более  5 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды.  Она продвигает деятельность матери. Этой деятельности ей нравится сшить национальную женскую одежду. Олуфтамо обратилась за кредитом, чтобы ремонтировать дом. За счет кредита она купить материалов для ремонта. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Олуфтамо верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Oluftamo is 41 years old. She lives in the town of Kulob. Oluftamo has a medium-size family. She lives together with her husband, in-laws and four [?] children. Her son is 14 years old, and her daughters are 16, 14, 13 and 7 years, respectively. Her children attend secondary school. Oluftamo has been sewing traditional women’s clothing for over five years. She is continuing her mother’s business. She enjoys sewing ethnic clothing. 

Oluftamo has applied for a loan to renovate her house. She will use her loan to buy construction materials. Because of lack of funds she has turned to you for a loan. Oluftamo puts her trust in you and your support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 43-year-old married mother of two children, who has been working as a tailor since 2005 to assist her husband in covering their family's living needs. She is a hardworking lady, with a very good reputation in her region with the special talents she has in her domain.

Hanaa is insisting on increasing her business income and developing her business properly, but her income is barely enough to assist her husband in covering their family's needs, so she can't save for future use. Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy tailoring tools and the means to trade as an additional income business parallel to her tailoring business in a way that she'll diversify the products and services provided to her current and future customers.

This is Hanaa's first loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and she is very anxious to expand her working sector.

loans.use: To buy tailoring tools and the means to trade as an additional income business parallel to her tailoring business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a boutique selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for the last two years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more materials for making African clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy an electric sewing machine. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making African clothes

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc que se encuentra ubicado en la región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, que es una bebida típica de su región que se extrae de la caña de azúcar, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 4 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el mismo y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a sus equipos de destilación asi como la ampliación de sus áreas de cultivo de caña de azúcar para la destilación de aguardiente. Con esto Rene espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio y ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rene is 32 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their four children in the Callayuc district, located in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The people of this region engage in farming, commerce, and raising animals. 

Rene distills aguardiente, a typical alcoholic drink of his region extracted from sugar cane. He has been engaged in this business for four years so he has experience with it and has good references in his district. He is asking for a loan so that he can make repairs and do maintenance on his distillation equipment. He also wants to increase the area of his sugar cane fields for distilling aguardiente. Rene hopes to improve his business' productivity and offer a better quality product to his customers. This will generate more income leading to a better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and perform maintenance on his distillation equipment and to expand his sugar cane growing area.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with one child and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. She has run business of sewing clothes for eight years, 
Tuyet would like a loan to purchase a sewing machine. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 49-year-old woman who resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family, which consists of one son and two daughters as well.

Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years. He provides his patrons with good service and fresh food meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market, so a great many shop keepers come into his restaurant to eat delicious food.

He needs some crockery and fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard, Nazeeran contacted Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC issued the loan to Nazeeran for the development of her husband's restaurant business.

Nazeeran is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crockery and fresh food items for her husband's restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new Juki sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Regina has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Regina also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Regina's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Agathia

texts.en:
Agathia is a 39-year-old married mother of two children, who has fourteen years of experience in chocolate designs and special occasions souvenirs and themes. She loves her business domain and works hard to develop it as much as she can.

Agathia is a main financial supporter to her husband in covering their family's increasing needs, so most of her business income is invested in covering the family's increasing expenses. Thus, for this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business in a well managed way.

Through her acquired loan, Agathia will increase her business merchandise with special Easter chocolates, souvenirs, themes and designs to attract customers' attention and reply to their requests. This is her first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower and she hopes that this experience will proceed for future business expansion deals.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special Easter chocolates, souvenirs, themes and designs to attract customers' attention and reply to their requests.

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.ru:
Тахмина 24 летняя жительница не большого района под названием Рудаки. В Таджикистане многие улицы, районы и города переименовывают в честь великих писателей и ученых таджикского народа. Рудаки был назван в честь основателя классической литературы. 
 Тахмина замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее муж работает таксистом. Тахмина все свое свободное время тратить на детей, домашние дела и если у нее останется время занимается шитьем. Ей тяжело брать заказы на шитье, потому что у нее остается очень мало времени. Но она старается, принести в дом источник дохода и помочь мужу. Тахмина обратилась за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать дом. Она заботится о своих детях и хочет, чтоб они жили в безопасных условиях. Их дом срочно нуждается в ремонте. Поддержите ее.
texts.en:
Takhmina is a 24 years old resident of the small region called Rudaki. In Tajikistan many streets, regions and cities were renamed in honor of the great writers and scientists of the Tajik people. Rudaki was named in honor of the founder of classical literature. 

Takhmina is married and has two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Takhmina uses all her time on her children and household chores, and if she has additional time she works with sewing. It is difficult for her to take orders for sewing, because she does not have a lot of time left. However, she tries to bring a source of income to their home and help her husband. 

Takhmina applied for a loan in order to renovate their home. She cares for her children and would like them to live in a safe environment. Their home urgently needs renovation. Please help her.

loans.use: to renovate her house and purchase building materials

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира 26 летняя молодая девушка. Она жительница города Кулоб. Мунира разведена с мужем, и она живет вместе отцом и мамой. Мунира красивая и талантливая девушка. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Ей научила ее сестра 3 года назад. Сейчас Мунира хорошо справляется своей работой. У нее есть свои клиенты. Мунира хочет расширить деятельнось. Она просит кредит для покупки ткани и швейные принадлежности. Мунира трудиться, и зарабатывает, чтобы помочь родителям обеспечить семью.
texts.en:
Munira is a young woman of 26 years. She is a resident of the city of Kulob. Munira is divorced from her husband and lives together with her father and mother. 

Munira is a beautiful and talented girl. She works with sewing women's clothing. Her sister taught her this three years ago. Currently Munira manages her work well. She has her own customers. 

Munira would like to expand her business. She requests a loan to purchase fabric and sewing accessories. Munira works hard and earns money to help her parents provide for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and sewing accessories to expand her business

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз 26 летняя жительница не большого района Шахринав. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Муж Дилафруз работает водителем. Она принимает заказы на шитье одежды на дому. Дилафруз старается работать еще больше, чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Дилафруз давно мечтала приобрести новую швейную машинку, но по сей день не смогла накопить достаточной суммы. Дилафруз решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы собрать не достающую часть денег и купить желаемую швейную машинку. Она верит, что ей помогут, и заранее выражает благодарность.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a 26 years old resident of the small region of Shahrinav. She is married and has a child. Dilafruz' husband works as a driver. She takes orders for sewing clothing at home. Dilafruz strives to work more in order to help her husband provide for the family. 

Dilafruz has long dreamed of purchasing a new sewing machine. She has however not been able to save up a sufficient amount of money for this. She decided to apply for a loan to collect the amount she is missing and purchase her desired sewing machine. She trusts that you will help her and extends her thankfulness in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
Annah is 60 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Annah is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Annah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Annah’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 49 years old. She is married to Francis, who is a farmer, and they are blessed with two children named Kelvin, 23, and Winnie.

She has had a Dairy business for 20 years, currently earning KES 40,000. She has borrowed KES 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya as her second loan, after successfully paying back the previous loan. She will be using the loan to purchase animal feed, animal licks, pesticides and three tin milk storing containers.

She hopes the anticipated profit will help her to buy food for the family, pay school fees for her children, provide medical care, expand the current business and repay her loan too.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a flourishing dairy farm, secure more markets for her dairy products and enjoy a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed, animal licks, pesticides, and three tin milk storing containers.

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Hellen, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Hellen will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Hellen plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total Hellen’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 3.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, 48, is married to Tabitha, and they are blessed with two children, 22-year-old Benson and eighteen-year-old Charity. For the past fifteen years he and his wife have been farmers and earn a monthly income of 55,000 KES.

Francis took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through VisionFund Kenya. He has now borrowed 65,000 KES to buy animal feed and fertilizer for his crops. With the anticipated profits he will be able to pay school fees for his children as well as repay his loan.

Francis’ ambitions are to have a well-developed farm, secure more markets for his farm products and enjoy an improved life with his family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, vive en casa propa con su esposo y sus hijos, hace 10 años inicio a vender tortillas y leña para tener ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, tiene un horario de trabajo de siete de la mañana cinco de la tarde.
El crédito le servirá para comprar leña, maíz y cal, tendrá mercadería suficiente para poder disminuir las necesidades de sus clientes, pretende aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias para subsistir con su familia.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio y popular.
texts.en: Marta lives in her own home with her husband and sons.  Ten years ago, she began selling tortillas and firewood to have income and support her husband with household expenses.  She works from 7am to 5pm.  The loan will allow her to purchase firewood, corn and lime, so that she'll have enough merchandise to be able to meet the needs of her customers.  She intends to increase her sales and to have a better income to sustain her family.  She dreams of having a larger and more popular business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn and lime, so that she has enough to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 50, is a mother of one son and two daughters. Her son owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, etc.

These important items will enable him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, he has not been able to purchase them.

Therefore, his mother, Razia, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her son. He will purchase the items he needs with the help of this loan amount. Razia is feeling happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kava lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring materials for her son's tailoring work

loans.name: San Juanico El Alto Group

texts.es:
La comunidad donde se conformó el grupo llamado “San Juanico el Alto” se caracteriza por su vegetación. Desde lo alto de las colinas, los habitantes pueden disfrutar de una vista increíble del conjunto de poblaciones cercanas. La mayoría de las personas en este lugar se dedican a hacer artesanías de barro como ollas y macetas, así como figuras de yeso. 
Guadalupe es una de las integrantes, madre de tres hijos. Desde pequeña, le llamaba mucho la atención peinar y cortar el cabello así que cuando tuvo la oportunidad, estudió cultura de belleza durante 2 años. Hace diez años, logró abrir su salón de belleza y aunque al inició fue difícil por la falta de experiencia y clientes, ella siguió trabajando para darse a conocer.
Recuerda que el primer préstamo de VisionFund y sus ahorros le ayudaron a comprar el mobiliario para su salón que tiene instalado en la sala de su casa. Guadalupe necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar una rasuradora y tenazas para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio.  “Estoy realmente agradecida por el apoyo que recibo” comenta acerca de las pequeñas inversiones que ha podido hacer para mejorar su actividad.
A pesar de ofrecer el servicio en su casa, muchas veces Guadalupe también va a casa de sus clientes para hacer servicios especiales para eventos como bodas y XV Años. Una de sus hijas está siguiendo sus pasos y siempre le ayuda con los peinados más modernos. 
El sueño de Guadalupe es poder tener un local en el centro de su comunidad, ella vive a 30 minutos de este lugar y ha observado que podría tener más clientes en este lugar y trabajará por cumplir su meta. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque del municipio donde habitan los integrantes, Guadalupe es quien tiene las botas y la blusa azul*
texts.en:
The community where the group called “San Juanico el Alto” was formed is known for its plant life. From the tops of the hills, the inhabitants can enjoy an incredible view of all of the surrounding towns. Most people in this area work making handicrafts from clay, such as cooking pots and planters, as well as plaster figures. 

Guadalupe is one of the group members and the mother of three children. Since she was little, she has always been interested in styling and cutting hair. Thus, when she had the opportunity, she went to beauty school for 2 years. Ten years ago, she was able to open her own beauty salon, and although things were difficult at the beginning due to her lack of experience and customers, she kept on working to make a name for herself. 

She recalls that the first loan from VisionFund along with her savings helped her to buy the furnishings for her salon, which is set up in the living room of her house. Guadalupe needs a new loan to buy an electric shaver and tongs so that she can continue to offer good service. "I am truly grateful for the support I am receiving," she comments with regard to the small investments she has been able to make in order to improve her business. 

Although she offers her service in her home, Guadalupe also often goes to her customers' homes to provide special services for events such as weddings and 15th birthday parties. One of her daughters is following in her footsteps and always helps her with the most modern hairstyles. 

Guadalupe's dream is to have a shop in the center of her town. She lives 30 minutes away from there, and she has observed that she would be able to have more customers in that location. She will work to achieve her goal. 

*The photo was taken in the park of the municipality where the members live. Guadalupe is the one wearing boots and a blue blouse.

loans.use: to buy a new electric shaver and more tongs for her salon.

loans.name: Dúo Girasoles De Magdalena Sacatepequez Group

texts.es:
Dúo Girasoles de Magdalena Sacatepequez
Este dúo está formado por doña Rosa Maribel, ella tiene 25 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de consumo diario, como sopas, aguas gaseosas, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, pollo, pastas, arroz, frijol, desde ya hace varios años en su tienda ubicada en su domicilio, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de arroz, frijol, negro y rojo, aceite de comida, detergente en polvo y jabón, su mayor deseo es surtir su tienda y tener todos los productos necesarios para sus clientes.
texts.en: This is the "Dúo Girasoles de Magdalena Sacatepequez" group. One of the members is Rosa Maribel. She is 25 years old and works selling daily consumption products, such as soups, carbonated waters, sugar, oil, sweets, chicken, pasta, rice, beans. For many years, she has been selling these at her store, located in her house. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, black and red beans, cooking oil, powder detergent and soap. Her biggest dream is to stock up her store and have all the needed products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy daily consumption products.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, ha mejorado mucho la venta de tortillas, tienen ingresos suficientes para ir cubriendo el pago de la deuda y las necesidades que surgen en su hogar, por el momento no ha tenido dificultades para mantenerse trabajando.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar una cocina industrial, le será de ayuda para aumentar la producción de tortillas y así cubrir las nuevas demandas.
texts.en:
Blanca has greatly improved her tortilla sales and has sufficient income to cover the debt payment and home expenses. So far, she has not had difficulties to keep working.

She is requesting a new loan to buy an industrial kitchen. It will help increase the tortillas production and, therefore, meet new demands.

loans.use: to buy an industrial kitchen, which will help increase the tortillas production and meet new demands.

loans.name: Bandakumar Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Dhanai, the lady standing first from left, 39, is a married woman who lives in a village in Koraput district, Odisha with her three teenage children, all of whom are currently studying. Dhanai primarily does stitching work to run the household and support her children's education. However, with the growing needs of her children, she wants to supplement her income. Dhanai needs a loan of 18,000 INR to start a vegetable selling business. She wants to use this money to buy vegetables from the wholesale market and sell them from her home. Setting up the shop at her home will be economical and also allow her to continue her stitching work in parallel. As these are items required daily, there is lot of demand for them. Dhanai is confident of a good margin of profit from her business idea of selling vegetables. 

Dhanai, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR, which she will use to start her vegetable selling business. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables from the wholesale market and sell them from her home

loans.name: Bandakumar Shg-C Group

texts.en: Janaki lives with her husband, two daughters and a son in a village in Odisha. Her husband works as a laborer to support their family. For the last eight years, Janaki has been supplementing their family income by running a small grocery shop. From their joint earnings, the couple also support their three children's education and hope for their brighter future. Janaki runs the business by sourcing her supplies from the wholesale dealer and sells with some profit margin. As there is no other similar business in their area, she has been making a good profit from this venture. She now seeks financial support to expand the business and plans to add more varieties of grocery items to her shop. She is confident this will widen her customer base in the area and help her take a step towards her dream of converting the shop to a big general shop. Janaki, along with her group, has requested this loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy edible oil, sugar, and rice in bulk. She is grateful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy edible oil, sugar, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Bandakumar Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Daimti, the lady standing first from left, is a young entrepreneur, 34, who wishes to take her first loan of 18,000 INR to start a breakfast stall at Jeypore in Koraput district, Odisha, India. Daimti plans to buy utensils and raw materials with the start-up capital. As a homemaker and mother of two boys, Daimti has experience in preparing the items that she now hopes to sell in her stall. She also hopes that this will enable her to contribute monetarily to the household's finances, which are presently solely dependent on her husband who earns about 60,000 INR annually as a laborer. 

Daimti, along with her group, has requested this loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy utensils and raw materials to start a food stall. She hopes to do well in her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and raw materials to start a food stall.

loans.name: Bandakumar Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Rukamani, the lady standing on the left is a woman who has been running a small food center for the last seven years to manage her household expenses. She struggles hard to support her family out of this income. Her family includes her two sons and a daughter. Her sons have been employed somewhere to earn some additional income for their family. Rukamani now wishes to scale up the venture by increasing her volume of business in the area. For this purpose, she seeks financial support and plans to use it for buying grocery supplies in bulk from the wholesaler as well as some utensils, etc. to serve more customers and increase her earnings from this venture. 

Rukamani, along with her group, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, flour, spices, and biscuits in bulk. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, flour, spices, and biscuits in bulk

loans.name: Bandakumar Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Sanamati, the woman standing left in the photo, 25, lives with her husband and daughter in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha. Her husband is a daily wage worker and both of them have worked hard all these years to ensure a college degree for their daughter. For this reason, Sanamati has been running a grocery shop from her home for seven years to generate income. She has taken loans previously from Peoples Forum and has a very successful repayment history. Currently, Sanamati is seeking a loan of 18,000 INR to invest in her shop. She wants to add oils, pulses and other condiments to expand her business. She often loses money due to price fluctuations in the wholesale prices. Having a lump sum capital will equip her to buy items when prices are more favorable. 

Sanamati, along with her group, has requested this loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy oils, pulses and other condiments to expand her business. She would like to say thanks to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy oils, pulses and other condiments to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to improve the sanitary conditions of her home's bathroom.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 42 años de edad,  padre soltero con un hijo de quince años el cual estudia en secundaria, es originario de Managua. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar, por falta de recursos económicos y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.  
Gracias a sus ganas de Salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  una carnicería como es la venta de carne de cerdo. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. Él tiene quince años de desempeñar dicho negocio,  el cual ha sido su sustento y el de su familia actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto.  Su rutina de trabajo es de una diez horas diarias ofreciendo su la carne de cerdos, y brindar de dicha forma una buena atención al cliente y cubrir la demanda de los clientes. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos  Carlos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Carlos, 42, is a single father with a 15 year-old son who attends high school.  He is a native of Managua.  He is known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal success.  Unfortunately, he was not able to study due to a lack of financial resources.  From a young age, he needed to work to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to his desire to get ahead, he has a butcher shop where he sells meat such as pork.  This business is located in one of the markets in the town.  Carlos has had this business for 15 years; this is how he supports his family, and he does this work gladly.  His routine is to work 10 hours a day in his business offering his pork meat for sale, providing good customer service to meet the demands of his customers.  With this loan he will invest in working capital, stocking his business so that in the near future he can increase his income.  

Carlos thanks the Kiva lenders who are providing assistance to low income people from poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a means of decent work.

loans.use: to buy and sell pork

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío del Yambolon, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, que funciona hace más de 03 años, por su experiencia y su buen servicio cuenta con bastante clientela, también se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a los cultivos de café y maíz. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miguel is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of Yambolon, a rural area of the district of Pomahuaca. Its population works in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. The village is located in the province of Jaén, belonging to the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands. Miguel has had a grocery store in his home for more than three years. Because of his experience and the good service he offers, Miguel has quite a lot of customers. He also works in farming, specially growing coffee and corn. He has requested a loan to buy merchandise to stock up his store and in this way earn more income for his family, which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock up his store.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón, está organizando todo lo necesario para poder cultivar maíz en esta temporada, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas realizar los trabajos agrícolas, espera contar con los recursos económicos necesarios y administrarlos de la mejor manera.
La ayuda del crédito anterior le ha permitido a Simón poder tener una cosecha abundante y mejores ingresos, su familia vive en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en: Simón is organizing all that is needed to be able to cultivate corn this season. He needs a new loan to buy agricultural inputs to do farming work. He hopes to have the necessary financial resources and to manage them in the best way. The support of the previous loan has allowed Simón to have an abundant harvest and better income. His family is living in optimal conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to do farming work.

loans.name: Farides

texts.es:
Farides es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos, ella toda su vida se entregó a su familia, se desempeñó como ama de casa, pero al ver que en su hogar carecían de algunas cosas y que el dinero en muchas ocasiones no alcanzaba, decidió en el año 2014 iniciar con un negocio propia el cual es la venta de pescado.
Ella quiere motivar su empresa, mejorar sus ventas, sacar su familia, adelante, soñar con reparar su hogar, con tener carro, vendedoras, ser exitosa  es por eso que quiere solicitar un préstamo, para ser más agresiva en la oferta, cubrir más partes, despertar el día de mañana y encontrarse con que lo logro, con que es exitosa.
texts.en:
Farides is a 55-year old woman who is married and has 4 children. She has devoted her life to her family and worked as a housewife, but decided to start her fish-selling business in 2014. They lacked a few things at home and money often was not enough.

She now wants to improve her business, increase sales and support her family. She dreams with repairing her home, having a car and being successful, which is why she is requesting a loan. She wants to offer more products and to wake up every day knowing she is being successful.

loans.use: to buy a selection of fish.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene solo un hijo.

Vilma, vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de la ciudad.

Vilma, necesita el crédito para comprar más fruta para vender

Ella, sueña con darle una buena educación a su hijo e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma, 56 years old, studied through sixth grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She only has one son.

Vilma sells fruit and vegetables in the city's market.

Vilma needs the loan in order to buy more fruit to sell.

She dreams of giving her child a good education and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo es un hombre que ha dedicado toda su vida al trabajo, y sigue en ello, mientras tenga fuerza y salud seguirá trabajando para generar ingresos para el sustento y ayuda a sus familiares, es un hombre separado, pero con su ex-esposa llego a tener 4 hijos, los cuales apoyo en momentos difíciles y compartió igualmente los bellos acontecimientos en sus vidas.
Guillermo trabaja en una tienda de abarrotes, este hombre parece una máquina, dedica a su negocio 16 horas diarias, una exhaustiva jornada pero así se acostumbró a trabajar.
Su sueño a sus 60 años de edad es poder comprar una vivienda propia, y seguirá persiguiéndolo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, como lo son arroz, panela, huevos, bebidas, servilletas, papel higiénico, etc.
texts.en: Guillermo is a man who has worked his whole life, and he keeps on working as long as he has strength and health to generate income to support and help his relatives. He is separated, but with his ex-wife he had 4 children, whom he supported in difficult times and likewise shared the good events of their lives. Guillermo works at a grocery store. This man is like a machine: he devotes 16 hours every day to his business. It is an exhausting day, but this is how he got used to working. At 60 years of age, his dream is to be able to buy his own house, and he will keep following his dream. He is requesting a loan to buy basic products such as rice, panela (brown sugar cane), eggs, drinks, napkins, toilet paper, etc.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, panela (brown sugar cane), eggs, drinks, napkins, toilet paper, in order to stock up his business.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María, de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la carpintería, tienen un hijo, pero ninguno depende de ellos.

María y su esposo, trabajan en la carpintería desde hace 20 años, tienen mucha experiencia en la elaboración y comercialización de muebles.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar madera y materiales para la carpintería.

Ella sueña con tener una carpintería más grande y que su hijo estudie y sea profesional.
texts.en:
María, 65 years old, studied through second grade. She is married and her husband works in carpentry. They have a son, but he is not dependent on them.

María and her husband have worked in carpentry for 20 years. They have a lot of experience making and selling furniture.

She needs the loan in order to buy wood and carpentry materials.

She dreams of having a larger carpentry shop and that her son will study and become professional.

loans.use: to buy wood and carpentry materials

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Iris de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la pesca y agricultura, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solo él más grande estudia en la escuela.

Iris se ha dedicado a trabajar desde muy pequeña a la compra y venta de pescado fresco,  ya que su madre también se dedicaba a esta actividad, ella comprar temprano el pescado para salir temprano a vender, y en la época de invierno trabaja en agricultura junto a su pareja.

Este crédito le servirá para pagar el arrendamiento del terreno donde cultiva maíz y para preparar la tierra.

Sus planes son darles estudio a sus hijos y comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Iris, 34 years old, studied through 8th grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works in fishing and farming. They have 2 children, of which only the oldest study at school.

Iris has worked since she was very young buying and selling fresh fish, since her mother also did this work. She buys the fish early in order to go out early to sell, and in wintertime she works in farming with her partner.

She will use this loan to pay the rent on the land where she grows corn and to prepare the land.

Her plans are to give her children an education and to buy a piece of land to build her house.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where she grows corn and to prepare the land

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith is 59 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 13 farmers in the Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Judith has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009.
