This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to the best seed prices, and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Judith is requesting a loan to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seed and fertilizer to grow maize as well as to purchase a solar light. She is excited about purchasing a light as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Obtaining this loan means that Judith's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of nine acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and access cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bonface's Group

texts.en:
Bonface is 36 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Bonface has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Bonface also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Bonface's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Benito Andres

texts.es: Benito tiene 58 años y esta casado con Julia, siempre se han apoyado mutuamente y llevan mas de la mitad de su vida juntos. Benito vive en el distrito de Acari del departamento de Arequipa. Se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposa, Benito con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar un terreno agrícola y ahora han sembrado cebolla y quieren darle un mantenimiento, es por ello que solicitan el préstamo para pagar la limpieza de malas hierbas que aparecieron en su terreno a causa de las lluvias esto con la finalidad de asegurar la calidad de la cebolla orgánica. Ademas usara el préstamo para comprar abono orgánico mineral. Su único objetivo es  dar a sus clientes cebolla de calidad sin perder la esencia natural de su cultivo.
texts.en:
Benito, 58, is married to Julia.  They've always helped each other and they've been together for more than half their lives.  He lives in the district of Acari in the department of Arequipa.

Benito earns a living in agriculture with his wife.  He was able to buy a plot of land with a lot of effort.  Now they have planted onions and they want to take care of the crop.  For that reason he's requesting a loan to pay to get rid of the weeds that grew on his land because of all the rain.  He'll also use the loan to buy organic mineral soil amendments.

His only goal is to ensure the quality of his organic onion and to give his customers quality onions without losing the natural essence of his crop.

loans.use: to take care of his organic onion crop

loans.name: Nieves Violeta

texts.es:
Nieves es una mujer trabajadora de 46 años, goza de la compañía de sus 6 menores hijos, la mayoría en etapa escolar. Cuenta con la compañía de su esposo Alejandro, en quien siempre ha encontrado un apoyo incondicional. Se dedican a la producción de mantequilla, queso y otros productos lácteos orgánicos con su propio ganado vacuno que es alimentado con alfalfa orgánica.
Ellos en su localidad de Coracora que esta ubicada en Ayacucho, llevan mas de 20 años de experiencia en su trabajo y es por ello que los pobladores gustan de sus productos naturales orgánicos. Nieves solicita el préstamo para comprar semilla de alfalfa mejorada y de calidad; también dará mantenimiento a su pequeño terreno agrícola, comprara abono orgánico que venden en su propia localidad que es producido por el excremento de cuyes. Nieves en el futuro solo espera poder darle comodidad y estabilidad económica a su gran familia.
texts.en:
Nieves, 46, is a hardworking woman.  She lives in the company of her six minor children, most of whom are of school age, and with her husband Alejandro, who has always provided unconditional support.

They earn a living producing butter, cheese, and other organic dairy products with their own dairy cows nourished with organic alfalfa.  They have more than 20 years of experience in their job in Coracora, which is located in Ayacucho.  The residents there like their natural organic products.

Nieves is requesting the loan to buy high-quality improved alfalfa seeds.  She's also going to perform maintenance on her small plot of land and buy organic soil amendments made from guinea pig manure and sold in her own community.

For the future, Nieves hopes only to be able to provide her large family with comfort and economic stability.

loans.use: to buy high-quality improved alfalfa seed

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam is responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for five years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his Taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Shabnam has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Shabnam's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Shabnam  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Shabnam is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to repair his taxi

loans.name: Daimati

texts.en:
Daimati, 38, lives in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha with her husband and two children. She has studied up to Class 7, but she wants both her children to complete their education and have a much better future. She has managed to get her son to do a Bachelor's degree. Her husband is a daily wage earner and she has been running a grocery store for the last five years to manage the household expenses. 

Daimati is looking for a loan of 35,000 INR to expand her business. She wants to add more items like rice, oils, and pulses, and increase the quantity of her current items. Slowly but steadily, Daimati has been strengthening her business and her children's future prospects. Please come forward to help her with this next step! 

Daimati has requested a loan of 35,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy rice, different sorts of oil, and pulses (lentils) in bulk, and increase the quantity of her current items.

loans.use: to buy rice, different sorts of oil, and pulses (lentils) in bulk and increase the quantity of her current items

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is 50 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Florence has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Florence also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Florence's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a 46-year-old married mother of two children. She has run a handmade knitting and embroidery business from her house since 1995. Janette works hard to develop her business and target new clients. She is well-known in the region because of her special talents and good-quality products. 

Janette is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary threads for her newly released spring and summer collection. She hopes that one day she can start a wholesale business and recruit others to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy threads for her spring and summer collection

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is single and has three children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She sells her products on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to educate her children to the university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of good customer care. She would like to get a shop in the future to have a permanent business premise. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is in the right place, having joined the microfinance group PMPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can get financial assistance for her chosen piggery business. Victoria has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her piggery business. Victoria wishes to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eliver

texts.en:
Eliver is a 37-year-old mother from Kisumu. She is married to John who is a businessman and supports the family by providing income. She supports seven people in their family, and she has two children.

Eliver has been selling second-hand clothes for the last 10 years making a monthly income of 20,000 KES. She is taking her sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes to earn more income to help her support her family. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by opening another kiosk.

Her dream is to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Alan

texts.es:
Alan, tiene la edad de 23 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres actualmente. 
El con el credito va comprar un novillo para cria. El posee un terreno apto para la explotacion de su proyecto y actualmente cuenta con buenois pastos para el engorde de sus animales. El piensa tener sus animales a un buen peso rapido para poder venderlos y a la vez generar mayores ganancia para el bienestar de su familia. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alan is 23 years old, single and currently lives with his parents.

He will use the loan to buy a heifer to breed. He has land suitable for this project and right now it has good grass to fatten his animals. He is thinking of having his animals quickly reach a good weight to be able to sell them and generate higher profit for the well-being of his family. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from the State banks and FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to breed.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
Jhony, tiene la edad de 52 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el credito quiere comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El va comprar los abonos plaguicidas y todo tipo de insumo aplicable para la buena produccion de cafe. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotacion del cultivo y actualmente se encuentra en produccion. El espera poder aumentar con estas mejoras la produccion y asi poder generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Es el tercer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en:
Jhony is 52 years old, married, and has 2 children who are his greatest priority. With the loan, he wants to purchase the supplies to take care of his coffee crop. He will purchase manure, pesticides, and all sorts of supplies applicable for good coffee production. He has good land for growing the crop and currently it is in production. He hopes to be able to increase his production with these improvements and in this way be able to generate more income for the well-being of his family and offer them a better quality of life.

This is the third loan that he has gotten from FUDECOSUR. He has never had previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase coffee supplies.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 61 years old and married with five children. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care products, soft drinks, bread, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

Adelaida has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to repair and renovate her family home and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, soft drinks, bread, coffee, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various kinds of goods and items to enlarge his grocery

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad, 39 years old, from village Chanieti, has a wife and four children. The family earns a living with a small agribusiness, which is really hardly enough to satisfy even the basic needs of this large family. Zviad cultivates family-owned agricultural land where he harvests nuts and maize and sells these products seasonally. Apart from this, they don't have any stable activity to cover all daily costs after the season. Because of the above-mentioned situation, Zviad decided to request a loan and start a stable business. Zviad needs financial support to purchase a general store, stock products and have money for working capital. Zviad has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Zviad and his large family. He will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

Zviad awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a general store and have money for working capital

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri is a 64-year-old man from the village Kvirike, where he lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law. The family’s main source of income is agriculture. With the help of his family members, Iuri breeds cattle and cows and cultivates mandarins and nuts. His family sells their harvest and milk products locally to earn a small income. In order to make a more stable salary and increase his family's living conditions, Iuri decided to become involved with a taxi business. After several unsuccessful attempts, Iuri applied to MFO Credo for credit. 

Iuri is requesting a loan to buy a car to provide local taxi service. His loan request was approved within the framework of the Start Up program, a joint initiative with MFO Credo and Kiva, which permits the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Iuri’s new business will give him a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi service

loans.name: Baloy Gerardo

texts.es: Baloy Gerardo, tiene la edad de 58 años, está casado y actualmente vive con sus 2 hijas y esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el credito va comprar los insumos para la asitencia de su cafetal. El espera comprar abonos, plaguicidas y otros productos para su cafe. El cuenta con el terreno apto ya cultivao y cosechando por lo cual quiere mejorarlo un poco. E tiene como meta aumentar su produccion y aumentar sus ganacias para el beinestar de su familia. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Baloy Gerardo is 58 years old, married, and currently lives with his wife and two daughters who are his main priority. 

With the loan he is requesting, he will buy the supplies he needs to tend to his coffee plantation. He plans to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and other products for his plants. The land is suitable for this crop and has already been planted and harvested - he wants to improve it a bit. His goal is to increase production and increase his earnings for his family's well being. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mercedes Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer muy emprendedora, solo estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera, pero tiene 3 hijos y es por ellos que se esfuerza día a día para ayudarles a superarse, sus dos hijos menores van a la escuela aún y su primer hijo ya está avanzando en sus estudios universitarios. 

Mercedes, realiza diversas actividades para generar ingresos económicos, cuando terminó sus estudios de bachillerato trabajo por varios años en un restaurante, luego empezó a trabajar en AVON como asesora de ventas.- Actualmente, sigue como asesora de ventas, pero además tiene pocos días de dedicarse a la venta de helados en un local alquilado, en el centro de su pueblo; el negocio está aproximadamente a 200 metros de su casa.
 
Mercedes, necesita el crédito para comprar helados y comprar productos lácteos para vender; con esto mejorará su calidad de vida, ya que sus ingresos incrementarán y asegurará el futuro de sus hijos.

Los propósitos de Mercedes son, ayudar en la educación de sus 3 hijos, otro de sus sueños es tener buenos resultados en su negocio y construir su propia casa, porque actualmente viven en una casa que solo están por cuidarla, sin pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 37 years old, is a very enterprising woman. She only studied until the end of high school and is a single mother, but she has three children for whom she strives day after day, in order to help them better themselves. Her two youngest children are still in school and her eldest son is now making progress in his university studies.

Mercedes does several things to generate income. When she finished high school she worked in a restaurant for a few years. Then she started work in AVON as a sales advisor. Currently, she is working as a sales advisor but she also has a few days when she sells ice creams in rented premises in the centre of her village. The business is about 200 metres from her house.
 
Mercedes needs the loan to buy ice creams and dairy products to sell. This will enable her to improve her quality of life, since her income will increase and she will guarantee her children's future.

Mercedes' aims are to help with the education of her three children, achieve her dream of doing well with her business and build her own house, as they currently live in a house that they are only looking after, without paying rent.

loans.use: buy ice creams and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Marlinawati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Marlinawati. Marlinawati lives in a city located about 15 hours' drive from Jakarta, or only one hour by airplane. She lives there with her husband and her only child. Marlinawati owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their child’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Marlinawati needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Marlinawati’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Marlinawati is the one who is standing. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married, 42-year-old father of four, whose children are aged between 20 and 12 years old. He lives with his family in Iganga, but is originally from Tororo in Eastern Uganda. Stephen started out in business as an entrepreneur selling essential commodities like tea and sugar, having dropped out of junior high school due to a lack of tuition fees. He supplemented his business by selling children’s clothes. It was while doing this that Amuza, an UpEnergy Sales Executive, introduced him to the business of selling improved cook stoves. Realizing that the demand for the product was high, and that he enjoyed a lot selling energy-efficient stoves, Stephen decided to become an UpEnergy distribution partner as well. He has been successfully selling UpEnergy products for three years now. He attributes his success to the healthy margins and uniqueness of the product on the Ugandan market, as well as the well-managed operations at UpEnergy, meaning a quick and reliable service. In addition to earning a living from the sale of the product, entrepreneurship and building a successful business are very important to him. He is also proud to be able to improve the livelihood of people in the communities who are able to save from improved fuel use. These savings are being channeled to other expenses like school fees for children or housing expenses, as well as enabling families to avoid the dangers of open fires, which is common with the use of three stone fires. His aspiration is to be able to grow his business, so that he can be able to see his children through school and ensure that they have a better life. The loan will make it possible for Stephen to scale up his business, and allow him to increase his stock, so that he saves time and transportation cost by not having to travel as often, to replenish his stock in order to meet the high demand on stoves.  A portion of the loan will also go toward leasing a tricycle that will make it easy for him to reach the rural communities and reduce on transportation costs that currently eat up most of his margins.

loans.use: To pay for products and aquire a trycycle for transportation of products.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running a business selling bed sheets; she purchases different varieties of bed sheets from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth and bed sheets in her community and earns enough through her business to support her family well. 

Sajida wants to expand her business; therefore she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of bed sheets in different colors by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bed sheets in different colors by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Nuryanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma agents, Nuryanto. Nuryanto lives in North Tangerang, a suburban located about two hours’ drive from Jakarta.  He lives there with his wife and his two children. He is happily married.   

Nuryanto owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories. Nuryanto is a friendly and cheerful person and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. He joined Ruma almost two years ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he had heard that Ruma has the best service and system. 

As the business grows, Nuryanto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and process utility bill payments for members of his local community.

As seen in the photo, Nuryanto is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments for members of his local community

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Ahmad. Ahmad lives in Surabaya, a city in East Java, located about two hours from Jakarta by plane. He is happily married. He lives there with his wife and his three children. 

Ahmad owns a stall that provides laundry service and sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He already joined Ruma for almost two years and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system, and he wanted to expand his business using technology. Ahmad is a friendly and cheerful person, and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Ahmad needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Ahmad's goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma's latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Ahmad is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Las Rositas” La cual  está constituida por 08 socias con muchas ganas de trabajar y prosperar. Eugenia de 56 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos uno de ellos dependiente. Ella se dedica  a la venta de comidas como el ají de gallina. Hace más de 5 años que se desempeña en dicho negocio.  Su mayor deseo es poder implementar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pollo, arroz, fideos y aceite. La Nueva Alcancía “Las Rositas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por facilitarles este crédito. Eugenia es la cuarta del lado derecho viste chompa color morado.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank Las Rositas, which comprises eight members. They are all hardworking women who are eager to get ahead. 

Eugenia is 56 years old. She is married and has two children, one of whom still lives with her. She works selling meals like "aji de gallina" (chicken in a spicy sauce). She has been in this business for over five years. Her main goal is to be able to implement her business. She is requesting this loan to buy chicken, rice, pasta, and oil. Eugenia is the fourth person from the left in the picture, wearing a purple sweater.

This newly founded communal bank wants to thank Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy chicken, ride, pasta, and oil.

loans.name: Dúo Debora De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Debora de San Pedro La encargada de este grupo es la señora Maritza quien tiene dos años en su negocio de tortillería en su casa, también vende blusas de tela típica cuando le piden, tiene dos hijos y le da gracias a Dios por la familia hermosa que le ha regalado.  Su sueño es poder agrandar su negocio y ayudar a varias mujeres que necesitan un trabajo para ayudar en casa.  Solita un préstamo porque necesita comprar varios quintales de maíz a Q. 115.00 cada uno y aprovechar una oferta que le están ofreciendo de varios quintales.
texts.en: Señora Maritza is in charge of the "Dúo Debora de San Pedro" communal bank.  She has had her tortilla making business run out of her home for two years.  She also sells blouses made from traditional fabric when she has requests for them.  Señora Maritza has two children and she thanks God for the beautiful family she has been given.  Señora Maritza's dream is to expand her business and to help various women who need work by having them help in her house.  She is requesting a loan because she needs to purchase a number of hundred-weights of corn at Q. 115.00 a piece, and she wants to take advantage of a sale being offered for purchasing multiple hundred-weights.

loans.use: to purchase corn for making tortillas.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials, build bathrooms, and install toilets in the patio and in one of the rooms of her house.

loans.name: Mervin

texts.en:
Mervin, a father of two, provides for his family with his farming income. After six years of experience in growing coconuts, he earns a better income.

Mervin needed to purchase fertilizer to improve the farm. He was determined to work hard in order to earn greater returns because he wants to give a better education to his child. With the microfinance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized.

In the future, he wants to expand his business so that he can sustain the needs of his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida tiene 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 2 menores hijos de 13 y 6 años de edad. Vive en la parte rural del distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz. Dicho caserío esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Nelida es la venta de cerveza y productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, entre otros, contando con clientes de la zona. El destino del crédito es para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos como bebidas gaseosas entre otros, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Nelida is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her spouse and their two youngest children, who are ages thirteen and six. They live in a rural area of their district. The house is built with rudimentary materials, but it has water and electricity. Their community is located in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the Cajamarca region on Peru's northern mountains. People there work mainly farming, raising livestock, or in sales.

Nelida runs a store where she sells beer and products like rice, sugar, oil, sweets, and other items. She has a local customer base. She is going to use this loan to invest in her business by stocking up on new products like soda and other items. This will allow her to generate more income so that she can improve her quality of life. Her business doesn't have much local competition, so she is able to sell her products at a good price.

loans.use: to stock up on new products like soda and other items.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Marie. She is married and has 1 child aged 4. 

In 2008, Marie established her stationery and printing shop business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living and also assist her husband in running the home. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,723,800 every month from this business.  

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Marie has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stationery for resale. These loans have helped her a lot in paying school fees and taking care of some domestic problems. She hopes that this loan will enable her to meet her target and increase her monthly profit, which she feels good about.   

In the future, Marie plans to expand and improve the business, and to continue to assist her husband and to educate their child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy A4 size paper and exercise books

loans.name: Ma. Amelita

texts.en:
Ma. Amelita is a married woman, 65 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Amelita has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Ma. Amelita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other supplies for her business.

Ma. Amelita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other supplies

loans.name: Puja Group

texts.en:
Puja group formed in the year 2015 in Ganganagar, Bhubaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India, with five active, self-dependent women with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the concerned group have their own professions and businesses. Sarmistha is one of the member who has taken a great role for her development and their group members' livelihood improvement. 

The lady who is standing first person from the right-hand side with a raised hand in the photo is Sarmistha. She is about 32 years old and is living with her small family of her husband and two children. 

Sarmistha has been engaged in a tailoring activity at her own home of Ganganagar since four years ago. Through this business she earns a monthly income of 7,500 INR. Her opinion is that her income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus for a total investment in the business to materialize her dreams. So to get more and more income by the expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business in the course of loan. She will take the loan and will purchase clothes, threads and related items, as well as a sewing machine from the market. Post disbursement of loan, the most significant thing is that she has to repair her tailoring machine, which is giving low performance. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for the construction of a house and provide a better education to her children.

The other four members of her group are also smart at their professions, which include vegetable vending, a milk business, a breakfast shop and a general store. All group members will purchase their required goods and items for the development of their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase lots of threads, clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un hombre casado, padre de tres hijos todos ellos adolescentes, su trabajo consiste en la distribución de agua potable, una actividad muy común en una zona como cerete que no cuenta con agua potable, y de mucha actividad deportiva en donde los clubes básicamente informarles de futbol, busca este tipo de personas para comprar el siniestro suficiente para sus deportistas.

Luis Alberto les ofrece una alternativa, su responsabilidad con sus pedidos, su gentileza, amabilidad y honestidad hacen que las personas le sigan pidiendo y de hacer de esta una actividad digna para el mantenimiento de su familia.

Su propósito con su negocio es poder pagar la educación universitaria de sus hijos y apoyado en préstamos de financiamiento sabe que lo puede lograr y pagara muy cumplido como el hombre responsable que es.

Solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de agua en cantidades aprovechando que el carro distribuidor está próximo a llegar, esto le permitirá tener un suministro para operar por un periodo de un mes o mes y medio dependiendo de las ventas.
texts.en: Luis Alberto is a married man, the father of three teenage children. His job is to distribute drinking water, a very common activity in an area like Cerete where there is no drinking water,  and with a great sporting activity. Here, the informal soccer clubs look for this kind of supplier to buy the necessary supplies for their athletes. Luis Alberto offers an alternative.  His responsibility with his orders, his kindness, courtesy, and honesty keep people coming back and makes this a dignified activity to  support the family. His purpose with this business is to pay his kids college education, and with the support of financing loans he knows he can achieve it and pay them back, as the responsible man he is. He is asking for a loan which he will use to buy water wholesale, since the distributing truck will be coming soon. This will allow him to have a good supply to operate for a month to a month and a half, depending on sales.

loans.use: To buy water wholesale.

loans.name: Badrussalam

texts.en: Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Badrussalam. Badrussalam lives in East Serang, a suburban area located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his children. Badrussalam owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment service for his community. He has been a member of Ruma for almost a year. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn how to expand his business using technology. As the business grows, Badrussalam needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. Badrussalam’s goal in the near future is to work with Ruma to provide an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Badrussalam is standing in his own shop stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Osmin Santiago

texts.es:
Osmin, se dedica a cultivar hortalizas, es un joven emprendedor que tiene 24 años de edad, se encuentra soltero, vive con una tía, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero y nadie depende de él, sus cultivos son de güisquil, tomate, chile y pepinos, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en la producción de hortalizas, el oficio lo aprendió de un amigo y vecino, trabaja a tiempo completo.
Invertirá en semilla, tubos y tela especial para construir un invernadero, con ello podrá incrementar el área de cultivo y mejorará la tecnificación de la producción, espera poder tener trabajo permanente e ingresos que le ayuden a cancelar la deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio más estable, construir su casa propia para tener un patrimonio cuando decida formar una familia.
texts.en:
Osmin makes a living growing vegetables. He is a young entrepreneur of 24 years, single and living with an aunt. He doesn't receive financial help from abroad and has no dependents. His crops are pear squash, tomato, chilli and cucumber and he has five years' experience producing vegetables, a trade he learnt from a friend and neighbour. He works full time.

He is going to invest in seeds, pipes and special fabric to build a greenhouse, enabling him to increase the area he can farm and use technology to improve production. He hopes to be able to work on a permanent basis and have enough income to pay off his debt.

He dreams of having a more stable business and building his own house, so that he has something to pass on when he decides to start a family.

loans.use: invest in seeds, pipes and special fabric to build a greenhouse, enabling him to increase the area he can farm and use technology to improve production.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is a working woman who has been the sole provider in her family since 2011, when her husband was diagnosed with multi-drug resistant TB in co-infection with DM. A year after her husband’s diagnosis, her three-year old grandson was also diagnosed with multi-drug resistant TB and had to start treatment. The child recovered after a two-year treatment but his grandfather had to continue treatment for an additional six months. During this time, the sole income in the house was provided by the borrower, who worked cutting fabric to make shirts for a local company.
During this time, Partners In Health – Peru was able to reach the family, providing assistance for medical tests and supplies for the borrower’s husband and grandson, as well as food stamps for the family. In 2013, the borrower was able to join Partners In Health’s Income Generation program, attending training sessions and developing a work plan to set up a small sewing business. The organization provided a small loan and technical assistance, which is still provided today. 
The borrower has formalized her business, and is now providing guidance to other small seam workshops, including her daughter’s small workshop. She would like to expand her business with the purchase of a second-hand covering machine for cotton garments which will provide more business opportunities for her.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Maa Santoshi 1 Group

texts.en:
The Maa Santoshi 1 group was formed in the year 2014 in Bhubaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India with four active local self-dependent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of the group have their own professional businesses. Mrs. Suma is one of them. She takes a great role in her development and in the group members' livelihood improvement. 

The lady standing in back of the group with her hand raised in the photo is Suma. She is about 42 years old and living with her small family as she has a husband and three children. 

Suma has been engaged in a grocery shop of her own at her home for the last five years. Through this business, she earns a monthly income of Rs. 6,500 INR. Her opinion is that, though her income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus totally invested in the business, she can realize her dreams. So to get more and more income by expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business over the course of the loan. With the loan, she plans to purchase rice, oil, sugar, tea, washing powder, soap, shampoo, biscuits, snacks, and other items for the expansion of her business. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house and to provide better education to her children.

The other three members of her group are also smart in their professions like tailoring, local line business and diary firm, respectively. They hope for a  boost in their livelihoods after the loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, tea, washing powder, soap, shampoo, and biscuits

loans.name: America Consuelo

texts.es:
America tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, tiene 01 hija dependiente, vive en casa familar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de limpieza a terceros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 02 años, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de herramientas nuevas para implementar su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio, con esto America espera incrementar su nivel de ingresos lo que le generará mayores ganancias que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
America is 37 years old, lives with her husband and has one dependent daughter. She lives in a family home in a rural area in the Oyotún district. This is located in Chiclayo province in the region of Lambayeque, on the North coast of Peru. 

She makes a living providing cleaning services to other people and has been doing so for two years. She has experience in this business and good personal and professional references in her district.

She is applying for a loan to buy new tools to carry out her business and provide a better service. By doing this America hopes to increase her income, which will generate more profit and improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: buy new tools to carry out her business and provide a better service.

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en: Kafa is a 45-year-old divorced woman who has worked hard since 2002 at preserving foods (a process known locally as Mouneh) since she has no one to support her financially. She needs to make sure that her business is doing well to insure customers loyalty and business success. Kafa has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a refrigerator to keep her goods fresh to work with and to do necessary maintenance on the vehicle she uses for her work. She hopes to expand her business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and repair her car.

loans.name: Nelly Silvania

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene 5 hijos de 29, 28, 22, 20,pero vive solo con el ultimo de 10 años, en la ciudadela 5 de Octubre perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe,
Nelly tiene un negocio de abastos, se dedica al comercio. Solicita el crédito para compra de abastos para invertir ya que los precios van a subir y tener almacenado para tener mayor ingresos e incrementando así su negocio. La compra la realiza en Ventanas. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión, y leer.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 48, is single.  She has five children, ages 29, 28, 22, and 20.  However, she only lives with the last one, age 10.  They live in the 5 de Octubre neighborhood in the Echeandia canton in the Bolívar province. 

She is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank.  

Nelly is a merchant, and she has a grocery business.  She is requesting the loan to buy supplies as an investment.  Prices are going to rise, and she will have the supplies stored in order to get greater earnings and expand her business in this way.  She will make her purchases in Ventanas.  Her challenge is the competition.

In her free time she likes to watch television, and she likes to read.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Joseline Gabriela

texts.es:
Joseline tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltera tiene un hijo, vive con sus padres en el barrio 13 de agosto, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe
Joseline tiene una tienda de abastos, se dedica al comercio. Solicita el crédito para compra de abastos, para asi incrementando su negocio. La compra la realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es tener una despensa mucho mas grande. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta bailar, la costumbre que más le gusta es la semana Santa.
texts.en:
Joseline is 21 years old. She is single and has one child. She lives with her parents in the "13 de agosto" neighborhood, which is part of the Echeandía canton in the Bolívar province. She is a member of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank.

Joseline has a small neighborhood grocery store and earns her living in commerce. She is requesting the loan to buy stock in order to increase her business. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. Her goal is to have a much bigger shop. Her challenge is competition. In her free time, she likes to dance, and her favorite custom is Holy Week.

loans.use: to buy stock for her neighborhood shop

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo crédito para realizar la siembra de dos manzanas de maíz y una manzana de frijol, comprara semilla certificada e insumos agrícolas para  dar un mejor desarrollo a sus cultivos, espera obtener una cosecha abundante para alimentar a su grupo familiar y venderle a sus clientes.
El impacto que ha tenido con el uso de créditos ha sido muy positivo ya que obtuvo una cosecha de 70 qq de maíz y 5 qq de frijol, sus ingresos han mejorado debido a que las ganancias las invirtió en la compra de una vaca para ir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
María needs a new loan to plant two ‘manzanas’ [a manzana is a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters] of corn and one manzana of beans.  She will buy certified seeds and agricultural supplies in order to give her crops better growth.  She hopes to get an abundant crop in order to feed her family and to sell it to her customers.

There has been a very positive impact from the use of the loans.  She got a harvest of 70 ‘quintales’ [a quintal is about 100 pounds] of corn and 5 quintals of beans.  Her earnings have improved because she invested the profits in the purchase of a cow in order to be improving her business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and agricultural supplies in order to give her crops better growth.

loans.name: Zipporah's Group

texts.en: Zipporah is 43 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is very hardworking. Even though she is the only one featured in the photo, she represents a group of six farmers in the Kakamega South District of Kenya. She started working with the One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to get the best-quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has earned more profits from each harvest since joining. This year she decided to lead a group of lenders because she wanted to help more farmers. Zipporah’s group will receive enough supplies to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. Additionally, two farmers in the group will also be buying solar lights so they can have illumination after dark.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo, de 47 años de edad, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, está soltero, pero tiene 4 hijos y con mucha responsabilidad ha cuidado de ellos; los tres asisten a la escuela, sus edades son 10, 13, 15 y 16 años. 

Domingo, siempre ha buscado la mejor forma para mantener sus hijos, para ello realiza diversas actividades que le generan ingresos.- En época lluviosa se dedica a trabajos agrícolas, sembrando granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y sorgo, para mantener los gastos de alimentación de su familia y además producir un excedente para la venta; en época seca los trabajos agrícolas no se pueden realizar, es por eso que se dedica a comercializar medicamentos de consumo humano en zonas bastante cerca a su vivienda, en el negocio y las actividades agrícolas se involucran sus hijos para agilizar el trabajo.

Domingo, solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como semilla, fertilizantes y algunos agro-químicos para obtener buena producción, ya que la época lluviosa se acerca y quiere estar preparado para la siembra de sus cultivos.  

Las intenciones y proyecciones de Domingo son muchas y todas son muy importantes para asegurar un futuro estable para su familia.- A corto plazo quiere aumentar su producción agrícolas, para tener disponibilidad de alimentos, luego desea invertir en su negocio de medicamentos y así mejorar sus ingresos y a largo plazo desea darles a sus hijos la ayuda necesaria, para que estudien bachillerato y luego puedan ir a la universidad.
texts.en:
Domingo is 47 years old and only has a second grade education. He is single but has four children whom he takes care of very responsibly. They are all in school and their ages are ten, thirteen, fifteen, and sixteen.

Domingo has always looked for the best way to support his children. In order to do this, he earns his income by running several businesses. During the rainy season he works as a farmer, growing basic grains like corn, beans, and sorghum. This allows him to feed his family, but he also produces a surplus to sell. During the dry season the crops can't be grown, which is why he works selling medicine in his surrounding area. His children are involved in the business and the farming in order to streamline the work.

Domingo is requesting this loan to buy farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizer, and some agrochemicals, in order to obtain a good harvest. The rainy season is approaching, so he wants to be well prepared to plant his crops.

Domingo has many goals and projects, and they are all very important to secure a stable future for his family. In the short run, he wants to increase his farming production so that food is readily available. He also wants to invest in his medicine business so that he can improve his income. In the long run, he wants to be able to help his children with whatever they need so they can go through high school and then go to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizer, and some agrochemicals.

loans.name: Janaki

texts.en:
Janaki and her husband have been operating their snacks/eatery business together for the past fourteen years in Jeypore town in Koraput district, Odisha. They earn an annual income of 60,000 INR from it.

Janaki has successfully managed to repay her past loan taken for the business and has now requested a second loan for 35,000 INR for purchasing raw materials such as dal, flour, spices, preservatives, etc., for making a greater quantity of papads.

Both Janaki and her husband are keen that their daughter is educated; her daughter is in the twelfth grade now.

Janaki has requested this loan of 35,000 INR. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as dal, flour, spices, preservatives, etc., for making a greater quantity of papads.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala lives with her husband and two children in a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, and is the only breadwinner of this small family. Kamala has been rearing goats for the past three years. She buys goats from the market, and when the goats give birth to babies, she will sell them in the market at a profit.

She has now requested a loan for 35,000 INR to enable her to buy more goats for her business. Kamala presently manages an income of 4,000 INR monthly from her business.

Kamala has requested this loan of 35,000 INR to buy goat kids for rearing. She is grateful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy goat kids for rearing.

loans.name: Kundana

texts.en:
Kundana, 24, lives in a small village of the Koraput district with her husband and two children. Kundana's children are studying, and her husband runs a tea stall.

Kundana herself, though educated through the tenth class, has been running a grocery shop from her home for the last seven years to add to the family income, for lack of other opportunities.

Kundana wants to expand her business, and to really benefit from increased inventory, she must buy stock in wholesale quantities. As the market prices keep fluctuating, buying in bulk guards her against price spikes and hence ensures decent profits. However, this means she has to buy in 25 kg or 50 kg packs.

She is, therefore, seeking a loan of 35,000 INR to bulk buy grocery items such as edible oil, rice, and condiments for her shop. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as edible oil, rice, and condiments for her shop.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en: Mouna is a 52-year-old single lady, the sole breadwinner to six members of her family. She is a hard-working woman who puts so much effort on her business development since she has a big responsibility she has to make sure she can handle. Mouna runs her current convenience store since 1978, and she is well known in her region and seeks to meet customers' requests. Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages and special offers. She will also use part of this loan to pay for an increase in her shop's rent.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages and special offers

loans.name: Delmy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delmy, es propietaria de una tiende de productos de la canasta básica y variedad de lácteos, cuenta que su negocio lo fundo hace 10 años y nació por la necesidad de generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares, vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos.
Desea mejorar la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes por lo que solicita un crédito que le servirá para comprar quesos, cuajada, crema, azúcar, bebidas, boquitas, etc., de tal forma podrá cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, espera que las ventas tengan un aumento y pueda cancelar la deuda con responsabilidad.
Para Delmy es importante continuar trabajando para darle a su familia un mejor entorno y nuevas oportunidades de superación.
texts.en:
Delmy is the owner of a store that sells household products and a variety of dairy products. She says that she founded her business 10 years ago, and that it was born because of her need to generate income to cover the needs of her family. She lives in her own house with her husband and children.

She wants to improve the merchandise she offers to her clients. Because of this, she requests a loan that will be used to buy cheese, cottage cheese, cream, sugar, drinks, snacks, etc. In this way, she will be able to meet her clients’ demands. She hopes that her sales will increase and that she can repay her debt responsibly.

For Delmy, it is important to continue working to give her family a better environment and new opportunities for improvement.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cottage cheese, cream, sugar, drinks, snacks, etc. In this way, she will be able to meet her clients' demands.

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter, no cuenta con el capital necesario para fortalecer su negocio, por lo que se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar dos vaquillas para engordarlas y luego venderlas, de esa manera seguirá atendiendo las demandas de sus clientes.
El resultado de haber invertido el crédito anterior en su negocio ha sido de mucho beneficio, ya que sus nuevas ganancias le han servido para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter does not have the capital he needs to strengthen his business. As a result, he decided to request a new loan to buy two young cows to fatten them and then sell them. In this way, he will continue taking care of his clients’ demands.

The result of having invested the previous loan in her business has been very beneficial. The new earnings have helped him improve the infrastructure of his house and cover the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy two young cows to fatten them and then sell them. In this way, he will continue taking care of his clients' demands.

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Nu would like to take another loan to buy new furniture and two pans for her stall to provide better quality service for her customers. Nu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. Nu also hopes that through the loan she can improve both her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and two pans for her stall

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Trinh would like to take another loan to repair her house to better serve her customers and improve her living conditions. Trinh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. Trinh also hopes that through the loan she can improve both her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house to better serve her customers and improve her living conditions

loans.name: Santiago Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santiago, de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es viuda y madre de dos hijos, los cuales le ayudan un poco económicamente.

Santiago, se dedica a bordar y a pintar mantas, además vende ropa como faldas y blusas, ella tiene cinco años de dedicarse a este negocio, pues su esposo cuando se enfermo ya no le pudo continuar ayudando y ella tuvo que buscar ingresos para su hogar.

Santiago, solicita un préstamo para comprar material para elaborar mantas y comprar fardos de hilo, plumones y ropa para vender, de esa forma lograra incrementar sus ingresos y tener mas clientes.

El sueño de Santiago, es tener las fuerzas para seguir trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Santiago is 59 years old and has studied through the second grade. She is a widow and the mother of two children, who help her a little financially. 

Santiago is dedicated to embroidering and painting blankets. She also sells clothing, such as skirts and shirts. She has spent five years dedicating herself to his business; when her husband got sick, he couldn’t continue helping, so she had to find an income for her household.

Santiago requests a loan to buy material to make blankets and to buy bundles of thread and down and clothing to sell. In this way, she will succeed in increasing her income and having more clients.

Santiago’s dream is to have the strength to continue working on her business.

loans.use: to buy material to make blankets and to buy bundles of thread and down and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sopiko

texts.en: Sopiko, who is 22 years old, lives in Batumi city. Her parents work in the private sector. In spite of her good education, Sopiko was unable to find a stable job, so she decided to start her own business. She lacks access to traditional capital markets and financial institutions because they require stable income and business experience, but the Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo has allowed her to get a loan for $3,000 to buy mobile phones and open her store. She is confident that her business will be profitable because it is in a great location and the only business of its kind in the area. After the store is open, the family will have a stable income which will allow it to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future. With help from the Start Up program, Sopiko will get an opportunity to own a business and overcome her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a mobile phone store.

loans.name: Benedict's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Benedict, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He is married, a father to 4 children and is known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Benedict joined One Acre Fund in 2009 because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvest season, Benedict plans to send his children to school.

Between the 7 farmers in Benedict's Group, a total of 5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is a 59 year old woman, from Matani village. She lives with her granddaughter, who is temporarily unemployed. Tsitsino works hard to provide financial stability for her, but she finds it hard to provide for all the family's needs. She has a small agricultural activity and sells products locally.

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, she decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.

With this loan of 2000 GEL, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in her community door-to-door. Tsitsino has experience in clothing sales from 10 years ago and will make the new business profitable for herself.

The loan will greatly assist Tsitsino and she will be able to re-start her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, she has a big list of loyal customers.

She is very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing and start a trading business.

loans.name: Josephat's Group

texts.en:
Josephat is 61 years old and is often referred to as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Kakamega South District, formed by 11 farmers, including himself.

Josephat has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2009 because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, Josephat’s Group will receive a total of 8 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests.

loans.name: Temur

texts.en:
Temur. a 45-year-old man from Kobuleti district, is married and has a school-aged son and daughter. Temur and his wife are both hired workers earning approximately 250 GEL each month.

Temur requested a loan from Credo to start up a new business, and his loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to poor people who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Temur plans to open a general store and make a stable income. He will purchase stocks of products and have money for working capital. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. The family members will be able to improve their living conditions, and Temur will be very thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: To open a general store and purchase products

loans.name: Elemina's Group

texts.en:
Elemina is 50 years old and is often referred to as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, she is representing her group in Kakamega South District, formed by 10 farmers, including herself.

Elemina has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2009 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Not only will she get maize seeds and fertilizer with her loan, but also a solar light in order to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. She will use the profits she gains from this year’s harvest for her children's education.

With this loan, Elemina’s Group will receive a total of five solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en: Cecilia is 50 years old and has eight children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be very hardworking. Even though she is the only we see in the photo above, she represents a group of eight farmers in the Kakamega South District of Kenya. Cecilia started working with the One Acre Fund in 2008 because she wanted to get the best-quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from every harvest ever since joining. This year she decided to lead a loan group because she wanted to help more farmers. Cecilia’s group will receive supplies to plant a total of 4.75 acres. Additionally, three of the farmers in the group will buy solar lights to they can have illumination after dark.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
Ángel Antonio es un agricultor de 45 años, casado con Anarda,  tienen 7 hijos a los cuales dar alimento y servicios básicos, en la actualidad el trabaja como capataz de una finca, sin embargo el desea hacer trabajos propios para poder superarse de forma individual.
Ángel hace distintos trabajos propios entre ellos el cultivo de abejas de distintos tipos: Apis Melífera -abejas comunes- y meliponas o abejas sin aguijón. Esta miel orgánica se comercializa através de COCAFCAL en Honduras y en los USA.La producción de miel es una actividad novedosa y muy exitosa en la región ya que la buena densidad de plantas en la región favorece para una producción abundante y mejora la polinización de todas las plantas. 
En la actualidad Ángel necesita un préstamo para comprar 30 excluidores para sus apiarios. Esto le permitirá reemplazar los que estén dañados en su apiario. También podrá construir cajas tecnificadas para ampliar sumeliponario ya que como vemos en la imagen, actualmente tiene algunas colmenas en cajas no aptas las cuales podría trasladar a sus cajas. La miel orgánica de las abejas meliponas es un producto muy escaso en los mercados nacionales e internacionales así que los precios son buenos y las ganancias aportan buenos ingresos a las familias productoras.
texts.en:
Ángel Antonio is a 45-year-old farmer who is married to Anarda. They have seven children, so they must provide them with food and basic services. He currently works as a foreman on a farm, but he wants to pursue his own work so that he can succeed on an individual level.

Ángel is able to work on a business activity of his own, such as raising different types of bees: Apis Mellifera, which is the common honeybee, and Melipona, which are stingless bees. The organic honey that he produces is sold through COCAFCAL in Honduras and to the United States. Honey production is a fairly new and profitable activity in this region because of the adequate density of plants that favor abundant production due to the improved pollination of all of the plants.

Ángel currently needs a loan so that he can buy 30 excluders [barrier frames] for his beehives so that he can replace the ones that have been damaged. He will also build specialized boxes, such as the one shown in the photo, so that he can expand his apiary. Organic honey produced by these bees is a scarce commodity in the national and international markets, so prices are very good and profits will result in a good income for these producing families.

loans.use: to buy 30 excluders for his apiary.

loans.name: Alphonce's Group

texts.en:
Alphonce, 70 years old, is often referred to as a really experienced farmer. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Kakamega South District, formed by 11 farmers, including himself.

Alphonce has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2008 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to buy a cow.

With this loan, Alphonce’s Group will receive a total of four solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of seven acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Kelvin Joaquin

texts.es:
Kelvin tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene un hijo de 2 año, vive solo en el barrio 5 de Octubre perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe.
Kelvin se dedica al comercio de madera. Solicita el crédito para la compra de madera y así aumentar la producción. La compra la realiza en Echeandia. Su meta es mejorar su negocio. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte. El agradece ya que en una ocacion anterior le ayudaron con un credito con el mismo pudo mejorar su economia y sustentar a su familia por lo que nuevamente pide otro credito.
texts.en:
Kelvin is 26 years old. He is single and has one two-year-old child. He lives alone in the "5 de octubre" neighborhood, which is part of the Echeandía canton in the Bolívar province. He is a member "Virgen de Guadalupe" communal bank.

Kelvin earns his living selling lumber. He is requesting the loan to purchase lumber in order to increase his production. He makes his purchases in Echeandía. His goal is to improve his business, and his challenge is competition. In his free time, he likes to play sports. 

Kelvin is grateful because they helped him with a loan on a previous occasion and he was able to improve his finances and support his family. That's why he is once again requesting another loan.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Elissar

texts.en: Elissar is the 25-year-old married mother of one child who financially supports four members of her family. For the last eight years she has earned a living as a hairdresser, and her long experience in this field means that she has many loyal customers. She very much wants to improve and expand her business by providing customers with specialized and personal care. A youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will help Elissar buy a car so that she can provide service to customers in their homes. Elissar is very optimistic that this loan will have a positive impact on her business.

loans.use: to buy a car to provide beauty services to people in their homes.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 47-year-old single woman living alone. She decided to start her own business in 2012, so she opened a small room in her house to prepare homemade foods in order to have a good lifestyle and to live in a good way. 

Today, Zeinab is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to ameliorate her business merchandise and to be able to offer more products to her clients. She is very happy and optimistic that she will sell all her products and expand her business area. She hopes that in the future, she might open her own store and attract more customers.

loans.use: to ameliorate her business merchandise (homemade foodstuffs)

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is requesting a new loan to purchase a variety and greater quantity of soft drinks to stock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase her sales. She also hopes it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a variety and greater quantity of softdrinks to stock her general store

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy new food products such as sugar, milk and ice cream to sell to her customers. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that this new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increase sales, and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new food products such as sugar, milk and ice cream to sell

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi would like to take a further loan to repair her stall to better serve to her customers and to pay her children's school fees. Chi's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in expanding the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her stall and pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Huu's Group

texts.en:
Huu is a 44-year-old single man. For 10 years, he has run a business selling fresh flowers for people in his community. Huu is group leader of a 7-member loan group, that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, he is in the centre wearing a black t-shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Huu would like a loan to purchase better quality flowers in bulk from wholesalers. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality flowers to sell.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata and her husband together manage a decorating service that supplies tenting material, stage decoration items, public address systems, and other kinds of equipment commonly used for social functions. The couple have been running this service successfully for over eight years. An amount of 35,000 INR will help them invest in additional equipment, which in turn will enable them to supply the decorating materials to more customers. 

Since their daughter has just begun university, their family needs will continue to steadily increase, demanding more commitment from Mamata and improvement in household income. 

Mamata has requested this loan of 35,000 INR to buy additional equipment for her decorating service. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her decorating service.

loans.name: Minakshi

texts.en:
Minakshi is 35 years old and engaged in the unique but profitable business of fish rearing, with special focus on Pohala and Rohu. The fish grown in the pond and are then sold.
