Her loan amount of 35,000 INR will be used to buy additional fish for rearing and pay for fish food, medicine and transportation costs. 

Minakshi's husband does paddy cultivation. Together, they are looking to enhancing the family income and ensuring their daughter continues to go to school. Minakshi is asking for a loan of 35,000 INR. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for rearing and pay for food, medicine and transportation costs

loans.name: Kezia's Group

texts.en:
Kezia is 60 years old and is often referred to as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, she is representing her group in Kakamega South District, formed by 13 farmers, including herself.

Kezia has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2009 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Not only will she get maize seeds and fertilizer with her loan, but also a solar light in order to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. She decided that she will use the profits she gains from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

With this loan, Kezia’s Group will receive a total of 3 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima and her husband are engaged in a fruit-selling business to make a living. She wishes to receive a loan to further expand the business and grow their earnings. As fruit is always in demand, the couple plans to add more varieties of fruit to their venture. For maintaining freshness, they buy on a regular basis. They have been doing this activity for the last ten years and are well aware of their customers' preferences to make good profit from this venture. 

Pratima has requested a loan of 35,000 INR which she will use to buy more varieties of fruit to increase sales. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fruit to increase sales.

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
"Milk is the elixir of life." It is so with human beings who consume it and those who rear cows, buffaloes, and goats. Maina, 34, a resident of Koraput district, desires to improve both the health of her family and the business of milk vending she is in. She wants to buy another buffalo. She already owns one. The additional milk-yielding buffalo will be financed by this loan of 35,000 INR . 

Maina has to advance her little savings in addition to this loan to buy the buffalo. She has requested a loan of 35,000 INR which will help her to buy a buffalo. Maina is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milking

loans.name: Baleda's Group

texts.en:
Beleda is 59 years old and has 10 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Beleda has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to the best seed prices and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Beleda also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Beleda's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is 47 years old and is living in the Fuzuli region with his lovely family. Rasim’s family consists of five people: his wife, who is housewife and doesn’t work on an income-earning business, and three children, a girl who is studying in the eleventh class and two boys - who are studying second course at technical college. The family members are Internally Displaced Person-IDP from Fuzuli city. 

Rasim and his wife have an animal breeding business, and today Rasim needs a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to support and develop the family business. With this amount he is planning to buy two calves. Rasim is thankful for help from Kiva and Kiva lenders. 

In the future, Rasim wants to build new stalls for his cows.

loans.use: to buy calves and to support and develop the family business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret is 56 years old and has 10 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 8 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Magret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2008. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Magret also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Magret's Group will be able to receive a total of 2 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Raja

texts.en:
Raja is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, three of whom are still attending school. She has been working as a cleaning services provider since 2009; she works in a company, and works independently upon a client’s request. She gives good quality services to her clients, and this is what helps her to attract other customers very easily. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to buy a new car that will allow her to reach her clients in time. She said that this loan will help her to support in her family more.

loans.use: to buy a new car to allow her to reach her clients in time.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and has 8 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Betty has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Betty also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Betty's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina, vive con tres hijos en edades de 10, 7 y 5 años, ellos son dependientes, desde hace 20 años práctica la jarcia y la crianza de cerdos, lo hace a tiempo completo, sus hijos le apoyan en dichas actividades cuando regresan de la escuela.
Comprará dos cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, fortalecerá su negocio para mantener su continuidad, espera poder aumentar la competitividad de su negocio y recuperar la inversión con mejores ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son tener recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Albertina lives with three children who are 10, 7, and 5 years old who are dependent on her. For twenty years, she has been weaving agave fiber and raising pigs. She does this full-time. Her children help her with these activities when they come home from school.

She will buy two pigs and concentrated pellets to feed them. She will strengthen her business to keep it going. She hopes to be able to make her business more competitive and to recover her investment with greater earnings.

Her aspiration is to have economic resources in order to cover her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and concentrated pellets to feed them. She will strengthen her business in order to keep it going.

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 41-year-old widowed mother of four children. She has been employed since 2010 in a grocery shop, to cover her family's living needs since her beloved husband passed away leaving her alone to take the responsibility of raising four children.

Mouna is a hard-working lady, who puts so much effort into providing her children with the necessary living needs, however she still finds herself not capable of providing them with everything they need because of her limited monthly salary which is barely enough to cover necessary living needs.

Mouna's son wants to support her through sharing her living expenses; he intended to travel abroad to seek better income to provide his beloved mother with a good income to improve their living. Unfortunately her son needs to pay for his travel expenses, and Mouna is his main financial supporter. To make his dream come true she applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her son's travel expenses so he can travel abroad searching for a better future and work opportunity.

Mouna is dreaming of one day when she can open her own business and develop her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for her son's travel expenses so he can travel abroad searching for a better future and work opportunity.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 24-year-old ambitious single lady, who opened her own cosmetics and accessories shop in August 2014. She is working hard to develop her business widely, through diversifying her merchandise to attract customers attention and increase her income.

Mariam is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer accessories, beauty products and newly released clothes collections.

This is her first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, and she hopes that her future relationship will lead to opening a bigger shop in a better location.

loans.use: increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer accessories, beauty products and newly released clothes collections.

loans.name: Ana Raquel

texts.es:
Ana, cuenta hoy en día con una tienda mucho más surtida y con nuevos clientes, manifiesta que ha sabido invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio y por tal razón está teniendo nuevos ingresos, su familia disfruta de una vida más confortable y todos se encuentran muy saludables.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para ofrecer un mejor inventario a sus clientes, comprara 100 libras de queso, arroz, frijol y azúcar por quintales para ahorrar en su precio y tener ganancias mayores, espera que las buenas ventas se mantengan.
texts.en:
Ana now has a much better stocked store and new customers, showing that she used the previous loan well in her business.  Because of this she has more income, her family is enjoying a more comfortable life and all of them are very healthy.

She is requesting a new loan to offer a better selection to her customers.  She will buy 100 pounds of cheese, rice, beans, and sugar, in bulk, to save on the price.  She hopes her sales continue to go well.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alba Nohemy

texts.es:
Alba, es casada, vive con sus tres hijos, dos de ellos ya están acompañados, con la ayuda de su esposo tenían un negocio de destazo de reses, pero tuvieron dificultades por lo que ella decidió dedicarse únicamente a la compra y venta de ganado, al desarrollar dicha actividad puede generar ingresos para subsistir con su familia.
El capital que solicita prestado es para poder tener recursos con los que podrá  comprar ganado fortalecerá su negocio, pagara un precio bajo a los ganaderos de su localidad y posteriormente los venderá en otros municipios, así sus ganancias serán mayores, los riesgos son que los animales se enfermen y mueran.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando,  apoyar a su esposo para cumplir con todos sus compromisos y tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Alba is married. She lives with her 3 children, and 2 of them are already in relationships. She and her husband had a beef butchering business, but they had some difficulties. Therefore, she decided to make a living only buying and selling livestock. By performing this work, she is able to generate an income in order to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to have the resources to buy livestock so that she can strengthen her business. She will pay a low price to the breeders in her area, and she will later sell the animals in other towns, increasing her earnings. The risks are that the animals get sick and die. Her dream is to continue working so that she can support her husband, attend to all of her responsibilities, and have a more decent life.

loans.use: to buy livestock so that she can strengthen her business

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yesenia, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y su esposo tiene 42 años de edad, tienen dos hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad, los cuales estudian, tiene una venta de comida y bebidas, el local está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, hace 3 años que hizo su apertura, trabaja de lunes a sábado, no representa dificultades en este momento para desarrollar sus actividades.
Comprará carnes, arroz, mariscos, bebidas, aceite, verduras, bebidas, condimentos, etc., tendrá materia prima suficiente para elaborar la venta de comida, la inversión será de ayuda para mantener su negocio en el mercado y satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
Sueña con darle a su familia mejor calidad de vida y hacer buen uso del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 39 years old and married, her husband is 42.  They have two children ages 20 and 18, who are in school.  She has a small food and drink stand in the center of the city, which she opened 3 years ago.  She works Monday through Saturday, and currently has no difficulty performing her work.

With the loan she will buy meat, rice, seafood, drinks, oil, vegetables, condiments, etc. to have sufficient raw materials to make food to sell.  The investment will help her to maintain her business in the market and meet the demands of her customers.

She dreams of giving her family a better quality of life and making good use of the loan.

loans.use: to buy food to make and sell in her food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her house and also buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un sonriente, amigable y servicial caballero de 34 años de edad, es actualmente soltero pero tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeña de 2 años de edad quien vive con su madre pero la mantiene Carlos.
Trabaja en un negocio de legumbres, oferta frutas y verduras de múltiples especias encontradas en Colombia. 
Inicio su negocio hace ya buen tiempo por necesidad económica, aprendió solo, en el camino fue adquiriendo la experiencia y la sabiduría necesaria para lograr una estabilidad y un buen flujo de ventas para servirle de apoyo incondicional a su hija.
Carlos sueña con ser suficiente para mantener a su hija, sostener su negocio, comprar vivienda, tener un local mas amplio, propuestas que tiene que ir trabajando con paciencia para cumplir uno a uno sus propósitos.
Carlos solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frutas y verduras solo por nombrar algunas:
Verduras (zanahoria, Papa, plátano, cilantro, tomates, papa criolla, yuca, cebolla, frijoles, alverjas, entre otros.)
Frutas(coco, mora, maracuyá, banana, tomate de árbol, guayaba, mango, pera, manzana, entro otros.)
texts.en:
Carlos is a smiling, friendly, helpful, 34-year-old gentleman who is currently single but is responsible for supporting his little two-year-old daughter; she lives with her mother but Carlos supports her. He has a produce market where he sells various kinds of fruits and vegetables found in Colombia. 
He started his business a long time ago due to financial need. He learned the business by himself, acquiring the experience and wisdom to achieve stability and a good sales flow along the way in order to provide his daughter with unconditional support.

Carlos dreams of being sufficient in order to support his daughter, sustain his business, buy a home, and have a bigger store; these are things he has to work at patiently in order to achieve his goals one by one.

Carlos is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of fruits and vegetables. To name a few:
Vegetables (carrots, potatoes, plantains, cilantro, tomatoes, cassava, onions, beans, peas, among others.)
Fruits (coconut, blackberry, passion fruit, banana, guayaba, mango, pear, apple, among others.)

loans.use: to buy an assortment of fruits and vegetable

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo un zapatero de profesión y nacimiento, el cual inicio un negocio desde el año 2000 como independiente de fabricación de calzado el cual aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre pero nunca se había atrevido a emprender un camino por su cuenta.
Gerardo vive junto con su pareja y gracias a su independencia a logrado tener una mejor calidad que poco a poco le permite pagar sus deudas e ir invirtiendo en reparaciones para su hogar y su propósito es mejorar, generar empleo, ser un proveedor de grandes empresas de calzado como lo son la nike y la adidas.
Por su parte ahora quiere solicitar un préstamo y la razón es que quiere vender calzado por su cuenta y con su propia marca de fabricación, por ello con el préstamo invertirá en cuero, plantillas, pegamento, puntillas, cordones y algunos otros materiales que emplea.
texts.en:
Gerardo a shoemaker who started his business in 2000. He learned everything from his father, but had never dared to take a path on his own.

Gerardo lives with his partner and thanks to his self sufficiency he achieved a better quality of life; he gradually allows him to pay his debts and start investing in repairing his home. He wants to improve, create jobs, and he wants to be the shoe provider of large companies such as Nike and Adidas.

He wants to request a loan to sell shoes on his own and have his own brand of manufacture, therefore the loan is to buy leather, insoles, glue, laces and some other materials.

loans.use: to buy insoles, laces, leather, leatherette among others matariales to make shoes

loans.name: Pamela's Group

texts.en:
Pamela is 36 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Pamela has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Pamela also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Pamela's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Nabila's husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 18 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to complete maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good - it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to complete the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Nabila has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Nabila's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Nabila also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Nabila is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband complete maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Ezekiel's Group

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 60 years old and has six children. He has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Ezekiel is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Ezekiel started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2009, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Ezekiel’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 32 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three daughters who are all studying. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes selling for seven years. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Musarat's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Musarat is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her husband to purchase clothes in bulk for his business.

loans.name: Miriam Irene

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil soltera, vive con sus 3 hijos en el barrio 13 de Agosto, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe, 
Miriam se dedica a la venta de pollos. Solicita nuevamente un credito para la compra de pollos y así incrementar su negocio ya que con al anterior le ayudaron a surgir en el negocio que por falta de capital no podia incrementarlo . La compra la realiza en Echeandía. Su meta es construir una casa. Su desafío es la competencia. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 33 years old, is single, and lives with her 3 children.  They live in the 13 de Agosto neighborhood, in the Echeandía canton, in the Bolívar province.  She is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe communal bank.  Miriam makes a living selling chickens.  

She is requesting a new loan in order to buy chickens to sell and so expand her business. The previous loan helped her to improve her business which she couldn't do before due to lack of money.  She will buy the chickens in Echeandía.

Her goal is to build a house.  One challenge she has is competition.  In her free time she likes to play sports with her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Sarah has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to send her children to school and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Sarah also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Sarah's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is 62 years old and has eight children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Peter is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group, formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Peter started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2008, and decided to do so because he wanted to earn enough to send his children to school. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain leadership skills.

Peter’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of seven acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 42 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, selling fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Samina's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position her husband is not able to purchase fruits for his business. Therefore, Samina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits to resell so her husband can increase his fruit business

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Matilde ella es soltera y tiene 39 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Virgen Del Rosario". This communal bank is located in the district of Paucartambo, which belongs to the province of Paucartambo and the department of Cusco. 

The member Maria Matilde is single and 39 years old. She makes a living through her restaurant business. She prepares different meals such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and sautéed meats. The member works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has had this business for the past 10 years, and she does very well. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is requesting a loan to buy food products for cooking such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The member in the photo attached to the group photo asked for permission to get her picture taken after the meeting because of her work. The other members work in an animal sale business, a livestock business, a grocery store business, and a restaurant business.

Maria Matilde gives thanks to those who are part of her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy food products for cooking such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Sonia Yanira

texts.es:
Sonia, compra semilla de marañón la tuesta y luego la vende para tener los ingresos necesarios para cumplir con sus obligaciones, tiene 8 años dedicándose a realizar esta actividad y cuenta con clientes establecidos a los que les distribuye el producto, ella es casada, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, su cónyuge es empleado, ambos comparten  las responsabilidades de su hogar.
Invertirá en la compra de semilla de marañón al mayoreo, le permitirá tener materia prima en la temporada de escases, lograra satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y espera que las ventas sean mayores.
Sus sueños son hacer buen uso del préstamo, apoyar en los gastos familiares y ser un ejemplo para que sus hijos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Sonia buys cashew nuts, roasts them and sells them for the income she needs to pay her bills. She has been engaged in this business for eight years and she has regular clients to whom she distributes her product. 

She is married and lives with her husband and children.  Her husband is employed and they both share the household responsibilities. 

She will invest in buying cashew nuts at wholesale which will allow her to have a supply of raw material during the season when it is scarce, satisfying the needs of her customers. She hopes this will increase her sales. 

Her dreams are to make good use of the loan, contribute to household expenses, and to be an example so that her children can succeed.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts at wholesale so she will have raw materials when they are scarce.

loans.name: Difina's Group

texts.en:
Difina is a 56-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega south district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Difina has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Difina described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, as well as fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Difina’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Nim is 60 years old and a mother of six children. As the main source of her family’s income, she grows sesame. She has been involved in her job for 20 years and it earns her about 37,400 KHR per day. 

For Nim, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to plow the field, buy sesame seeds and pay for labor workers' fees. She hopes that she can expand her current business to earn more income and update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to plow the field, buy sesame seeds and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Halima operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high-cost transportation to her place of operation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a water tank to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to use for her business.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons, who are studying. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 10 years. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Farhat's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Farhat is applying for a Kiva loan from the field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase the clothes in bulk for his business. 

This loan amount will help Farhat's husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits. Farhat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband in improving his clothing business.

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar is married with three children. He is 34 years old. For 22 years, Etibar’s family have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Peoples) from Gubadli City. The family now lives in the Absheron region. Etibar’s wife is a tailor, and he is a driver, transporting building materials. 

A few days ago his car was broken and now, he can’t work. For this reason, Etibar has applied to Komak for a loan to repair his car. He needs 1,200 AZN. He hopes that his car will be repaired soon so he will be able to start work again. 

This is Etibar's second loan; the first loan he closed in time. Etibar is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help. In the future, he wants to help his children with their education.

loans.use: to repair his car and increase his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood for her business and pay for repairs to the roof on her home.

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Dilia de 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus  hijas  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio ella vende  frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc. Y también en sus tiempos libres hace Nacatamales de cerdo y de gallina y luego ella  los vende con sus vecinos y amistades, Radica en el municipio de San José, Choluteca, al sur de Honduras,  ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Ana está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería,  como pollo, arroz, frijoles, maseca, manteca, jabón, frescos, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente existente con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Doña Ana su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien completo con bastante s productos para que sus clientes allí encuentren todo lo que buscan, y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro y terminar los estudios de sus hijas.
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  MARZO  2015.
texts.en: Ana Dilia is 35 years old and lives with her husband and her daughters in their own house.  She has worked for the past ten years selling groceries.  In her business, she sells beverages, chips, beans, rice, dairy products, soap, chicken, etc.  Also, in her free time, she makes pork and chicken Nacatamales and then she sells them to her neighbors and friends.  Located in the town of San José, Choluteca, in southern Honduras, she is a hardworking woman with the desire to succeed and she fights everyday to improve her quality of life. Doña Ana  is requesting the loan to purchase products to stock her store like chicken, rice, beans, corn meal, lard, soap, beverages, etc.  With the support of this loan, she intends to improve her income as well as her quality of life.  She is a current client who wishes to continue working with Prisma and KIVA. Doña Ana's dream is to have a good business, complete with enough products so that her customers will find what they're looking for, and at the same time improve her future and allow her daughters to finish their schooling.  San Lorenzo, Hondura - March 2015

loans.use: to purchase chicken, rice, beans, corn meal, lard, soap, beverages, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Henrieta's Group

texts.en:
Henrieta, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by six farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Henrieta will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that she will now be able to reduce consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Henrieta plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Henrieta’s Group will use the supplies received from this loan to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old. He is married with three children. 

He has had a retail shop business for ten years. He will be using the loan to purchase goods, e.g., sugar, salt, bread, soap, etc., for resale, and hopes this will help him to expand his business and educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children to university level.

He is in his eighth loan cycle and is borrowing 70,000 KES.

loans.use: to purchase goods, e.g., sugar, salt, bread and soap, for resale.

loans.name: Enaam

texts.en:
Enaam is a 40-year-old married woman, living with her husband and only child. She cooperates financially with her husband to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. 

She has owned a grocery store since 2013. Her shop is situated next to her house, where she welcomes customers from different areas and villages to buy her fresh goods. 

Today, Enaam is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to increase her store’s inventory and to renovate her store. She states that the loan will surely help her expand her trade and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her grocery store’s inventory.

loans.name: Rukamani

texts.en: Rukamani, at 48, has learned to be the head of her household in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha. While her two older sons work as a farmer and a daily laborer, Rukamani has been supplementing the family income by selling milk from the cows that she has owned for the past six years. She has now requested a loan of 35,000 INR to purchase another cow and to provide the cow with healthy food and proper shelter. Although illiterate, Rukamani has ensured that her third child (a daughter) receives some education. She hopes to save enough money for herself and to educate her third child further, as she is now in the 12th grade. Rukamani is also a part of a group named Trinath Shg to help and support each other. She has requested 35,000 INR to purchase a cow and to provide the cow with healthy food and proper shelter.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to provide the cow with healthy food and proper shelter.

loans.name: Selika's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Selika, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 24 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  She is married and has three children.

Selika is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Selika says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Selika will use the profits from this season to invest in a business.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of six solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of seven acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Sanai

texts.en:
Sanai is 37 and hails from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha. She works with her husband, and together they run their pottery business. They make pots from soil, ceramic and clay as raw materials. They make instruments like ceramic utensils, plates, jars, etc. The business is run from home, and together they earn 6,000 INR per month. This is her first loan, which will be used for purchasing good quality clay and soil for their pottery. 

Sanai has requested this loan of 35,000 INR, which she will use to buy good quality clay and soil for the pottery. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy good quality clay and soil for her pottery

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality  and transportation in her business. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is 48 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Violet has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough income to send her children to school. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Violet decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Violet's Group will be able to receive a total of ten solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez  is a 55-year-old married woman. She is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Kaneez ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect milk from them. 

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Kaneez  has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo, in order to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 35-year-old married woman. In order to support her husband (also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti lives in a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha. She is a petty shop owner and has been in the business for 13 years. She works 10 hours a day and earns 3,000 INR a month. Her husband is not working presently, and the onus of running the household is on her and her eldest son. Her second son is currently doing his schooling. Maintaining a good rapport with customers has helped Basanti to build a strong customer base. She buys grocery items directly from the farmers and sells them to the customers at a reasonable price. Quality household items are also sold in her shop. She says transportation is the main challenge in her job apart from a lack of finances. She says she will use the loan to purchase extra items for her store and enhance the business.

Basanti has requested this loan to invest in her business. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase extra items for her store and enhance the business

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 28-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and two children who are school age. She has worked as a private teacher since 2011, and works also in parallel in a local school, with the aim to help her husband and family to meet the needs of life. She is in this profession as she feels that she is helping students to get the desirable education. She prepared a special room in her house where she receives her students. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new car to help in her work. She wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sausages, eggs, vegetables, drinks, oil, etc..  She thinks that, having the raw materials, she will be able to continue preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
Luz Estella es una joven de 25 años de edad soltera sin hijos dedicada a su cultivo de plátanos y a sus padres, inicio en el año 2009 con un negocio muy decaído pero sus buenas ideas y buenas decisiones le han llevado a exportar su producto sin dejarlo que se pierda.

Su propósito al iniciar su negocio fue levantar lo que dejaron sus padres, y ahora tiene la gran oportunidad de que su negocio trascienda fronteras y como lo hará, expandiendo sus cultivos  para tener otros contratos que serán muy lucrativos para ella.

Solicita un préstamo el cual invertirá en lo siguiente.

•	Insumos(abonos y riegos)
•	Pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas
•	Comprar semillas para expandir sus cultivos.
Apoya esta persona que tiene proyección, tiene ganas de ser algo más que una simple agricultura.
texts.en:
Luz Estella is 25 years old, single and childless. She is dedicated to the cultivation of bananas and she takes care of her parents. She started a business in 2009, and her good ideas and decisions led her to export her product without failing.

When she started her business her purpose was to improve the business that her parents left her, and now she has the great opportunity; her business will transcend borders, and she will do this by expanding her crops to have more contracts.

She is requesting the loan to buy.
• Inputs (fertilizers and irrigation)
• Pesticides, fungicides, insecticides
• Buy seeds to expand her crops.

Support Luz Estella that wants to be more than just a farmer.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and fungicides to tend her crops.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Sakeena  is a 52-year-old married woman doing a business of animal purchase and sale, with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of six children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 27 years old. She is married with four children.

She has had a second-hand clothing sales business for five years. She will be using the loan to purchase buy more second-hand clothes for resale and hopes this will help her open a new business and educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to purchase a car and educate her children to university level. She is in her second loan cycle and is borrowing 60,000 KES.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Santos Marina

texts.es:
Santos, con el financiamiento anterior mantiene la continuidad de su negocio de venta de fruta picada, antojitos y cultivo de granos básicos, su estilo de vida es más digno y mantiene su buena calificación en el uso de créditos.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar variedad de fruta, aceite, yuca, tomates, harina, etc., para surtir el inventario de su negocio.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Santos maintains the continuity of her business selling sliced fruit, snacks, and cultivating basic grains.  Her lifestyle is more worthy and she maintains her good qualification in the use of loans.
She is requesting a new loan to buy a variety of fruits, oil, yuca, tomatoes, flour, etc. in order to stock the inventory of her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits, oil, yuca, tomatoes, flour, etc., in order to stock the inventory of her business.

loans.name: Stanzlaus's Group

texts.en:
Stanzlaus is a 53-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing his group of six farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Stanzlaus has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Stanzlaus described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing a solar light, aside from the fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Stanzlaus’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Emmily's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Emmily, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 37 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Emmily is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to earn enough to feed her family, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Emmily says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Emmily will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase a total of four solar lights as well as seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es:
José, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero y vive con su hermana, trabaja todos los días en una ferretería de su comunidad.

José, es empleado desde hace ocho años en una ferretería, el busco tuvo que buscar trabajo cuando quedo huérfano y por esa razón se fue a vivir con su hermana y sus sobrinos, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:0 p.m.

El préstamo que está solicitando José, es para comprarle una plancha para hacer pupusas a su hermana, para que obtenga ingresos y puedan vivir en mejores condiciones sus sobrinos y él.

El sueño de José, es tener una pupuseria más grande y con bastantes clientes y que sus sobrinos estudien y se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
José is 23 years old and has a high school education.  He is single and lives with his sister.  He works everyday in a hardware store in his community.

José has been employed for eight years at the hardware store.  He had to look for work when he became an orphan and for that reason, he went to live with his sister and nephews.  His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

The loan that José is requesting is to purchase a griddle for his sister to make pupusas (typical Salvadoran food), so that they earn income and he and his nephews can live in better conditions. 

José's dream is to have a larger pupuseria (pupusa restaurant) with lots of customers and that his nephews study and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to purchase a griddle for his sister to make pupusas.

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Lucy, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by ten farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Lucy will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Lucy plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Lucy’s Group will use the supplies received from this loan to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia  is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing the best services, she has become very famous on her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demand of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the beauty parlor. That is why she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy hair care products, skin care products and hair rollers, in order to treat more customers and gain profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin care products and hair rollers.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana  is 38 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Shabana’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shabana has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants  to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shabana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Hajra

texts.en:
Hajra is 48 years old, and a hardworking woman who has two children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her area. 

She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Hajra ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Hajra  has requested for a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan  to purchase a new sewing machine, along with some spools of thread and lace, in order to meet the demands of her customers consistently. 

She aspires to save money for her family's prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, along with some spools of thread and lace.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is 47 years old, and a married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal more customers time after time. That is why she has applied a loan of 45,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time to earn more revenue to run her household activities efficiently. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, makeup kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time to earn more revenue to run her household activities.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 54-year-old married woman running a business of selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has six children, and she is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase an additional buffalo to increase milk sales, so that she can earn a good amount of income and fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase an additional buffalo to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya  is a 34-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her area. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo, in order to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales.

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Farkhanda  is well known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. 

With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as thread in different colors, lace, zippers, and cloth, to stitch up more dresses on time and generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as thread in different colors, lace, zippers, and cloth.

loans.name: Djeneba's Group

texts.fr: Djeneba,  au dernier rang à gauche sur la photo et portant un foulard bleu, est membre d'un groupe de 20 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Diafarana, au sud-est de Bamako(Mali).Djeneba,est âgée de 43 ans et vit dans une famille composée de 22 personnes. L’agriculture est pour elle un moyen d'assurer la sécurité alimentaire. Elle a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro grâce à son système de paiement. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Djeneba a acheté un paquet de semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.25 hectare. A travers cet achat, Djeneba espère avoir plus de rendements en quantité et qualité afin de pouvoir acheter un vélo, assurer l'alimentation des siens et faire de l'élevage.
texts.en:
Djeneba,  in the last row on the left in the photo wearing a blue scarf, is a member of a group of 21 women farmers who work and live in the village of Diafarana,  southeast of Bamako (Mali). Djeneba is 43 years old and lives in a family made up of 22 people. For her, agriculture is a way to have food security. She decided to enroll in myAgro thanks to its payment system. 

For her first year with myAgro, Djeneba bought a package of seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts (groundnuts) on her field of 0.25 hectares. Through this purchase, Djeneba hopes to have more yield, in both quantity and quality, so as to buy a bicycle, ensure food, and raise livestock.

loans.use: to buy a package of seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Sameena

texts.en: Sameena  is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor in her street. She is doing her job passionately. She is a well-known beautician in her town. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently. This will help her earn a good amount of income to handle her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers.

loans.name: Korotoumou's Group

texts.fr: Korotoumou,  au premier rang à droite sur la photo et portant un foulard noir et blanc portant un polo noir et orange, est membre d'un groupe de 8 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Damanan, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Korotoumou, qui est âgée de 30 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 8 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille . Elle a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour avoir plus de rendements et acquérir de nouvelles connaissances agricoles. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Korotoumou a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.0625 hectare. A travers cet achat, Korotoumou espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements, élargir le champ, et vendre les excédents afin de pouvoir être un exemple en mobilisant les autres villageois à s'inscrire .
texts.en: Korotoumou, who is sitting in the first row on the right of the photo and wearing a black and white scarf on her head and a black and orange top, is a member of a group of eight farmers who live and work in the village of Damanan, south east of Bamako in Mali. Korotoumou is 30 years old and lives in a family with eight children. Farming allows her to ensure that all her family gets sufficient food. She decided to register with myAgro so that she could make more profit and acquire new farming knowledge. In her first year with myAgro, Korotoumou has bought a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer to farm groundnut in her 0.0625 hectare field. Through this purchase, Korotoumou hopes to make a better yield, expand her field and sell the excess so she can set a good example and get other villagers to sign up.

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing groundnuts.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en: Aasia is 44 years old, and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good-quality products. They make enough to meet the expenses of their five children. Currently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers, to generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers, to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Soumaila's Group

texts.fr: Soumaïla, qui se trouve assis sur la photo au bout du banc à droite et qui porte une chéchia noire, levant la main, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Semana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Soumaïla, âgé  de 48 ans, est le père de 10 enfants âgés de 3 à 30 ans dont 7 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés .L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Soumaïla  à exercer cette activité depuis la puberté. Soumaïla cultive l'arachide, le riz, le sorgho, et  le coton sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, d’engrais de qualité et de semoir. Soumaïla entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit  en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et du courage de l’agent de terrain. Cette année, Soumaïla effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15 ans que Soumaïla cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière surtout pour une grande famille comme la sienne. Soumaïla planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu, d’avoir de bœufs de labour et des matériels de travail tels que la charrue, la charrette, le semoir et élargir ses parcelles cultivables.
texts.en: Soumaïla, who is sitting at the right side of the bench in the photo, wearing a black hat and raising his hand, is the member of a group of 7 farmes signed up with myAgro, who live and work in a village called Semana, located Southwest of Bamako in Mali. Soumaïla, who is 48 years old, is the father of 10 children who range in age from 3 to 30 years, 7 of whom are currently in school. His family's tradition is to work in agriculture, and this is the primary source of revenue and food security for his household. Agriculture also allows him to keep his family independent, and therefore Soumaïla has worked in this business since he was a teenager. Soumaïla grows peanuts, rice, sorghum and cotton on his land for his land, but faces difficulties such as lack of water, quality fertilizers, and farming equipment. Soumaïla is in his first year working with myAgro, and signed up in order to be able to increase his yield thanks to myAgro's services, and thanks to myAgro's field agent. This year, Soumaïla is making payments to buy a packet of certified seed and fertilizer from myAgro for his .25-hectare holding. It's now been 15 years that Soumaïla grows peanuts for its value as a crop to be consumed at home, especially for a large family like his. Soumaïla plans, with the increase in his yield and revenue, to acquire cows for labor, and equipment such as a cart, a plow, a semoir (seed dosing machine), and to enlarge his arable land.

loans.use: to buy a packet of certified seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Seiba's Group

texts.fr: Seiba,  au dernier rang au centre sur la photo et portant le tshirt blanc de myAgro, est membre d'un groupe de 10 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Dongorona, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Seiba, qui est âgée de 35 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 40 personnes dont 15 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille . Elle a décidé de  s'inscrire à myAgro pour gagner davantage avec les nouvelles techniques agricoles. Pour sa deuxième année avec myAgro, Seiba a acheté un paquet d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.125 hectares. A travers cet achat, Seiba espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements afin de pouvoir vendre les excédents de produits au marché et rendre la famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Seiba, the one in the middle of the last row in the photo wearing a white myAgro T-shirt, is a member of a group of 10 farmers who work and live in the village of Dongorona, to the southeast of Bamako, in Mali. Seiba, who is 35 years old, lives in a family of 40 people, 15 of whom are children. Farming allows her to provide food for all of her family. She decided to joint myAgro in order to have access to updated agricultural techniques. 

For her second year with myAgro, Seiba has bought a packet of fertilizers to grow peanuts of her field of 0.125 ha [0.3 acres]. Thanks to this purchase, Seiba hopes to increase her yield, sell her excess harvest at the market and make her family happy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Waraba's Group

texts.fr: Waraba, qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, et qui porte un habit vert tenant la pochette vert, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Faradalla au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Waraba, âgée de 48 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 15 à 30 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. Son marriage avec un agriculteur a incité Waraba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Waraba cultive l'arachide et les légumes sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Waraba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de l'avis favorable de son entourage sur l'impact positif de myAgro. Cette année Waraba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Waraba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Waraba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage des bovins et caprins.
texts.en:
Waraba, who is in the photo in the first row on the right, and who has a green outfit with a green purse, is the member of a group of 11 farmers signed up with myAgro, living and working in Faradalla village, southwest of Bamako in Mali.
Waraba, who is 48 years old, is the mother of 4 children aged from 15 to 30 years old, 2 of whom are currently in school. After marrying a farmer 20 years ago, Waraba started working in the same business. Waraba grows peanuts and vegetables on her land but, as a farmer, must face difficulties such as lack of rainfall or quality fertilizer. Waraba is in her first year with myAgro, and signed up thanks to her friends' and family's good opinion of myAgro's positive impact. This year, Waraba is making payments in order to purchase a packet of certified seeds and fertilizer in order to grow peanuts and increase yield on her .0625 hectare holding. For the past 20 years, Waraba has been growing peanuts for their value as a food crop, and explains that it can immediately be eaten by her family, and is used for basic sauces in cooking. Waraba plans, with the increase in her yield and income, to start raising cows and goats.

loans.use: to buy a packet of seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband. In order to help her husband financially, she opened her own clothing shop in 2014, and provides her customers with a variety of European clothing at fair prices. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, even though she wishes to enhance her family’s way of living even more. 

Today, she is seeking a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to buy a new collection of European shoes that she will sell to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of European shoes for resale.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en: Bashar is a 54-year-old Lebanese divorced man living with his two children. He is the one taking care of them and covering their needs. Bashar opened a cafeteria in his town three years ago where people also meet at his place to enjoy their time with friends. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase his business merchandise. In that way, he will be able to receive more clients and surely earn higher revenues.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise.

loans.name: Joseline Pamela

texts.es:
Joseline tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su familia y su hijo de 1 año, en el barrio 8 de Octubre, perteneciente al cantón Echeandía, Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Virgen de Guadalupe,
Joseline se dedica a vender ropa de adultos y niños. Solicita el crédito para compra la compra de mercaderia para incrementar su negocio ya que va hacer un viaje a Ibarra para alla comprar ya que es mas conveniente. Su meta es tener su casa propia. En su tiempo libre se dedica a su hijo.
texts.en:
Joseline is 21 years old and single. She lives with her family and her one-year-old son in the 8 de Octubre neighborhood, part of the Echeandia canton in the Bolívar province. She's a member of the Virgen de Guadaupe communal bank.

Joseline earns a living selling clothing for adults and children. She's seeking the loan to buy merchandise to grow her business, and is planning a trip to Ibarra to buy there because it's more convenient.

Her goal is to have her own house. In her free time, she cares for her son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Indatwa Group

texts.en: Indatwa is a group led by Seraphine who is 33 years old. The group name means “The great” in English. She owns a shop and has been doing business for 10 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casado y su esposa vende pupusas por las tardes, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando.

Israel, desde hace varios años se dedica a trabajar como empleado en una gasolinera, empezó a trabajar desde que se caso y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m.
 
Israel, solicita el préstamo para comprar una plancha de pupusas, porque la que tiene ya no le sirve, de esa forma logrará que su esposa continué con el negocio y pueda generar otros ingresos para su casa.

Israel, desea que sus hijos estudien y que sean profesionales, además desea tener las fuerzas suficientes para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Israel is 34 years old and studied until 4th grade. He is married and his wife sells pupusas during the day. He has 2 children who are studying.

Isreal has been making a living for several years working as a clerk at a gas station. He started to work here when he got married. His working hours are from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

Isreal is requesting a loan to purchase a griddle for pupusas, because the one they had is no longer useable. In this way, his wife can continue to succeed in her business and generate income for their home.
 
Isreal wants his children to study and become professionals. He also wants to have the strength to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for pupusas.

loans.name: Luisa Aracely

texts.es:
Luisa, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 7 años de edad, cuida de su familia y elabora prendas de vestir para generar ingresos y cubrir gastos familiares, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años y aprendió a realizar dicha actividad asistiendo a clases impartidas por una organización gubernamental. 
Requiere de un préstamo para poder tener recursos económicos con los que comprara una máquina de coser con sistema eléctrico, será de ayuda para agilizar sus actividades y mejorar la calidad de sus servicios, espera mejorar el equipo de trabajo.
Sus aspiraciones son aprender a utilizar créditos para progresar y también mejorar la calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Luisa lives with her husband and a seven-year-old son. She takes care of her family and makes clothing to earn income and cover household expenses.

She's has her business for three years and learned her work attending classes offered by a governmental organization.

She needs a loan for funds to buy an electronic sewing machine. This will help her streamline her activities and improve her quality of service. She wants to improve the equipment she works with.

Her goals are to learn to use credit to progress and also improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine with an electronic system to streamline her activities and improve her quality of service.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is a 50-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition, so she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Kubra is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list.
