Currently, she requests a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 44 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 16 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Margaret has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Margaret decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save her more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Margaret's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 10.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nifa's Group

texts.en:
Nifa is 41 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Nifa is representing her group of 9 farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Nifa's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to repair her home.

Nifa and her group will receive a total of 5 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Isaac will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Isaac plans to use the profits he gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total, Isaac’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Lawrence's Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is 48 years old and has 6 children. He has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Lawrence is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 7 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Lawrence started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community.

Lawrence’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is a 42-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Rose has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Rose described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Rose’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 29-year-old married woman. She is running a business of selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Sadia ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. 

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Sadia  has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo so that she can to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo in order to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is a 31-year-old, married woman. She is a very talented person and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time, in order to get boost in her earnings. She wishes to spend her earnings on providing a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors.

loans.name: Sitan's Group

texts.fr: Sitan, qui se trouve sur la photo, assit au premier rang à l'extrême droite,elle porte un t-shirt gris sombre et elle tiens un bébé et la pochette de MyAgro, est membre d'un groupe de 16 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Siby, au sud-ouest de Bamako, au Mali. Sitan, qui est âgé de 45 ans, vit dans une famille un peu large, elle a 10 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés. L’agriculture lui permet d'avoir assez de nourriture et gérer le quotidien. Elle a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour nouvelles méthodes. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Sitan a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champs de 0.5 hectare. A travers cet achat, Sitan espère pouvoir avoir les meilleures rendements, améliorer son champ pour qu'il soit plus productif afin de pouvoir payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et faire du commerce, ses rêves vont à l'endroit de sa famille et de son village.
texts.en: Sitan, who is sitting in the first row on the far right, and has on a dark grey t-shirt, with a baby and myAgro packet in her hand, is a member of a group of 15 agricultural producers who live and work in a village called Siby, southwest of Bamako in Mali. Sitan, who is 45 years old, lives in a large family with 10 children, 3 of whom are in school. Agriculture allows her to have enough food to feed her family and manage daily needs. She decided to sign up with myAgro to access new farming methods. For her first year with myAgro, she bought a packet of certified seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts on her .5-hectare holding. With this purchase, she hopes to be able to generate a better yield, improve her field to be more productive in order to be able to pay for her children's school fees and start a small side business. Her dreams are for her children and her village.

loans.use: to buy a packet of certified seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 44-year-old single lady, the sole breadwinner for four other members of her family. She has run a shop selling chocolate and special occasion souvenirs since 2011, with 14 years of experience in this domain.

Amal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special Easter, spring and summer themes and chocolate designs, in addition to putting up a new banner for her shop instead of the old one. She is very anxious about this loan, since at the beginning she wasn't happy while establishing her current business because of her mother's death.

Amal hopes to expand her business to a larger shop in the future and to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special Easter, spring and summer themes and chocolate designs, and to buy a new banner for her shop

loans.name: Estrellas De San Antonio Group

texts.en:
Karla is a very enterprising woman who struggles on a daily basis to improve the quality of life for her and her family.  She is 35 years old and has two children who inspire her to fight to improve.  She is teaching them the importance of studying to make their future better.

Karla has a general store that sells products that are used daily.  She also offers products that can be bought in catalogs such as cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing for children, women and men. 

She is requesting a loan to increase her store’s inventory of the things bought consistently on a daily basis like sugar, rice, corn, oil, noodles, beans, juice, soda and candy.

Karla is very grateful to the members of the Trust Bank “Estrellas de San Antonio” for their support, but she is especially grateful to the KIVA investors for supporting Guatemalan women to help them become pillars of their communities.  Thank you!!!

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory of the things bought consistently on a daily basis like sugar, rice, corn, oil, noodles, beans, juice, soda and candy.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 29-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children. They are both cooperating together to live a respectable life and to offer their children whatever is needed. 

She opened a beauty salon in her town where she welcomes customers and provides them with beauty services such as manicures, makeup, tattoos, etc. Today, Lina is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to buy a beauty parlor chair and to increase her merchandise. She intends to enhance her work operations by offering her clients high-quality services. This will satisfy their demands and keep them loyal to her.

loans.use: to buy a beauty parlor chair and to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor  Ángel  de  56  años de edad  es  casado y vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación, se dedica  al transporte cuenta con dos motos taxi en el cual transporta persona diariamente de su aldea y hasta orilla de la calle principal y viceversa, es una persona muy luchadora, radica en aldea Agua Fría al Sur de Honduras. 
Don Angel esta solicitando 6,000 lempiras para realizarle chequeo de overhol ha uno  de sus moto taxi el cual ya lo necesita con estos fondos podrá comprar piston, cilindro, válvulas, aceite, kit de empaque, anillos y otros repuestos para su mototaxi con el apoyo de este crédito espera tener en buen estado la  unidad y tener mejores ingresos. Esta reparación le beneficiara ya que la Mototaxi consumirá menos combustible y menos lubricantes.
Don Ángel su sueño es  comprarse una nueva moto taxi para ir renovando sus unidades y con esto ayudar más a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2015.
texts.en:
Angel, 56, is married and lives with his wife in their house. He works in transportation and relies on two mototaxis which he uses daily to transport people from his village to the main road and vice-versa.

He's a very hardworking person and resides in the Agua Fría al Sur village in Honduras.

Angel is seeking 6,000 lempiras for a needed checkup and overhaul of one of his mototaxis. With these funds, he'll be able to buy a piston, cylinder, valves, oil, a packing kit, rings and other parts for his motorcycle taxi.

With support from this loan, he hopes to have his vehicle in good shape and have better income. These repairs will help his mototaxi consume less fuel and oil.

Angel's dream is to buy a new mototaxi to be renovating it, and thus help his family more.

loans.use: to buy a piston, cylinder, valves, oil, a packing kit, rings and other parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 24 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. 

He has had a motor bike transport business for nine years. He will be using the loan to purchase a new motor bike and hopes this will help him to build a better house for his family. He is in his second loan cycle and has borrowed an asset loan of 105,000 KES to be repaid in 12 months.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his child well and to buy another motor bike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor bike

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 31 years old, married to Nancy, and blessed with two children aged 2 years and 3 months.

He has been in horticultural farming for 10 years now and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and he intends to use it to purchase farm inputs.

He plans to support his young family with the anticipated profits. His hopes and dreams are to grow big in business and live a good life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en: Marie Claire is 38 years old. She is married with five children aged between one month and 17 years old. She sells vegetables and she has been in a business for the past 14 years. Her husband is a driver. With the loan, she would like to buy more cabbages, tomatoes and carrots to sell. With the profits from the business she plans to build a house and increase her savings as well.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages, tomatoes and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 32 years old. She is married. She owns a bar and she has been in a business for five years. Her husband is a motorcyclist. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell. With the profits from the business she wishes to renovate her house. In future, she aims to earn more profits monthly and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 30 years old. She is married with one child, aged 2 years. 

She owns a shop and she has been in business for two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. 

In the future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Collette

texts.en: Collette is 35 years old. She is married with four children aged between 6 and 12 years old. They all go to school. She owns a shop and she has been running this business for the past 10 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, salt and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house and improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 26 years old. She is married with two children aged 1 and 4 years old. She sells clothes and she has been in a business for the past four years. Her husband is a driver. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Theodosie

texts.en: Theodosie is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged between 2 and 10 years old, and they all go to school. She sells clothes and shoes, and she has been in a business for the past nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy medical insurance and improve her welfare. In the future, she wishes to earn at least 300,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis ha tenido que soportar muchísimas adversidades en el proceso de desarrollo de su negocio.
Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo productos de uso personal, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para su hijo.
Le dedica 14 horas diarias a su negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de planchas y secadores para el cabello al por mayor para tener mejor inventario.
Con este préstamo para ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.
Es un hombre fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en: Luis has had to face many obstacles in the process of developing his business. Currently, he lives in a modest house and earns his living by selling personal use products, an activity he learned by experience in order to support his son. He devotes 14 hours a day to his business. He is requesting a loan to buy hairstyling irons and hair dryers at wholesale prices in order to have more inventory. He needs this loan to have more products to offer and improve his sales in a considerable manner. He is strong man with great enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy hairstyling irons and hair dryers at wholesale prices in order to have more inventory.

loans.name: Charles's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Charles who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to four children, and is known by his community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Charles joined One Acre Fund in 2009 because he wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program, he says that his life has improved, especially because he has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Charles plans to invest in a business.

Among the eight farmers in Charles's Group, a total of 4.25 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 64 years old and has eight children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Grace has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Grace also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Grace's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mwanafuraha

texts.en:
Mwanafuraha is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Sulumena's Group

texts.en:
Sulumena is a 40-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Sulumena has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Sulumena described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Sulumena’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 1 solar light.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Roselidah's Group

texts.en:
Roselidah, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2007 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Roselidah will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. 

Roselidah plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total Roselidah’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Soedirman

texts.en:
Soedirman once again thanks all his Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice cultivation. He has repaid his loan fully. 

Soedirman could save more for purchasing of a rice plot. But that is not enough, So he decided to continue with the rice cultivation and for this he needs a loan for 7,500 SRD to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Tieho

texts.en:
Tieho is a 35-year-old father of three (two boys and one girl). 

He has been transporting children to and from school everyday while working in full-time employment. He is a hard worker and a very entrepreneurial person such that when he was laid off from work, he immediately responded by using his savings to buy a Condor van and expand his transport business. 

His van was recently involved in an accident and is currently immobile. This has greatly affected his business as he is now forced to hire a car to transport the children so as to keep his business running. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a new radiator system as well as replace the gear box. These repairs will allow him to cut costs related to outsourcing his business and therefore improve his margin. 

In the next five years, Tieho plans to own more transport vehicles and create many jobs.

loans.use: To buy new engine parts

loans.name: Alwyn

texts.en:
Alwyn (39), is a family man with a full house. He has five children (23,17,17,16 and 8) and also supports his late brother's three children. All the children go to school, hence Alwyn has to work extra hard to provide for them. 

He has been working as a builder for almost 20 years, and has picked up enough experience to start his own construction company. Having been in the business for so long, Alwyn has identified a niche opportunity within the construction industry in his community. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a plastering machine. This machine will be for hire to contractors and will allow him penetrate the market quicker.

Alwyn is not just calculative but ambitious as well. He plans to build his first large-scale real estate project within the next five years and has already engaged community officials towards this realization.

loans.use: to buy a wall plastering machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 49 years old. She is married with six children aged between 10 and 25 years; five of them go to school. 

She sells beer and she has been in business for the past 10 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell.

The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. 

In the future, she hopes to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: David Remberto

texts.es:
David, trabaja en la agricultura, principalmente cultiva maíz, vive en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar compuesto por su esposa e hijos, toda su vida ha trabajado en el campo, tiene un horario de trabajo de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde.
Comprará semilla mejorada, abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas, para preparar la tierra y cultivar maíz, espera tener mayor productividad  para vender a nuevos clientes y así mejorar su situación económica.
El sr. David sueña con crecer con su negocio y brindar a su familia apoyo incondicional para salir adelante.
texts.en:
David works in agriculture. He principally raises corn. He lives in his own house along with his family group, which consists of his wife and children. All his life he has worked in the fields. He has a work schedule from seven in the morning to three in the afternoon.

He will buy improved seed, compost, fertilizers, and insecticides to prepare the land and raise corn. He hopes to have better productivity in order to sell to new customers and thus improve his economic situation.

Señor David dreams of growing in his business and offering his family unconditional support in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy improved seed, compost, fertilizers and insecticides to prepare the land and raise corn.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 26 years old. She is married with two children, aged 1 and 6 years. 

She owns a shop and she has been in a business for the past 10 years, while her husband is a local constructor. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, Colgate and biscuits to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, Colgate and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stones to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old. She is married with two children aged 4 and 7 years; they both go to school. 

She owns a shop and she has been in business for eight years, while her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more biscuits and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house. 

In future, she aims to earn at least 400,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Roger Enrique

texts.es:
Roger ha podido acumular grandes experiencias gratas en su vida, una de ellas es el haber podido trabajar en diferentes tiendas de abarrotes.
Es un padre amoroso y responsable y tiene muy presente el significado de la familia en su proceso productivo.

El siempre fue muy inquieto y con gran vocación de servicio, cualidades que lo motivaron para iniciar con su propia tienda de abarrotes.

Hoy en día es un hombre amable y muy emprendedor, siempre buscando alternativas para que sus clientes se sientan bien atendidos y comprando productos de calidad.

El solicita apoyo económico para obtener un préstamo y realizar la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, pues planea aumentar su oferta de productos y desea tener un inventario mucho más grande, así podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Roger has been able to have many great, rewarding experiences in his life.  One of them is having been able to work in different grocery stores.

He is a loving and responsible father, and the meaning of family is very present in his production process.

He has always been very lively, with a calling to service.  These qualities motivated him to start his own grocery store.

Today he is a friendly and very enterprising man, always looking for alternatives so his clients feel well cared for, and purchasing quality products.

He is requesting economic support to get a loan and purchase inventory of basic household products.  He plans to expand his offering of products, and he wants to have a much larger inventory.  That way, he will be able to have the products available for his clients.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of basic household products.

loans.name: Maiter Carolina

texts.es:
Maiter es una madre de una pequeña hija de ya 10 meses de edad y por la cual ha luchado incansablemente para sostenerla y brindarle todo lo que necesita.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como artículos para el aseo personal, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de su hija.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos como cremas de manos, desodorantes, lociones, enjugues, entre otros, al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en: Maiter is the mother of a young girl who is already 10 months old and for whom she has struggled tirelessly to support and give her all she needs. In the sale of merchandise such as personal hygiene items, she has found a way to generate good income and be close to her daughter. Nowadays, she is starting with a small capital and is in the phase of collecting customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a stock of products such as hair creams, deodorants, lotions, hair rinses, among other products, at wholesale prices, and be able to stock up her small business with quality products. With the help of the loan she will be able to boost her business and have more diversity of products to offer, achieving the consolidation of her business.

loans.use: to buy hand creams, deodorants, lotions, hair rinses, among other things.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor ángel de 30 años de edad vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación donde cuenta con una hacienda ya que produce leche y la vende a sus clientes quienes visitan su hacienda y compran la leche  por mayor ya sea para revender o para elaborar quesos. Ángel es conocido por ser un joven luchador ya que con su corta edad cuenta con bastante ganado y terreno, radica en aldea la Cuesta al sur de Honduras. 
Ángel está solicitando 25, 000.00 lempiras para la compra  de un torete y Concentrado para su ganado. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia en su hacienda.
Ángel sueña con hacer más grande su negocios y mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar más a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2015
texts.en:
Señor Ángel, who is 30 years old, lives with his wife in their home, where he has a farm, since he produces milk and sells it to his customers, who visit his farm and buy the milk wholesale, whether to resell it or to make cheese. Ángel is known for being a hard-working young man, since at his young age he has quite a bit of livestock and land. He lives in the village of La Cuesta in the south of Honduras.

Ángel is applying for 25,000 lempiras for the purchase of a young bull and feed concentrate for his cattle. With the earnings and the support of this loan, he hopes to improve his quality of life and that of his family on his farm.

Ángel dreams of making his business bigger and improving his income in order to help his family more.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2015

loans.use: to buy a young bull and feed concentrate for his cattle

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dativa is a 30-year-old married woman with 3 children aged between 1 and 9 years, they attend school. 

She owns a shop and she has been in a business for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. She will use the loan to buy toothpaste, biscuits, and sugar. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. 

She aims to earn more in the future.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, biscuits, and sugar.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is a 31-year-old married woman with 2 children who are 1 and 7 years old; one attends school. 

She has owned a shop  for  five years and her husband is a farmer. She will use the loan  to buy more soap, sugar, and biscuits. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she hopes to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, and biscuits.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is a 36-year-old married man with 4 children  between the ages of 1 and 14; 2 attend school. 

He sells charcoal has been in the business for 8 years and his wife is a business woman. He will use the loan  to buy more charcoal. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house. He hopes to make more profit in the future.

loans.use: to buy  charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad, es dueña de una tienda, ofrece a sus vecinos productos de primera necesidad y lácteos, cuenta con más de 16 años de experiencia y no tiene un horario fijo para atender a sus clientes, no tiene apoyo económico del extranjero.
Comprará arroz, azúcar, queso, cuajada, huevos, bebidas, etc., fortalecerá su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y tener un negocio competitivo, espera que los clientes sigan prefiriendo sus productos para mantener su fuente de negocio funcionando.
María sueña con tener mejores ingresos para cancelar su deuda, darle a su familia alimentación, vestuario y educación de calidad.
texts.en: María lives with her husband and her two children, who are 15 and 12 years old. She owns a store. She offers basic goods and dairy products to her neighbors. She has more than 16 years of experience doing this, and she has no set schedule to serve her customers. She has no financial support from abroad. She will buy rice, sugar, cheese, curd, eggs, drinks, etc. to strengthen her business to serve her customers better and have a competitive business. She hopes that her customers continue preferring her products so she can keep her source of business running well. Maria dreams of having better earnings in order to pay off her debt, to give her family food, clothes and quality education.

loans.use: to buy rice, cheese, curd, eggs, drinks, etc. to strengthen her business to serve her customers better and have a competitive business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 53-year-old married woman with 6 children between the ages of 10 and 27; 5 attend school. 

She has owned a restaurant for 17 years. She will use the loan to buy  cassava and bananas to make food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In the future, she wishes to earn more and expand her business .

loans.use: to buy cassava and bananas.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a weaver from Mexico who specializes in Zapotec accessories. She would like to purchase bulk quantities of cotton.

Carmen has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story:

I was born in the weaving village of Teotitlan del Valle, I specialize in creating accessories on the traditional loom. My parents taught me how to weave when I was 15 years old, and the first piece I worked on was a rebozo shawl, which I gave to my mother as a Mother's Day gift.  I've been weaving since the 1980's, and in 2002 I started my own workshop where I specialize in shawls and bedspreads. The most challenging aspect of starting on my own was having a place where I could exhibit my creations.

I am very thankful and excited about this opportunity, as it will allow me to expand by business and share new creations with the world.

Use the link below to view Carmen's Zapotec woven cotton apparel and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8586">http://www.novica.com/kiva/8586

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of cotton

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a weaver from Mexico who specializes in hand-woven Zapotec rugs. He would like to purchase bulk quantities of wool.

Alfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

Alfredo says, "I was born in Oaxaca and, along with my brothers and sisters, I learned the handicrafts that my parents made. I was 12 when I created my first rug and I haven't stopped. I believe the art of weaving Zapotec rugs is unique."

"Many thanks, as this microcredit allows me to carry forward our traditions and continue making our dreams a reality."

Use the link below to view Alfredo's hand-woven Zapotec rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7961">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7961

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of wool.

loans.name: Wilmer Efren

texts.es: Wilmer de 36 años de edad es un joven emprendedor que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida. Él es muy trabajador, y desde hace varios años se gana la vida como promotor social de su municipio, actividad que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. Wilmer desea construir una galera en su vivienda la cual le permite tener un lugar agradable para descansar al llegar a su casa después de sus arduos días de trabajo, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento, arena y grava para construir una galera en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Wilmer, who is 36 years old, is an entrepreneurial young man who lives in his own house along with his life companion. He is very hard-working, and for a number of years he has earned a living as a community organizer in his township, an activity that allows him to bring sustenance to his family. 

Wilmer wants to build a gallery for his home, which will allow him to have a pleasant place to relax when he arrives at his home after his arduous workdays. It is for this that he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to build a gallery for his home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, cement, sand, and gravel to build a gallery for his home.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is a 27-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 2 and 7; 2 attend school. 

She has sold beer  for 8 years and will use the loan to buy more beer. In the future, she plans to make more profit and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is a 46-year-old married woman with 4 children  between the ages of 7 and 15; all attend school. 

She and her husband have farmed for 10 years.  She will use the loan to buy  beans and sorghum.  She will used the profits to  build a house. In the future, she hopes to make more profit and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Ana tiene 31 años de edad es soltera vive con sus padres en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Virgen de Guadalupe.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura solicita el credito para iniciar el negocio de la venta de legunbres en las comunidades, realizara las compras en Guaranda cada semana. Su sueño es culminar la carrera y empezar a laborar en alguna empresa, es su tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasearse.
texts.en: Ana is 31 years old. She is single. She lives with her parents in Echeandia in the province of Bolivar. She belongs to the communal bank Virgen de Guadalupe. She works in agriculture. She is applying for the loan to begin a business of selling legumes in the communities. She will make her purchases in Guaranda every week. Her dream is to finish her degree and begin to work in some business. In her free time she likes to go for walks.

loans.use: to begin a legume business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 24-year-old married woman with 2 children who are 2 and 6 years old; 1 attends school. 

She has sold beer for 6 years and will use the loan to buy beer. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In the future, she hopes to make more profit and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Thanasie

texts.en:
Athanase is a 56-year-old  married man with 6 children between the ages of 4 and 17; 5 attend school. 

He has sold local drinks made from sorghum for 4 years and his wife is a business woman. He will use the loan  to buy sorghum to make more local drinks ti sell.

loans.use: to buy sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in doors, windows, and labor to install doors and windows in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheets, beams, and pins to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Kayasi

texts.en:
Kayasi is 23 years old. He owns a shop and he has been in business for 3 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more sugar, Colgate, and salt to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house. In future, he would like to be a whole seller.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, Colgate, and salt to resell.

loans.name: Vivianne

texts.en:
Vivianne is 40 years old. She is married, with no children. She owns a shop and she has been in business for the past 10 years. Her husband is a business man. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more rice, salt, and sugar to resell. The profits from her business will be used to build a house and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice, salt, and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 57 years old. He is married with 8 children aged between 12 and 28 years old. 6 of them go to school. He owns a shop and he has been in business for the past 31 years.  His wife is a business woman. 

With this loan, he would like to buy more milk, cakes, and soda to resell. The profits from the business will be used to build his house. In future, he hopes to make more profit and raise his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more milk, cakes, and soda to resell.

loans.name: Yuli

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Yuli. Yuli lives in Cianjur, located in West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her only son. Yuli owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. She decided to join Ruma because she already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Her community sees her as an informative and kind mobile provider. As a woman, Yuli realized that she has to help her husband to increase their income.

As the business grows, Yuli needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Yuli’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Yuli is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Mahadev Group

texts.en: Farsara is a small village in the most remote pocket of Nuapada district in Odisha India.  Tikemani is an inhabitant of this village. The lady standing in the middle with raised hand in the photo is Tikemani. She is 33 and resides with her husband, son and daughter. Manual blacksmith work is the main source of income for Tikemani. This is her traditional work. She and her husband work for eight hours daily to repair and make agricultural tools like a share, hoe, axe, sickle, pixeshark, pick axe etc. From this work, she earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR. From this scanty income, Tikemani is managing her house. Due to this small income, she is not able to improve her living condition. So to overcome this situation, in March 2015 she formed a Self Help Group (SHG) comprised of 10 members and took a total loan of 140,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation. Looking at the coming agricultural season, from her loan of 16,000 INR, Tikemani is planning to purchase raw iron in bulk for making more quantities of shares, sickles and axes. She hopes that this investment will definitely fetch some more income for her. From her small savings, Tikemani hopes to construct a house and give a better life to her children. The other members of the group also do businesses like vegetable vending, tent house, tailoring and blacksmith work.

loans.use: To purchase raw iron for making agricultural tools like sickles and axes

loans.name: Deni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Deni. Deni lives in Cianjur, located in West Java, around 2 hours and 30 minutes from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his family. Deni owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Deni needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Deni’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Deni is the one who is standing in his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: N'tisse's Group

texts.fr: N’Tisse qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, et qui tient la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 8 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sikoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. N’Tisse, âgé de 68 ans, est le père de 13 enfants âgés de 8 à 37 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité N’Tisse à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 22 ans. N’Tisse cultive le maïs, l'arachide, le mil, les légumes, le coton sur sa parcelle mais il doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. N’Tisse entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison des formations et techniques agricoles. De plus, N’Tisse souligne l'impact positif qu'a eu dans le passé le système de paiement  dans son quotidien d'agriculteur. Cette année N’Tisse effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences hybrides  et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 1 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que N’Tisse cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. N’Tisse planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de diversifier ses cultures. Enfin N’Tisse espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en: N’Tisse, who is in the center in the photo, holding the myAgro pouch, is a member of a group of 8 farmers signed up with myAgro, all of whom live and work in Sokoro village, southeast of Bamako in Mali. N’Tisse, who is 68 years old, is the father of 13 children aged between 8 and 37, 3 of whom have been to school at this point. His family's tradition in farming, the principal source of revenue and food security for the household, is why he started to farm 22 years ago. N’Tisse grows corn, peanuts, millet, vegetables and cotton on his land, but faces challenges such as lack of rainfall and agricultural materials. N’Tisse is in his second year with myAgro, and signed up for a second year because of the agricultural trainings. Moreover, N’Tisse emphasizes the positive impact myAgro's payment system had on his life as a farmer. This year N’Tisse is making payments to purchase a packet of myAgro hybrid seeds and fertilizer in order to grow corn and increase his yield on his 1-hectare holding. It has now been more than 10 years since N’Tisse started growing corn for its profitability as a cash crop. N’Tisse plans, with the increased yield and revenue, to diversify his crops. In the end he hopes to also pay for his cihldren's weddings.

loans.use: to buy a packet of hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.fr: Mariam qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang au centre, et qui tient la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Darani au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Mariam, âgée de 44 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 4 à 19 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. Son marriage avec un agriculteur a incité Mariam à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 16 ans. Mariam cultive l'arachide, le maïs, les haricots sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et de matériels agricoles. Mariam entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des formations et techniques agricoles . Cette année Mariam effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 5 ans que Mariam cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Mariam planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter des bœufs et une charrue. Enfin, Mariam espère aussi pouvoir devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Mariam, who is in the photo in the first row, in the center, and who is holding the myAgro pouch, is a member of a group of 12 farmers signed up with myAgro, who liv and work in a village named Darani southeast of Bamako in Mali. Mariam, who is 44 years old, is the mother of 6 children who range in age from 4 to 19 years old, 5 of whom have attended school at this time. Marrying a farmer got Mariam started as a farmer over 16 years ago. Mariam grows peanuts, corn and beans on her land, but faces challenges as a farmer, such as the lack of access to quality fertilizer and agricultural materials. Mariam is in her first year with myAgro, and signed up in order to access agricultural trainings. This year Mariam is making payments to purchase a package of certified seed and fertilizer in order to grow peanuts and increase her yield on her .0625-hectare holding. It has now been more than 5 years since Mariam started growing peanuts for household consumption. She explains that peanuts are an immediate food source for her family, and can be used as a basic sauce in cooking. Mariam plans to use her increased production and revenue to purchase cows and a plow. Eventually, Mariam wants to become a large-scale livestock raiser.

loans.use: to purchase a package of certified seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Oumar's Group

texts.fr: Oumar qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à droite, et qui montre la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 10 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kombo au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Oumar, âgé de 28 ans, est le père de 4 enfants âgés de 4 à 17 ans, et dont l'1 d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Oumar à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 10 ans. Oumar cultive le maïs sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie. Oumar entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison des engrais de qualité. Cette année, Oumar effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences hybrides  et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 7 ans que Oumar cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Oumar planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter des animaux pour agrandir son troupeau d'éleveur. Enfin Oumar espère aussi pouvoir devenir un grand commerçant.
texts.en: Oumar, in the second row on the right in the photo, holding the myAgro pouch, is a member of a group of 10 farmers signed up with myAgro, living and working in Kombo village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Oumar, 28 years old, is the father of 4 children aged from 4 to 17 years old, 1 of whom is currently in school. His family's tradition in farming, which was the primary source of revenue and food for the household got Oumar started in farming more than 10 years ago. Oumar grows corn on his holding, faces challenges such as lack of rain in his work as a farmer. This year he is buying a package of hybrid seed and fertilizer for his .5-acre farm. It has now been more than 7 years since Oumar started to grow corn for its profitability as a cash crop. Oumar plans to purchase animals in order to increase his herd using the increased yield and profits from his farm. Eventually, Oumar would also like to become an important trader.

loans.use: to purchase a package of hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Nana's Group

texts.fr: Nana qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, et qui montre la pochette myAgro avec sourire, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Falani au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Nana, âgée de 39 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 7 à 19 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Nana à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 22 ans. Nana cultive l'arachide, le maïs, le mil, le sorgho, les haricots sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Nana entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des engrais de qualité  et du système de paiement. Cette année Nana effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 22 ans que Nana cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Nana planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter des bœufs et une charrue. Enfin Nana espère aussi pouvoir devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Nana is in the middle in the photo holding the myAgro pouch and smiling. She's a member of a group of 18 farmers signed up with myAgro, who live in Falani village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Nana is 39 years old and the mother of 5 children aged from 7 to 19 years, 5 of whom have been to school at this time. Her family's tradition in farming, which provided the family's primary source of revenue and food, is why Nana started farming more than 22 years ago. Nama grows peanuts, corn, millet, sorghum and beans on her holding but faces challenges such as the lack of rain and agricultural materials. Nana is in her first year as a myAgro farmer, and signed up to access quality fertilizers and because of the system of payment. this year Nana is making payments to purchase a package of myAgro seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts and increase her yield on her .0625-hectare holding. It has been 22  years since Nana began growing peanuts for their value as a food source, since they're immediately a source of food for the family, and used as a basic sauce in cooking. Nana plans, with her increased yield and revenue to purchase cows and a plow. In the end Nana wants to become an important livestock raiser.

loans.use: to buy a package of certified seed and feritlizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Lamine's Group

texts.fr: Lamine qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, et qui tient la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Darani au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Lamine, âgé de 38 ans, est le père de 6 enfants âgés de 1 à 22 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture comme activité génératrice de revenu complétant son travail principal d’agent de santé a incité Lamine à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 3 ans. Lamine cultive le maïs sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Lamine entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison des engrais de qualité  et du système de paiement. Cette année Lamine effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 3 ans que Lamine cultive le maïs pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Lamine planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter des bœufs et une charrue. Enfin Lamine espère aussi pouvoir devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en: Lamine, in the first row on the right in the photo, holding a myAgro pouch, is a member of a group of 7 farmers who have signed up with myAgro, who all live and work in Darani village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Lamine, who is 38 years old, is the father of 6 children ranging in age from 1 to 22 years old, 5 of whom have attended school at this time. Farming is an income-generating activity that compliments his work as a health agent; he began farming 3 years ago. Lamine grows corn on his land but faces challenges as a farmer, such as lack of rainfall and agricultural materials. Lamine is in his first year with myAgro, and joined in order to access quality fertilizer and because of the system of payment. This year Lamine is making payments to purchase a packet of myAgro seeds and fertilizer in order to grow corn in order to increase his yields on his .5-hectare holding. It has now been more than 3 years since Lamine started growing corn because it is a profitable crop on the market. Lamine plans to purchase cows with his increased revenue, as well as a plow. In the end Lamine hopes to become an important livestock raiser.

loans.use: to purchase certified seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Soungoura's Group

texts.fr: Soungoura qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang au centre, et qui porte le drapeau myAgro autour du cou, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Dara au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Soungoura, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 3 à 24 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Soungoura à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Soungoura cultive l'arachide, les légumes sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles. Soungoura entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Soungoura effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Soungoura cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Soungoura planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Soungoura espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en: Soungoura, who is in the photo in the first row in the center, wearing a myAgro flag around her neck, is a member of a group of 12 farmers signed up with myAgro, all of whom live and work in a village called Dara in Mali, southeast of Bamako. Soungoura, who is 40 years old, is the mother of 7 children aged between 3 and 24 years old, 6 of whom have attended school at this time. Her family's deep roots in agricultural practices, the principal source of revenue and food self-suficiency in the household are the reason Soungoura started this business now more than 20 years ago. Soungoura grows peanuts and vegetables on her farm, but faces challenges such as the lack of agricultural materials. Soungoura is in her first year with myAgro, and signed up in order to be able to increase her yields through myAgro's services. This year, Soungoura is making payments to purchase a package of certified seed and fertilizer to frow peanuts in order to increase her yields on her .125-hectare farm. It has now been more than 20 years since Soungoura started growing peanuts for their value as a food crop. She explains that peanuts are an immediate source of food for her family, and are used as a basic sauce in cooking, and also thanks to their commercial value. Peanuts are a food product that she sells in the market. Soungoura plans to increase the land that she cultivates with her increased yield and revenue. In the end, Soungoura also wants to pay for her children's weddings.

loans.use: to buy a packet of certified seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Mahamadou's Group

Mahamadou plans to diversify his crops using the increased yield and revenue from his crops.

loans.name: Kadia's Group

texts.fr: Kadia qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, et qui porte un foulard jaune avec sourire et tient le drapeau myAgro  entre les mains, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tomba au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Kadia, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 15 à 30 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Kadia à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 10 ans. Kadia cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque d'herbicides. Kadia entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Kadia effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Kadia cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Kadia planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de diversifier ses cultures (travailler sur le mais et le  sorgho) pour leurs avantages.
texts.en: Kadia is in the photo in the first row on the right and is wearing a yellow scarf with a smile, holding a myAgro flag in her hands. She is a member of a group of 18 farmers signed up with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Tomba southeast of Bamako in Mali. Kadia, who is 60 years old, is the mother of 8 children aged between 15 and 30 years old, 6 of whom attend school at this time. The family's tradition in farming, which provided for their needs and food security, is why she became a  farmer more than 10 years ago. Kadia grows peanuts and rice on her land but faces challenges such as the lack of pesticides. Kadia is in her first year with myAgro, and making payments to purchase a package of myAgro certified seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts in order to increase her yields on her .0625 hectare farm. It has now been more than 10 years since Kadia started growing peanuts for their value as a food crop since they can be immediately consumed by the family and serve as a basic sauce in cooking. Kadia plans to diversify her crops using the increased yield and revenue (she will work on corn and sorghum) since those crops have their advantages.

loans.use: to buy a package of certified seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Moussa's Group

texts.fr: Moussa, qui se trouve au deuxième rang, à l'extrême gauche sur la photo, est membre d'un groupe de 7 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Seguessona, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Moussa, qui est âgé de 46 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 32 personnes dont 18 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille . Il a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour réduction de l'espace exploitant. Pour sa deuxième année avec myAgro, Moussa a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champs de 0.25 hectare. A travers cet achat, Moussa espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements afin de pouvoir satisfaire sa famille.
texts.en: Moussa, who is in the second row on the far left in the photo, is a member of a group of 7 farmers who work and live in Seguessona village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Moussa, 46 years old, lives in a family composed of 32 people, 18 of whom are children. Farming allows him to provide for the nutritional needs of the whole family. He decided to sign up with myAgro in order to reduce the amount of land he is cultivating. During his second year with myAgro, he is purchasing a package of certified seeds and fertilizer to grow corn on his .25-hectare holding. With this purchase, Moussa hopes to increase his revenues in order to satisfy his family.

loans.use: to buy a seeds and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Bassa's Group

texts.fr: Bassa, qui se trouve au centre du deuxième rang,debout sur la photo, elle porte un foulard violet et un vêtement orangé, est membre d'un groupe de 9 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Seliban, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Bassa, qui est âgé de 35 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 15 personnes dont 6 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille . Elle a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour réduction du prix des engrais. Pour sa deuxième année avec myAgro, Bassa a acheté un paquet d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champs de 0.125 hectare. A travers cet achat, Bassa espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements afin de pouvoir acheter un bœuf.
texts.en: Bassa  is in the middle of the second row, standing up in the photo and wearing a purple scarf and orange tunic, is a member of a group of 9 farmers who work and live in Seliban village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Bassa, 35 years old, lives in a family of 15 people, 6 of whom are children. Farming allows her to provide for her whole family's food independence. She decided to sign up with myAgro in order to reduce the cost of fertilizer. For her second year with myAgro, she purchased a packet of fertilizer to grow peanuts on her .125-hectare holding. With this purchase, Bassa hopes to be able to increase her yield in order to be able to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a packet of seed and fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Bouroulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Broulaye,  au centre sur la photo et portant porte le  polo boutiquier, assis au beau milieu, est membre d'un groupe de 28 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Nani, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Broulaye, qui est âgé de 31 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 15 personnes. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille. Il a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour son système de paiement. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Broulaye  a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champ de 2 hectares. A travers cet achat, Broulaye espère pouvoir augmenter la taille de son champ d’1 ha afin de pouvoir assurer la santé familiale, les besoins alimentaires, l’élevage et l’alphabétisation.
L'Agent de terrain est présent sur la photo, il est debout au fond au centre.
texts.en: Broulaye, in the center of the photo in the green shirt, sitting right in the middle, is a member of a group of 28 agricultural producers who live and work in Nani village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Broulaye, who is 31 years old, lives in a family composed of 15 people. Farming allows him to provide food for his entire family. He decided to sign up for myAgro because of its payment system. For his first year with myAgro, Broulaye purchased a package of certified seed and fertlizer to grow corn on his field of 2 hectares. With this purchase, Broulaye hopes to increase the size of his cultivated area to by one hectare in order to be able to provide for his family's healthcare needs, food, livestock raising and school fees. The myAgro field agent is also in the photo, standing in the center in the back.

loans.use: to buy certified seed and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Koniba's Group

texts.fr: Koniba,  deuxième personne de droite à gauche sur la photo et portant un grand boubou bleu, est membre d'un groupe de 6 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Zelabougou, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Koniba, qui est âgé de 68 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 60 personnes et 40 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille. Il a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour maîtriser la nouvelle technique agricole. Pour sa deuxième année avec myAgro, Koniba a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champ de 1 hectare. A travers cet achat, Koniba espère pouvoir produire 50 sacs dans un hectare de mais afin de pouvoir prévoir l'année prochaine, apporter la joie dans la famille, et augmenter les membres de myAgro.
texts.en: Koniba, the second from the right in the photo wearing a big blue tunic, is a member of a 6-person farmer group who live and work in the Zelabougou village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Koniba, who is 68 years old, lives in a family of 60 people, 40 of whom are children. Agriculture allows him to provide food for his family. He decided to sign up with myAgro in order to master new agricultural techniques. For his second year with myAgro, Koniba purchased a packet of certified seeds and fertilizer to grow corn for his 1-hectare field. With this purchase, Koniba hopes to be able to produce 50 sacks on one hectare of corn in order to save for the year to come, bring joy to his family, and attract more members to myAgro.

loans.use: to buy certified seed and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Mumu

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Ahmad. Ahmad lives in Majalengka, located in a regency in West Java, about 5 hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his children. Ahmad owns a stall that sells small snacks and drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider.

As the business grows, Ahmad needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Ahmad’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Ahmad is the one who is standing in front of his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Chaka's Group

texts.fr: Chaka, qui se trouve au dernier rang, à l'extrême gauche sur la photo, il porte un vêtement noir avec une casquette sur la tête, est membre d'un groupe de 21 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Sanamba, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Chaka, qui est âgé de 52 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 10 personnes dont 7 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet de assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille . Il a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour plus de production. Pour sa deuxième année avec myAgro, Chaka a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champs de 0.125 hectare. A travers cet achat, Chaka espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements et pluviométrie afin de pouvoir acheter plus de matériel de travail .
texts.en: Chaka, who is in the last row on the far left in the photo, is wearing a black outfit with a hat on his head. He's a member of a group of 21 agricultural producers who work and live in Sanamba village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Chaka, who is 52 years old, lives in a family of 10 people, 7 of whom are children. Farming allows him to provide for his family's needs. He decided to sign up with myAgro in order to produce more. For his second year with myAgro, Chaka purchased a packet of certified seed and fertilizer to grow corn on his .125 hectare field. With this purchase he hopes to be able to increase his yield and rainfall in order to purchase more working materials.

loans.use: to buy a packet of certified seed and fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Flor Del Lago Santiago Group

texts.en:
Santiago Atitlán is the largest of the communities located on Lake Atitlan. There is a strong indigenous identity here and the townspeople, called “Atitecos” adhere to many Tz'utujil Maya traditions including their distinctive style of clothing. The women wear heavy emboidered blouses called “huipiles” with colored flowers and birds. A few older men still wear purple and white striped pants with emboidered birds and flowers as well.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Flor del Lago” or “Flower of the Lake” meets monthly with a Loan Officer to transact business on their loans and also to participate in educational trainings on a variety of useful topics.

The President of the Trust Bank is 41-year-old Julia who has eight children. She has a textile business and fabricates and sells traditional blouses or “huipiles” as well as colorful shirts and napkins. She has had the business for some years and expresses her appreciation to Kiva and Friendship Bridge for their support. Julia is quite pleased that she has been able to expand her business with the purchase of raw materials and looks forward to increased growth with a new loan. She would like to purchase basic supplies like various colors and textures of thread with the goal of offering various sizes and designs of her textiles to her customers. With her earnings, she is able to provide education for her children and shares with us that her oldest daughter attends university.

Little by little, the women of the “Flor del Lago” are moving ahead, generating more income and learning more about the world around them and within them. We look forward to reporting on their progress in our next report. Thank you, Kiva investors, for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies like various colors and textures of thread with the goal of offering various sizes and designs of her textiles to her customers.

loans.name: Anna's Group

texts.fr: Anna, qui se trouve sur la photo, assit à l'extrême droite, elle porte un t-shirt et foulard vert, est membre d'un groupe de 6 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Ferekoroba, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Anna, qui est âgé de 52 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 7 personnes dont 5 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille . Elle a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour les méthodes de travail. Pour sa deuxième année avec myAgro, Anna a acheté un paquet d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champs de 0.125 hectare. A travers cet achat, Anna espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements afin de pouvoir acheter les matériels agricoles.
texts.en: Anna, who is seated on the far right in the photo is holding a green t-shirt and wearing a green scarf, and is a member of a group of 6 farmers who work and live in Ferekoroba village southeast of Bamako in Mali. Anna, who is 52 years old, lives in a family of 7, 5 of whom are children. Farming allows her to see to her family's food needs. She decided to join myAgro to learn new working methods. For her second year with myAgro, Anna purchased a packet of fertilizer to grow peanuts on her .125-hectare holding. With this purchase, Anna hopes to be able to increase her yields in order to purchase agricultural materials.

loans.use: to buy a packet of fertilizer to grow peanuts

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata, qui se trouve au deuxième rang, à l'extrême gauche sur la photo, elle porte un t-shirt rose et tiens une pochette MyAgro, est membre d'un groupe de 11 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Diago, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali.
